lg.l: Heir followis ballatis of luve
Devydit in four pairtis The first
Ar songis of luve The secound are
Contemptis of luve And evill wemen
The thrid are contemptis of evill
fals vicius men And the fourt
Ar ballatis detesting of luve
And lichery

div.head: The fourt pairt of this buik

head.title: She hath such judgement both in tyme and mude

lg.l: She hath such judgement both in tyme and mude
That for to play wth hir wald do ȝow guid
And qn ye win hir heart bot theres the spight
yow cannot gett hir for to play alone
Bot play yor p[ar]t & she will play all night
And nixt day too or ells its ten till one
And run devoue wt yow in such sort
But never so far she will mak yow com short
Also she sent for me to come & play
Qlk I did take for ane exceiding grace
Bot she so tyred me or I went away
I wished I had bein in some vther place
She loved the tune far better than I did
And still she keiped tyme for heart & bluid
I loue my mistres & I loue to play
So she will let me play wth intermeasor
Bot qn she tyis me to it all the day
I hate and vgg hir greedie disposioqne
Let hir keip tyme as nature does requyre
And I will play as muche as she'll desyre

head.title: To the reidar

lg.l: Heir haif ȝe luvaris ballattis at ȝour will
How evir ȝour natur directit is vntill
Bot wald ȝe luve eftir my counsalling
Luve first ȝour god aboif all vder thing
Nixt as ȝour self ȝour nichtbur beir gud will
[etc]

head.title: Sonet

lg.l: Lyke as the littill emmet, haith hir gall
The sorie banestikkill haith hir fin we sie
The lawest treis hes cropis thot thay be small
The wran haith wingis with grittar fowlis to flie
Thair is ane drone sang also in the bie
allthocht I grant it may not mache the merle
Fflynt is ane stone althocht in to þe eie
It may not be so pretious as the perle
and mantua is not half so fair we sie
as royall rome ȝit thay ar both bot townis
and schellops saillis alsweill (^ with a dot above, two semi-legible words struck through) as schippis most hie
and pennyis passis alsweill as goldin crownis
Strypis hes stremes alsweill as fludes hes springis
So luve is luve in peure men as in kingis
[etc]

head.title: O foly hairt fetterit in fantesye

lg.l: Disputatio
O foly hairt fetterit in fantesye
wincust wt werry wardly wane plesance
Compone thy self and Lat þi sychin be
Think þat þis warld is all bot wariance
Tak nevir no thing in to remembrance
That may displeiss þi makar immortaill
Think quhat he sufferit and keip thyne observance
Remembir als þat thow man die but faill
Syche for no sorrow bot for þi syn allane
Greit for thi gilt thow ma get forgifnaiss
Sen of thy deid The day is incertane
Keip the ay clene fra cryme in every caiss
Thow hes no causs to tak sic haviness
Thairfoir be blyth or thow sall beir þe blame
Thow sychis so sair wt pane in every plaiss
That sickerly thow garris me think grit schame
Respontio cordis
I may not seiss bot syche I am sa sair
Thairfoir get vp and tak ane pen and wryt
And all þe cais I sall to the declair
off my peteouss and peroles pane p[er]fyt
I dreid me soir That thow be fund þe wyt
Than in a greif I grathit me to ryss
Quhen I sat doun and dresset me to dyt
Sychand full soir my hairt said on þis wyss
Ffair weill all ioy and walcum steidfastness
Evir mair wt me for to be mancipait
My hoip my haill is turnit in hawyness
Thair is no (mych, struck through) mirth my mynd may recetait
Sen that my lufe hes left me desolait
Quhilk I luvit best attour all erdly thing
Thair is not wyt in to þis warld I wait
That hes moir causs to syche quhen he suld sing
That lady leill of wirchep wes þe well
To quhome wes lent sic liberalitie
That now my wit exceidis for to tell
Amang all vþir scho wes ane a p[er] se
Curtass and kynd full of humilitie
Bayt gyd and grund of all gud gownance
Quhen I hard this I said alace lat be
Cast out of mynd sic wardlie wane plesance
not for hir scho wes ay wnkynd
Pensyt and prowd ryt fenȝeit and frawdolent
Cor Allacce lat be I wait I knaw hir mynd
The for to pleiss scho wes ay deligent
And sickerlie scho set all hir intent
To lufe þe best abouf all creatur
Thairfoir me think þat (mark, looks like ^) thow suld not repent
That chosin hes so trew a p[ar]ramour
To luve I wet it is bot naturall
till all mankynd in ȝoutheid specialie
Bot sen þat þow art cheif and principall
Grantit be god to gowirne thy bodie
Thow suld the set to serwe him Idently
And luf him best þat bocht þe (b, struck through) wt his blud
My hart remembir how deir he cowth by
Quhen he for the wes rent vpoun þe rud
Thy langege is to me Intollerabill
Thairfoir I will thow sobir þe and heir
I lat the wit I am not wariabill
Na nevir sall vnto my lady deir
I will hir luve qll I be brocht on beir
And mak hir serwice suthlie incertane
Reproif me not for I warne the but weir
War scho to luve I wald hir luve agane
Quhen of my hairt I hard þe fynall end
þat schort wald serwe þis foirsaid lady fre
I did wrang me thot for to contend
Bot I besocht to lat sic syching be
Syne to my hairt i haill confermit me
Ffor quhy I luve þat lady in a pairt
The quhilk wes flour of all faminitie
And thus endit my body with my hairt
finis [etc]

head.title: Be ȝe ane luvar

lg.l: Be ze ane luvar think ȝe notq ȝe suld
Be weill adwysit in ȝour gouerning
Be ȝe notq sa it will on ȝow be tauld
Bewar thairwith for dreid of misdemyng
Be notq a wreche nor skerche in ȝour spending
Be layth alway to do amis or schame
Be rewlit rytq and keip this doctring
Be secreit trew incressing of ȝour name
Be ȝe ane lear that is werst of all
Be ȝe ane tratlar that i hald als ewill
Be ȝe ane ianglar and ȝe fra vertew fall
Be nevir mair on to thir vicis thrall
Be now and ay the maistir of ȝour will
Be nevir he that lesing sall proclame
Be notq of langage qrq ȝe suld be still
Be secreit trew incressing of ȝour name
Be notq abasit for no wicket tung
Be notq sa set as i haif said ȝow heir
Be notq sa lerge vnto thir sawis sung be notq our prowd thinkand ȝe haif no peir
Be ȝe so wyis that vderis at ȝow leir
Be nevir he to sklander nor defame
Be of ȝorq lufe nor prechorq as a freir
Be secreit trew incressing of ȝorq name
Ffinis [etc] Dumbar

head.title: Off luve quhay lyikis to haif ioy or confort

lg.l: Off luve quhay lyikis to haif ioy or confort
ȝe man begin and leir this A B C
heireftir writtin quha will it ryt repoirt
First to be courtes wyis gentill and fre
Lairge honest gentill bayth secreit and preve
And of him self na vantour as i wene
Be sobir trew and every day luste
And quhair thow luvis se thow be senedill sene
Be not our hamely in to presenss
Nor ȝit our wanderand in to secreit wiss
Se all thy deidis be mixt wt plesance
And quhen thow maj prophir hir thy serwis
Paynit not thy wirdis se þt thow be not niss
Speik not in termis of clergy
Vse the to rewlis that may the weill suffis
And as i trest thair sall the few denny
My sone qll thow of ȝowthed hes þe flour
ȝarnand to be of luvis obserwans
Alswa cheis the a lusty paramour
Fulfillit of gudly gouirnance
Thow ȝarnand of hir to haif plesans
Wirk by this counsale that i the gif
Tak tent to this lair be ay leill to thi luf (and trew)
Gif that i sall the wis the narrest way
be not lang out of hir presens
Certis it is suth i hard men say
Is no thing hinderand moir than lang absens
be not of wirdis our grit perfluens
Nor ȝit of langage aw thair lest
In myddill way thi tung be ay nurest
Se for na thing that thow abasid be
in þe begynnyng thot scho wer nevir so nyss
On the first day and the kepar be sle
Ane castell is not ay win be geperdyss
Clayth is notq haldin at the first prys
I say for me lat ilk man say qt þai list
Quhay weill abidis is abill to speid best
Gif mony luvaris thi lady will persew
swa at þow leif not in Iolesy
Scho is the bettir swa that scho be trew
non wald hir luve war scho not womanly
repair not till hir ay oppinly
Bot in all tyme be reddy hir to pleis
Howbeit thi hairt thow think sumtyme at weis
Be not a vantour gif thow thinkis to speid
Ffor that is haittit of wemen at our all thing
harche not se thow haif no dreid
Gif thow hir luf thow man mak sum conking
Ffor harchenes dois grit hindering
howeit for luf þt þow wald almaist de
Bot reveling mone be first in the
Ffair weill sweit sone thow speidis ser now or nevir
Sen i haif teld the all haill my devys
do my counsale and fra it not dissevir
ffor and thow do certiss thow art not wyss
Leif hir not thot scho be nevir so he empryss
Bot ay be gudly to that gay
Turne thyne intent quhen that scho wrythis away
finis qȝ mersar

head.title: Luve preysis but comparesone

lg.l: Luve preysis but comparesone
Both gentill sempill generall
And of fre will gevis waresone
As fortoun chansis to befall
Ffor luve makis nobill ladeis thrall
To bassir men of birth and blud
So luve garris sobir wemen small
Get maistrice our grit men of gud
Fferme luve for fauour feir or feid
Of riche nor pur to speik suld spair
For luve to hienes hes no heid
Nor lychtleis lawlines ane air
Bot puttis all personis in compair
This prowerb planely for till preue
That men and wemen les and mair
Ar cumd of adame and of eue
So thot my lyking wer a leddy
And I no lord ȝit not þe less
Scho suld my serwyce find als reddy
As duke to duches docht him dres
Ffor as prowd princely luve expres
Is to haif souerenitie
So serwice cumis of sympilnes
And leilest lufe of law degre
So luvaris lair no leid suld lak
A lord to lufe a silly las
A leddy als for luf to tak
Ane proper page hir tyme to pas
Ffor quhy as bricht bene birneist bras
As siluer wrocht at all dewys
And als gud drinking out of glas
As gold thot gold gif grittar pryss
Suld i presome this sedull schaw
Or lat me langouris be lamentit
Na i effrey for feir and aw
Hir comlie heid be miscontenttit
I dar not preiss hir to presentit
ffor be scho wreth I will not wowit
Bot pleis hir prowdens to Impre[n]tit
Scho may persaue sum inglis throw it
Q scott
Sen that i am a presoneir
Till hir that farest is and best
I me commend fra ȝeir till ȝeir
In till hir bandoun for to rest
I govit on that gudliest
So lang to luk i tuk laseir
quhill I wes tane wtouttin test
And led furt as a presoneir
Hir sweit having and fresche bewte
Hes wondit me but swerd or lance
With hir to go commandit me
Ontill the castell of pennance
I said is this ȝour gouirnance
To tak men for thair luking heir
Bewty sayis ȝa ser perchance
ȝe be my ladeis presoneir
Thai had me bundin to the ȝet
Quhair strangenes had bene portar ay
And in deliuerit me thairat
And in thir termis can thai say
do wait and lat him not away
Quo strangnes vn to the porteir
Ontill my lady i dar lay
ȝe be to pure a presoneir
Thai kest me in a deip dungeoun
And fetterit me but lok or cheyne
The capitane hecht comparesone
To luke on me he thotq greit deyne
Thot I wes wo I durst not pleyne
Ffor he had fetterit mony affeir
Wt petous voce thus cuth I sene
Wo is a wofull presoneir
Langour wes weche vpoun the wall
That nevir sleipit bot evir wouke
Scorne wes bourdour in the hall
And oft on me his babill schuke
Lukand wt mony a dengerous luke
Quhat is he ȝone that methis ws neir
ȝe be to townage be this buke
To be my ladeis presoneir
Gud houp rownit in my eir
And bad me baldlie breve a bill
Wt lawliness he suld it beir
Wt fair serwice send it hir till
I wouk and wret hir all my will
ffair serwice fur wtouttin feir
Sayand till hir wt wirdis still
Haif pety of ȝour presoneir
Thane
lg.note: (Thane comes at the bottom of the page and leads into 214 verso)

lg.l: Than lawlines to petie went
And said till hir in termis schort
Lat we ȝone presoneir be schent
Will no man do to ws support
Gar lay ane sege vnto ȝone fort
Than petie said i sall appeir
Thot sayis I hecht coim I ourthort
I houp to lows the presoneir
Than to battell thai war arreyit all
and ay þe wawart kepit thot
Lust bur the benner to the wall
and bissines þe grit gyn brot
Skorne cryis out sayis wald ȝe ocht
Lust sayis we wald haif entre heir
Comparisone sayis þat is for not
ȝe will not wyn þe presoneir
Thai thairin schup for to defend
and thai þairfurt sailȝeit ane hour
Than bissines the grit gyn bend
Straik doun the top of the foir tour
Comparisone began to lour
and cryit furt I ȝow requeir
Soft and fair and do fawour
And tak to ȝow the presoneir
Thai fyrit the ȝettis deliuerly
wt faggottis wer grit and huge
And strangenes quhair that he did ly
Wes brint in to the porter
luge Lustely thay lakit bot a iuge
Sik straikis and stychling wes on steir
The semeliest wes maid assege
To quhome that he wes presoneir
Thrut skornes noss thai put a prik
This he wes banist and gat a blek
Comparisone wes erdit quik
And langour lap and brak his nek
Thai sailȝeit fast all the fek
Lust chasit my ladeis chalmirleir
Gud fame wes drownit in a sek
Thus ransonit thai the presoneir
Ffra sklandir hard lust had vndone
His ennemeis him aganis
Assemblit ane semely sort full sone
And rais and rowttit all the planis
His cusing in the court remanis
Bot ialous folkis and geangleiris
And fals invy that no thing lanis
Blew out on luvis presoneir
Syne
lg.note: (Syne comes at the bottom of the page and leads into 215 recto)

lg.l: Syne matremony that nobill king
Was grevit and gadderit ane grit ost
And all enermit wtout lesing
Chest sklander to the west se cost
Than wes he and his linege lost
And matremony withowttin weir
The band of freindschip hes indost
Betuix bewty and the presoneir
Be that of eild wes gud famis air
And cumyne to continwatioun
And to the court maid his repair
Quhair matremony than woir the crowne
He gat ane confirmatioun
All that his modir aucht but weir
And baid still as it wes resone
With bewty and the presoneir
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: the garmound of gud ladeis

lg.l: wald my gud lady lufe me best
And wirk eftir my will
I suld ane garmond gudliest
Gar mak hir body till
Off he honour suld be hir hud
Vpoun hir heid to weir
garneist wt gou[er]nance so gud
Na demyng suld hir deir
Hir sark suld be hir body nixt
Of chestetie so quhyt
Wt schame and dreid togidder mixt
Th same suld be p[er]fyt
Hir kirtill suld be of clene constance
Lasit wt lesum lufe
The mailzeis of continwance
For nevir to remvfe
Hir gown suld be of gudlines
Weill ribband wt renowne
Purfillit wt plesor in ilk place
furrit wt fyne fassoun
Hir belt suld be of benignitie
Abowt hir middill meit
Hir mantill of humilitie
To tholl bayt wind & weit
Hir hat suld be of fair having
and hir tepat of trewt
Hir patelet of gud pansing
hir hals ribbane of rewt
hir
lg.note: (hir comes at the bottom of the page and leads into 215 verso)

lg.l: hir slevis suld be of esperance
To keip hir fra dispair
Hir gluvis of gud gouirnance
To hyd hir fynzearis fair
Hir schone suld be of sickernes
In syne þat scho not slyd
Hir hois of honestie i ges
I suld for hir provyd
Wald scho put on this garmond gay
I durst sweir by my seill
That scho woir nevir grene nor gray
that set hir half so weill
Ffinis of þe garmont of gud ladeis q mr rot he[n]rysoun

head.title: Was not gud king salamon

lg.l: Was not gud king salamon (^ with dot above) reuisit in sindry wyiss
(^ with dot above) with every lufely paragon
glistering befoir his eis
Gif þis be trew, trew as it wass lady lady
Suld not I serwe ȝow allace my fair lady
Quhen paris wes Inamorit
of helena dame bewteis speir
Than venus first him promisit
To venter on and not for to feir
quhat sturdie stormes indurit he la la
To wyn hir lufe or it wald be my deir
Knaw ȝe not how troyelus
wanderit and lost his Ioy
wt faitis and fyveris mervalous
for cresseid fair þat dwelt in trow
Till petie plantit intill hir breist la la
Till sleip wt him and grant him rest my
I reid sumtyme how venterouss
Leander wes his luf to pleiss
quho swame þe watteris perralouss
of abedon thais surgane seis
Till cu[m] till hir þ[air]at scho lay la la
quhair he wes drownit by þe way, my
How say ȝe than be peramous
That promisit his luf forto meit
quho fand be fortoun m[er]valouss
ane bludy clayt befoir his feit
ffor tisbeis saik him self he slew la la
To pruve he wes ane luvar trew, my
Hercules for ectione
murderit ane monsteir fell
he pot him self in Iepordie
perrelus as þe story dois tell
reskewand hir vpoun þe schoir la la
or els be chance had deid þairfoir, my
Annaxerat þe bewtyfull
quhome kiphis did behold and se
wt sychis & sobbis petifull
That peragon lang wowit he
and quhene he culd not wtin hir so, la la
he went and he hangit him self for wo, my
Off all yir maiteris m[er]valus
gud ladeis ȝit I can tell ȝow moir
The goddis hes bene full amorus
As (off, struck through) Iupiter by lernit loir
twyis on þe day his chop thai schred, la la
To cum till alcumenois bed, my,
Gif bewty breidis sic blisfulnes
In amoring of god and man
Gud ladeis lat not wilfullnes
exuperat ȝour bewteis than
To slay þe hairt ȝe ȝeild and craif la la
ȝe grant thame ȝor gud willis to haif, my,
(Now, struck through)gif all yir wechtis of wirdines
Indiuorit sic panis to tak
(Unlegible word, struck through) wt wailȝeant deidis and sturdines
Inventering for þair ladeis saik
quhy suld not I pur sempill man la la
lawbor and serwe ȝow þe best þat I can my deir lady
Ffinis coloph q ane inglisma[n]

head.title: ffor to declair þe he magnificens

lg.l: ffor to declair þe he magnificens
and grit bountie þat in to ladeis Is
The wirdines and verteus excellense
The lawd þe brut þe bewty and þe bliss
My barbir tung is vnwirthy I wiss
Bot not þe les my pen I will apply
To say the suth thot eloquens I miss
off femenene þe fame to fortefie
Thot ald dotaris addressit þ[air] delyt
To dyt of ladeis defamatioun
wa wirthi wycht suld set his appetyt
To reid sic rollis of reprobatioun
Bot titar mak plane proclamatioun
To gaddir all sic bybillis besely
and in þe fyre mak þair locatioun
off famenyne þe fame to fortefie
For quho so list þe rycht for to reherss
To gloir humane þai mak habilitie
quhen men ar sad at þame solace þai serss
as habitaklis of all humilitie
Thai bring grit weiris to tranquilitie
Malis of me[n] þai meiss and pacefy
To saul and bodeis bayt vtilitie
Thairfoir all me[n] þair fame suld fortefie
Thot ane persone had paciable to spend
all myttis movit wtin þe mappamond
wanting weme[n]is weilfair wer at end
wtout þair confort cair suld him confound
Quhair ladeis abydis bliss dois ay abound
and quhair þai fle felicitie gois by
but (but, struck through) þair solace no sege ma be (found, obscured by ink smudge) found
Thairfoir all (illegible word, struck through) me[n] þair (fame, obscured by ink smudge) fame suld fortefy
Sen god hes grantit þame sic gudlinas
and formit þame eftir sa fyn fassioun
Syne put sa blumyng bewty in þair face
quhy suld not me[n] hald þame of he renown
Sene god hes gevin þame sa grit guerdoun
wt sic meiknes done þame magnifie
Quhi suld me[n] mak to þame co[m]paresone
Bot our allquhair þair fames to fortefie
Off mary myld þe maid Immaculat
To fortefie of famenene þe fame
Christ wes incarnat and incorporat
and nureist nyn monethis in hir wame
And eftir borne and bocht ws fra þe blame
of baliall þat brint ws bittirly
(and, struck through) That onlie act saivis þame all fra schame
and our allquhair þ[air] fame dois fortify
Ladeis þai ar of excelland valour
Ladeis ar ding to haif auctoritie
Ladeis ar clene of confortand cullour
Ladeis ar wyis and full of veritie
Ladeis ar chest and full (of, written above the line) cheritie
Ladeis ar menis parradice erdly
Ladeis ar plantit full of puritie
Thairfoir all me[n] þair fame suld fortefie
War all þe erd papir and perchmyne
and pe[n]nis wer all treis herbis and flouris
and all þe sternis in þe lift dois schyne
war in þis erd moist ornat oratouris
The se wer ink wt fresche fludis and schouris
all wer to small ane buk to edify
for to contene of ladeis the honouris
and factis þat þair fame dois fortefie
Ffinis q stewart

head.title: My hairt is lost onlie for lufe of one

lg.l: My hairt is lost onlie for lufe of one
ffoir laik of speche and all for schamefulness
I dar not speik my purpois to propone
Nor wat not how my purpois how till dress
Speik I to hir and scho be mairciless
And not do denȝe agane to speik to me
Than haif I tynt my speiking moir and less
onsped speche bettir vnspokin be
I dar not speik in dreid þat scho dispyt
my rurall termes and say I do bot raif
and speik I not vnto my lady quhyt
wtout speche hir luf I can not haif
bot gif I speik quhat can I of hir craif
I spair to speik for laik of eloquens
and scho but speche my synis cuth persaif
I wald not speik to hir magnificens
Ffayne wald I speik and speiking myt awaill
and scho for speiking wald speik to me agane
I spair to speik for spilling of my taill
Than I my speiking spendit hes in vane
To speik and speid not it is ane lestand pane
how sall I speik I dar not speik for dreid
Be it gud or evill to speik to me agane
ȝit sall I speik vnspokin can not speid
Quhat sall I speik sen I mon speik on forss
to hir þat is of speche most eloquent
I sall speik how þat my cairfull corss
Throw laik of speche is day and hour torment
Becaus I can not speik to hir my haill intent
for laik of speche and ornat termis plane
Beseikand hir wt speiking reuerent
That scho wald speik to confort me agane
Ffinis q

head.title: Quhen I think on my lady deir

lg.l: Quhen I think on my lady deir
War not gud hoip I wald be schent
Sic panis to me thair can appeir
That I not wait quhair I sall went
To bowne me þan our busk and bent
It is non but for all my beir
So am I (vexit, struck through) in myne entent
quhen I think on my lady deir
Than is þair non to confort me
quhen I am standand in that stage
Suppois I wer in point till de
Thair is not wrey in wardlie wrege
To rug me than out of þat rege
Than cumis gud hoip wt lachand cheir
and biddis me lat all sorrowis swage
Quhen I think on my lady deir
How sall I lat all sorowis sess
Gud hoip I pray þe tell me this
My lady may my corss incress
and all my hell turne vntill bliss
I may be mad quhen I hir miss
Suppois I wald þis is no weir
how my thow fra þis warld me wiss
Quhen I think on my lady deir
ȝit sall I wiss þe fra þis way
Sa thow tak heid vnto my lair
Gif þat thow luvis ane lady gay
Si thow be nevir in dispair
Suppois þat scho be nevir so fair
ȝit may þow fang hir to þi feir
Thairfoir be blyt bayt lait and air
Quhen thow thinkis on þi lady deir
Oft tyme hes bene hard and sene
ane loird hes luvit ane las full weill
and eik a laid ane lady scheyne
So luf of fortoun turnis hir quheill
suppois ane fre[m]mit fair thow feill
ȝit in hir serwice p[er]seveir
suppois ȝat scho be stif as steill
ȝit sall þow win þi lady deir
Gif þow luvis hir and scho not the
wt wisdome ȝit þow may hir win
Thot scho be cu[n]d of grit degre
and thow be cumin of sempill kin
Se in hir serwice þow not blin
bot ay be curtas to þat cleir
and sa þat gentrice be hir wtin
Sa sall thow win þi lady deir
Now to gud hoip I gif my hand
That I sall luf my lady best
quhair evir iO fair our se or land
my hairt wt hir sall evir (ink smudge) moir rest
Syne do to me as evir scho lest
for I am hiris qll I am heir
for in þat fre my fayt is fast
quhen I think on my lady deir
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: The bewty of hir amorus ene

lg.l: The bewty of hir amorus ene
quhen I behald my lady bricht
dois perss my hairt wt dairtis kene
I am so reft be luvis micht
rest man I not day nor nycht
my hairt is so in hir serwice
quhilk is þe verry lantrene lyt
off woma[n]heid ane flour delice
Scho is þe preclair portratour
fulfillit wt all lustiness
of puchritud þe fair figour
The mirror eik of all meikness
The verry stapill of steidfastness
off flurist fame þe strang pavice
Scho is þe gem of gentilness
off womanheid ane flour delice
Now sen I am hir seruitoure
and flurist in my ȝeiris grene
I trest I do to lang indure
That will not schaw my karis kene
This to my lady will I mene
That I so lufe wtout fantice
She is my souerene and serene
off womanheid þe flour delice
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Quhen flora had ourfret þe firth

lg.l: Quhen flora had ourfret þe firth
In may of every monet quene
quhen merle and maviss singis wt mirth
sueit melling in þe schawis schene
quhen all luvaris reiosit bene
and most desyrus of þair pray
I hard a lusty luvar mene
I luve bot I dar not assay
Strang ar þe panis I daylie prufe
bot ȝit wt pacience I sustene
I am so fetterit wt þe lufe
onlie of my lady schene
quhilk for hir bewty myt be quene
natour sa craftely alwey
hes done depaint þat sweit serene
quhome I luf I dar not assay
Scho is so bryt of hyd and hew
I lufe bot hir allone I wene
Is non hir luf þat may eschew
That blenkis of þat dulce amene
So cumly cleir at hir twa ene
That scho ma luvaris dois effrey
Than evir of grice did fair helene
quhom I luve I dar not assay
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: The well of vertew and flour of womanheid

lg.l: The well of vertew and flour of womanheid
and patrone vnto patiense
Lady of lawty bayt in word and deid
ryt sobir sweit full meik of eloquens
bayt gud and fair to ȝour magnificens
I me com[men]d as I haif done befoir
my sempill hairt for now and evir moir
ffor evir moir I sall ȝow serwice mak
syne of befoir in to my mynd I maid
Sen first I knew ȝour ladischip but lak
bewty ȝowth of womanheid ȝe had
wtouttin rest my hairt cowt not evad
thus am I ȝouris and evir sensyne hes bene
co[m]mandit be ȝor gudly twa fair ene
ȝour twa fair ene makis me oft syiss to sing
ȝour twa fair ene makis me to syche also
ȝour twa fair ene makis me grit conforting
ȝour twa fair ene is wyt of all my wo
ȝour twa fair ene may no ma[n] (loopy squiggle) keip þame fro
wtouttin rest þat gettis a sycht of þame
This of all vertew were ȝe now þe name
ȝe beir þe name of gentilnes of blud
ȝe beir þe name þat mony for ȝow deis
ȝe beir þe name ȝe ar bayth fair and gud
ȝe beir þe name þat faris þan ȝow seis
ȝe beir þe name fortoun and ȝe aggreis
ȝe beir þe name of landis of lenth and breid
The well of vertew and flour of woma[n]heid
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: To ȝow þat is þe harbre of my hairt

lg.l: To ȝow þat is þe harbre of my hairt
and creatour in quhome my confort lyis
Wufenȝeandlie wt hairtlie (wt hairtlie, struck through) lufe invvart
I me co[m]mend ten hundret thowsand syis
Beseikand ȝow in my maist humill wyis
ȝe wald disdane to vesy þis scripture
Direct fra me ȝour hummill seruitur
Quhilk luvis ȝow wtowttin variance
attour all leid þat levis or de may
and thot my body mak disseuerance
fra ȝow with ȝow (remanis, struck through) my hairt remanis ay
allace sweit hairt I wait not quhat I say
bot soir I dowt ȝe tak to littill cure
of my grit pyne þat is ȝour seruitour
I dwell in dolour quhill þe day be gone
and on þe nyt I tak na manar of rest
Bot to and fro lamenting myne allone
Thinkand on ȝow þe farest and þe best
maist womanlie and eik þe wirthiest
That is or wes formit be dame nature
allace do grace and saif ȝour seruiture
Allace grant grace,, ȝour seruiture to saif
Sen in ȝour face,, so grit grace dois appeir
delay not grace,, quhill I be gone to graif
Ffor fall þat cace,, I by ȝour grace to deir
I haif ȝour seruand bene þis mony ȝeir
ȝarnyng na fee,, Thairfoir to recure
bot onlie grace,, to saif ȝour seruiture
And thot ȝe will na m[er]cy of me haif
bot as ȝour bund in balis evir bynd
I dar weill say so christ my saull mott saif
ane trewar serwand sall ȝe nevir fynd
bot now allace trew men ar now left behynd
wt sorow slane and send to sapulture
As salbe sene on me ȝour seruiture
Heirfoir sueit hairt sum gudlie ansuering
of þis sedull I ȝow beseik to send
Quhilk of my cair may be sum conforting
and medecyne my melody to amend
wryt quhat ȝe will I sall it keip vnkend
ffull clois fra ony cristiane criature
Except my self ȝour faythfull seruiture
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Maist ameyn roseir gratious and resplendent

lg.l: Maist ameyn roseir gratious and resplendent
Excedand trew benyng and verteus
fragrant olif violat rubicumbent
to ma[n]s sycht is wondir gratiouss
hir beny[n]g luk wt blenkis amorus
persis my hairt þat soir I syche oft syis
Bot for remeid my wit can not devyiss
Hir cristall ene all forgit wt delyt
Surmonting topatioun a[n]namalit celicall
hir courtlie corss of portratour p[er]fyt
hes me becu[m]in hir seruand and hir thrall
Scho to my sycht is gudliest of all
That evir I saw fulfillit of grace
That (evir, struck through) I hir knew I Ioy and sayis allace
My wittis fyve ar vnsufficient
hir bewty brycht schortlie to declair
bayt hummill amiable and sobir of intent
Wyiss and discreit degest and debonair
off woma[n]heid and vertew exemplair
and gif hir gudnas may be comprehendit
be ma[n]is wit may na thing be amendit
Constant of wit excellent of bewtie
Exceding vþiris in hir gou[er]nance
woyd of all pryd full of humilitie
prudent of speche but vice or variance
my hairt is hirris wt all obseruans
a warld of wisdome appeiris in hir face
he is at eiss þat standis in hir grace
Christ sen scho knew,, so trew,, as I hir lufe
and syne wald rew,, adew,, all syt for ay
my hairt to play,, ilk day,, wer set abufe
fra hir behufe,, remvfe,, my wit away
sall nevir ane,, attane,, þe deth but weir
for war scho gane,, wer nane,, to me so deir
Ffinis [etc] q stewart

head.title: Ffresche fragrent flour of bewty souerane

lg.l: Ffresche fragrent flour of bewty souerane
my hummill seruice tak not in disdane
bot me accep to be ȝour seruiture
That in ȝour cur wt cair cotidiane
my spreit as thrall is fetterit to remane
þat but ȝour grace my life may not indur
ȝour sycht hes slane my corss wtout (cure, struck through) recure
but ȝour remeid my lawbor is in vane
That luvis ȝow best abuve all creature
And evir sall wtouttin fenȝeing
to quhome my hairt I send in gou[er]nying
wondit wt dreid abyding þe confort
of ȝow my luf maist bowsum and benyng
quhois cristall ene vnto my mynd rolling
reuellis my pane but solace or repoirt
ressaif to grace ȝour serwand I exhort
for and ȝe list to mak me conforting
all my diseiss war turnit in dispoirt
Moir amorus wes nevir erdlie wicht
be natur wrocht of plesand bewty bricht
quhome to behald ane hevin is of delyt
of womanheid þe mirror schynand lycht
quhilk is þe rute of my remembrance rycht
Ioyand my spreit þe verteus to indyt
of ȝow lady þe spectakle p[er]fyte
of all þis warld apperand to my sycht
I may not lest ȝour lufe and ȝe me nyt
Go littill bill and be my aduocat
onto my lady best modestiat
bid hir haif rewt vpoun hir luvar trew
and mak hir hairt wt m[er]cy mytigat
for in hir lufe I am so laqueat
That I may not enchenge hir for no new
I may forthink (two letters, crossed out and illegible) þat evir I hir knew
to me in mynd and scho be indurat
all erdlie Ioy for evir moir adew
Beseik þat schene wt hu[m]mill reuerence
The to ressaif and haif reme[m]brance
on me hir seruand subiect and hir thrall
That of my wo scho haif compacience
qlk nevir did hir falt nor ȝit offence
bot evir bowsum obeyand to hir call
In word and deid hes bene and evir moir sall
wt hairt and mynd and all obeysance
go þi for grace þow instantlie call
Say also to þat gudlie fair and fresche
of all my panis scho may me weill relesche
wt breif in bill or bodwart send agane
qlk myt releif me of my haviness
my plungit corss þat dalie in distress
þat on hir grace sall evir moir remane
þat m[er]ciles hir seruand be not slane
qlk and scho do hir fame sall evir decress
in hurt and hindering of hir gud name
Bot wo wer me þat it suld so betyd
þat scho þairthrow suld be cald ane homicyd
Thairfoir do grace and be not obstinat
wtout scho do scho will be notifyd
a ma[n]slaar and þairfoir ratefyd
bot o allace be not so indurat
wt m[er]cy mak ȝor malice mitigiat
I ask bot grace qlk not suld be denyd
for seruice done vnto ȝour hie estait
Adew fair weill,, my lustre lady sueit
Adew my seill,, and confort of my spreit
als trew as steill,, I salbe to ȝour grace
adew my ioy,, and paramour compleit
my hairt wt noy,, bot gif ȝe iust decreit
will me distroy,, throw amouris of ȝour face
Adew my hairt,, þe flour of lustinece
quhen we depairt,, wt sorow sone I meit
wt panis smart,, and sychis cald allace
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: O maistres myn till ȝow I me co[m]mend

lg.l: O maistres myn till ȝow I me co[m]mend
all haill my hairt Sen þat ȝe haif in cure
for but ȝour grace my lyfe is neir þe end
now lat me not in danger me endure
off lyiflyk lufe suppois I be sure
quhay wat na god may me sum succur send
Than for ȝour lufe quhy wald ȝe I forfure
o maistres myn till ȝow I me co[m]mend
The wynttir nyt ane hour I may not sleip
for thot of ȝow bot tu[m]land to and fro
me think ȝe ar in to my armys (two, struck through) sueit
and quhen I walkyn ȝe ar so far me fro
allace allace þan walky[n]nis my wo
Than wary I þe tyme þat I ȝow kend
war not gud hoip my hairt wald birst in two
o maistres myn till ȝow I me co[m]mend
Sen ȝe ar ane þat hes my hairt alhaill
wtout fenȝeing I may it not genstand
ȝe ar þe bontie bliss of all my baill
Bayt lyfe and deth standis in to ȝour hand
Sen þat I am sair bunding in ȝour band
That nyt or day I wait not quhair to wend
Lat me anis say þat I ȝour freindschip fand
o maistres myn till ȝow I me co[m]mend
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: In to my hairt emprentit is so soir

lg.l: In to my hairt emprentit is so soir
hir schap hir forme and eik hir seymliness
hir port hir cheir hir gudnas mair and mair
hir womanheid and eik hir gentilness
hir trewt hir fayt and also hir meikness
wt all verteouss iche set in his degre
Thair is no lak bot onlie pete
Hir sad demyng of will not variable
off louke benyng and rut of all plesans
and exampillair to all þat bene stable
discreit prudent of wisdome sufficie[n]s
mirror of wit grund of gud gou[er]nance
a warld of bewty compasit in hir face
quhois present luk did throt my hart glace
Quhat wondir is than thot I be wt dreid
Inly suppoysit for to askin grace
of hir þat is a quene of womanheid
ffor weill I wat þat in so he a place
I will not be in dispair in no caice
Bot suffir lawly thus þat I indure
Till scho of pietie tak me in hir cure
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Off lufe and trewt wt lang continwans

lg.l: Off lufe and trewt wt lang continwans
all may ȝe luvaris cum leir at me
That nevir a wicht had confort nor plesans
In warld to think nor ȝit behald wt E
In þat intent to turne fra hir bewty
That evir I had and hes my hairt compleit
sen first I saw þat womanlie and sweit
Nowþir for joy nor scherp aduersitie
nor for disdane dreid da[n]ger nor dispair
ffor lyfe for deth for wo for destany
ffor bliss for baill for (ink smudge, may be a crossed out letter) confort nor for (wo, struck through) cair
for chance of fortoun turna[n]d heir and þair
for hir sall nevir turne my plane hairt trew
Quhat I suffir of sorow auld or new
My faytfull (seruice, struck through) hairt returne fra hir sall nevir
vnto no vddir lady vpoun life
quhilk but ganekalling I gif hir for evir
wt haill consent of all my wittis fyfe
qll dethis rege vnto þe rut me ryfe
Thair sall no vthir in to þis warld but dreid
dep[ar]t me fra þe flour of woma[n]heid
Ffor weill I wet þat natur hes me wrocht
to wirschep hir, abone all erdlie wicht
and for þat caus hes in þis warld bene brocht
To be hir seruand fassit ay but slycht
hir fresche effeir and hevinlie bewty bricht
To c[on]sidder and for to discrif
(feill, in margin) and for to luf hir leill in all my life
Thot I suld de for trew lufe of þat wicht
I sall hir luf onlie wtowttin mo
That for to fle my hairt it hes not micht
bot wt þat wicht to byd and brist in wo
God grant þat I to graif befoir hir go
for of þis warld fra scho tak leif to fair
The joy of it fair weill for evir mair
The lord of luf I thank ane thowsand syis
my faytfull hairt hes set so sad and sound
vnto hir most fair most woma[n]lie & wyiss
That natur wrot in to þis warld so round
weill fair þat wicht ¥at gaif so sweit a sound
Thairwt sic plesans in to my hairt went
That I neir slane wes (and, struck through) wt my awin consent
The figurat dairt inve[n]nomit wt bliss
forgit wt lufe and fedderit wt delyt
wtowttin wame hes wondit me I wiss
The harme of quhilk will nevir moir be quyt
quhois grundin point vnto my hairt did wryt
In to my mynd evir in remenbrans
off lufe and trewt wt lang continwans
ffinis etc
Author unknown

head.title: Off every joy most Ioyfull joy it is

lg.l: Off every joy most Ioyfull joy it is
In leill luving ay (lufe, struck through) lestand life to leid
and of all sorrow most sorowfull sorow I wiss
off sueit amouris þe fellony and feid
wt dully dartis and dwa[m]mis war no deid
I say as one vnwirthy thot I be
That evir I luvit allace and welis me
I say allace þat evir I saw þat (roundish markings, likely ink) sycht
qr I haif set my hairt so foley soir
for to remoif (round marking, likely ink) frome þame I haif not mycht
bot in hir bandone lyis bundin moir and moir
bot weilis me I haif remeid þairfoir
on hir to louk and think on hir bewty
That evir I luvit allace and welis me
I say allace for sorow and for pane
That I am wtin danger and dispair
bot weillis me I haif remeid agane
my fayt is fest on ane bot gud and fair
of bontie bewtie þat is þe flour and air
qlk reft fra me myne hairt owt of myne E
That evir I luvit allace and weill is me
I say allace for joy and sorow bland
vmqle I syche and vmqle I sing
quhylome I sit and vþ[er] quhylis I stand
umquhill I lawche and quhill I weip and wring
quhyll hait quhyll cald þat lathis my luving
quhairfoir I haif resone to say p[er]de
That evir I luvit allace and weill is me
I say allace for dreid my lady be
wt on moir rik arreistit be þe renȝe
bot god of his grace gif I wer set & he
In feild to wyn and weld wtowttin fenȝe
and nevir þe les suppois scho not dedenȝe
on me to luk I sall hir luvar be
That evir I luvit allace & welus me
I say allace, for evir I waill in wo
nor of my wit quhen I sall fra hir wend
my wofull hairt neir will Dep[ar]te in two
for of my wo is nane can tell þe tend
bot weill is me quhen þt I fand hir frend
my hairt is blyth as ony fowll to fle
That evir I luvit allace & weill is me
Quhairfoir gud hoip I mak þe messingeir
Vnto my luve wtowttin jre or ill
Sen to þe lord of lufe thow art most deir
I þe beseik to beir my lufe þis bill
and pray to hir gif þat it be hir will
To grant me grace for hir benignitie
To leif allace and say bot weill is me
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: Bryt sterne of bewtie and well of lustines

lg.l: Bryt sterne of bewtie and well of lustines
Flour of honour and he nobilitie
Iem and grit jowell of wit and steidfastnes
renownit lady in liberaltie
our all þis land ȝe stand as a p[er] se
for bontie bewtie trewth and womanheid
springyth in ȝow as flouris in þe meid
Thairfoir I wait (þat, struck through) sen þat þe god aboif
hes formit ȝow so fair of hyd and hew
wald not ȝe suld luvit be and lufe
and m[er]cy haif vpoun ȝour seruand trew
quhairfoir sweit hairt of me haif rewth and rew
Louke quhat ȝe ask of god in ȝour preyer
And ȝald ȝour seruand in þe same maneir
Dreidfull dispair oft syis dois me schoir
and cursit dangeir my sillie hairt to slay
wicket wanhoip sayis I sall lufe no moir
Saif asperans, ffreindis I fynd no may
quhilk oftymes biddis me to ȝow say
haif m[er]cy lady and be not obstinat
for deth in schort ȝour serwand will chakmait
Bethink ȝow how þat holie scriptour sayth
quhai saikles slayis sall nevir moir se þe face
of god eterne or than wyiss clerkis leith
and sen þat ȝe ma lady wt ȝour grace
The lyfe or deth of me ȝour ma[n] purchace
O god forbeid þat evir so ȝow betyd
That ȝe suld be ane cursit homicyd
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Bayth gud and fair and womanlie

lg.l: Bayth gud and fair and womanlie
debonair steidfast wyiss and trew
Courtass hu[m]mill and lawlie
and grundit weill in all vertew
To quhois seruice I sall p[er]sew
wirchep wtout villony
and evir anone I salbe trew
bayt gud & fair & woma[n]lie
Honor for evir vnto þat fre
That natur formit hes so fair
In wirchep of hir fresche bewtie
To luvis court I will repair
To serue and lufe wtout dispair
forthy I wait hir most wirthy
ffor to be callit our allquhair
Bayth gud and fair & woma[n]ly
Sen þat I gif my hairt hir to
quhy wyt I hir of my mrnyng
Thot I be wo quhat wyt hes scho
quhat wald I moir of my sweit thing
That wait not of my wome[n]ting
quhen I hir se confort am I
hir fair effeir and fresch having
Is gud and fair and womanle
Thing in þis warld þat I best luf
my werry hairt and conforting
To quhois seruice I sall p[er]sew
quhill deid mak our dep[ar]ting
faytfull constant and bening
I salbe quhill þe lyfe is in me
and luf hir best attour all thing
Bayt gud and fair and womanlie
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Now in þis mirthfull tyme of may

lg.l: Now in þis mirthfull tyme of may
my dullit spreit for to reioss
I sall wt sobir mynd assay
gif I can ocht in metir gloss
Syn all þe poyntis of my purpoiss
in secreit wyiss salbe asselȝeit
how in my garth þair growis a roiss
wes fresche and fair and now is felȝeit
All winttir throt þis ross wes reid
and now in may it changis hew
Thairfoir I trow þat it be deid
and als þe stak þat it on grew
Suld I for plesour plant a new
na that I wow to god in plane
said it fair weill all flouris a dew
Bot gif þat roiss reuert agane
Ffor of all plesans to my syt
That grew on grund it beris þe (name, struck through) gre
my hairt wes on þat day and nyt
It wes so plesand for to se
now þair is nowdir erb nor tre
Sall grow wtin my garding mair
qll I get wit qt gart it de
This foirsaid flour þat wes so fair
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: My hairt is thrall begone me fro

lg.l: My hairt is thrall begone me fro
vnto þe gudliest vpoun lif
no windir is thot it be so
for no[n] may wt hir bewtie strif
Till hir I will nowdir c[om]pair maid nor wif
That leva[n]d is in to þis warld allane
hir to discrif surmo[n]tis my wittis fyfe
Aboif all vþ[er]is scho is my souerane
for to discrive hir bonteis all at schort
my barbir toung it is vnsufficient
and als my cu[n]ni[n]g can it not report
bot weill I wait vndir þe firmane[n]t
Is no compair to þat ross redolent
quhilk hes my hairt haill in to hir cure
and evir sall abid þair p[er]mane[n]t
Till I be closit in my sepulture
For weill I wait scho is þe gudliest
That evir formit wes be dame nature
aboif all vþ[er]is the most semliest
The mirrour of hewis and nurtour
The maist plesand patrone of portratour
a warld of bewtie compassid in hir face
and of woma[n]heid þe rich mirror
That I hir knew I joy and sayis allace
Hir ene þat is as beriall brycht
hes wondit me and mony hundret mo
fra hir to fle I haif nowdir strenth nor mycht
bot bound hir thrall quhiddir I will or no
allace thot scho becu[m]in is my fo
I sall hir seruand be my lyvis space
and nevir for to change for weill nor wo
Bot to await vpoun hir m[er]cy and grace
Hir hew is hevinlie to behold
moir meik wes nevir creature on life
wt hair bryt glitterand as þe gold
so standis scho in gre sup[er]latyfe
for quhois saik I suffir mony syfe
hir bewty in my mynd so prentit bene
and ȝit my sorrowis sall I nevir mycht
bot onlie to þat gudlie fair and schene
Bot god sen þat scho knew my constance
The fervent lufe vntill þat cu[m]lie cleir
I haif till hir wtowttin variance
quhill I almaist is bowne to my beir
and help in erd ma me no medisoneir
bot scho þat is most gudlie fair and wyiss
Thairfoir ȝour seruand saif and be not sueir
and m[er]cy haif on him þat m[er]cy cryiss
Now m[er]cy lady on my grevoiss pane
and lat me not daylie thus indure
and saif ȝour ma[n] erar than he be slane
Sen þat my lyif lyis haly in ȝour cure
or than to god ȝe do grit Injure
and sall accuss ȝow saules of my ded
and þairthrow schame sall evir mair indure
and grit lak vnto ȝour woma[n]hed
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Ma co[m]mendationis wt humilitie

lg.l: Ma co[m]mendationis wt humilitie
I send vnto hir faytfull womanheid
Than þair is dropis of wattir in Se
sternis in þe hevene flouris in þe meid
pleiss ȝe remembir quhen ȝe thir l[ett]res reid
That I am trew not (effer, struck through) fekill of efferis
dittand þir verss wt disconfort and dreid
mixand my (penstroke) ynk ay wt my bittir teris
Quhat windir is my hairt be granit thrwt
fro out þe rute rewthles ȝe haif it revin
ȝe haif þe ȝok wt me remanis þe slwche
To schaw ane schaddow quhair my hairt hes bene
allace þe rewling of ȝour wanttoun Ene
Thai war þe caus and gaif þe iugeme[n]t
Thus am I met and (quh, struck through) wat not quhome to mene
my corss is thrallit and my hairt is rent
War not reasone sen þat ȝe haif my hairt
ȝour gratious m[er]cy þat ȝe wald schaw
and gif me ȝouris owdir all or p[ar]te
and tak my hairtles corss and hald ȝow aw
o lord cupeid we wait þis is (ink splotch) þe law
(luf, in the margin) Sen ȝe ar (^ with a dot above) goddes and moder
rathir my secreit deidis ȝe wald knaw
de in ȝour grace nor leif and serss ane vþ[er]
How sall I do quhat sall I say allace
is no[n] bot ȝow þat may mak (ȝe, struck through) me remeid
I may not vdir bot do me in ȝor grace
sen in ȝor handis standis bayt lyfe and deid
fortoun allace quhy am I thus at feid
wt ane on quhome natur hes done hir cure
Thus standand daylie in þe poynt of deid
and m[er]ciles bene ay ȝour seruiture
Luf hes me wardit in ane park of pane
wt dolor is þe dowbill dykis dicht
and lust is foster wt his bow & flane
fro tre to tre he chaisss me in þe nycht
I weip I wring wes nevir ane veriar wicht
(thus, in margin) Thus nyt & day wt petouss wox I (and, struck through) cry
wes nevir ane vndir þe sonis lycht
mair patient sufferrit proctory
Wald ȝe send help sone wt ane speid of hop
and cast þe dyk of dolour to þe erd
wt lusty hairt than suld I gif ane loip
and cu[m] to ȝow I ken þe gait onsperd
my hairt is ȝor[is] full steidfastlie vnsteird
fetterit full fast qll ȝe mak it fre
I send till ȝow most farrest in þis erd
ma c[om]me[n]dationis wt humilitie
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: My sorufull pane and wo for to complene

lg.l: My sorufull pane and wo for to complene
my wit is waik bot I may not refrene
It for to tell vnto sum creature
Gif þat be me or ony vþir of mene
my souerane lady lest to dedene
To rew vpoun my wofull eventure
for sen I come in to þat cleiris cure
I haif bene trew wt all my hairt and mycht
And sall ay serue that bird of bewtie brycht
Sen þat first I fewty maid to lufe
and to þe king þ[ar]of þat sittis abufe
I haif bene trew vnto þat fair and fre
Thot it be scho þat revis me rest & rufe
my hairt fra hir ȝit sall I nevir remofe
but dreid vnto þe day þat I sall de
Thus sall scho haif all þat scho may of me
bot hairt body seruice and all þe laif
þat ony in erd may of hir serwand craif
Wald god þat wirthy wist my wo and pane
qlk gif I culd in wordis few and plane
I suld hir wryt þe causs of my distress
how for þat scheyne I am neir schent and slane
and nevir to joy lippy[n]nis to cu[m] agane
bot gif þat gudly schap hir to redress
my wofull hairt fulfillit of haviness
Thus am I boune and boundin to hir will
quhiþ[er] scho list to speid or ellis to spill
Quhome suld I serue but hir þat fair & fre
In all þis warld sen þair is nane bot sche
That may me cur of all my caris cald
and bot þat blyt me beit wmbet I be
and than be done my dulfull destine
Is went all wrang and no thing as I wald
Quhat may I do bot to þat heynd behald
and byd ay quhill þat blycht list to me bute
off all my wo quhilk is bayt crop and rute
All þe lang day I wy thus wofullest
and quhen þe nyt cu[m]is and tyme þat I suld rest
tha[n] wiss I deth moir than a thowsand syiss
Saya[n]d at anis hairt now suld thow brest
and not daly in thrang me thus to threst
I windir þat þow wirkis on þis wyiss
me think anewt it aucht þe to suffyiss
at anis to wirk þi crueltie and pane
Thot þow not new it eu[er]i day agane
And sen no pane no passioun na no pyne
ma bring agane þis sorrowfull hairt of myne
In sic a wyiss to leif þat I haif luvit
I will not laue quhiþ[er] scho be heir or hyne
I salbe fane to leif in luvis lyne
I war vnwyiss and vþ[er] I concuffit
To haif hir luve my hairt ȝit nevir remvfft
To hir to quhome I aw allegeance
Sen hirris I am wtowttin variance
Thus to conclud schortlie I say for me
That gudlie fair and fresche quhair evir scho be
I pray grit god to gif hir weill to sair
Thot I be sett thus gait in adu[er]sitie
In sorrowis seir and syching as ȝe se
I wald þat blyt of bliss wer nevir bair
That may me help qlk bot scho do but mair
fair weill my gud dayis bene ago
all thus I plene my sorrowfull pane and wo
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: O cupid king quhome to sall I complene

lg.l: O cupid king quhome to sall I complene
Or call for confort in þis cairfull cace
Sen quhair I luve I am not luvit agane
bot for my luve lathit I am allace
I will go mene ȝit on to my maistrece
as I haif done oftymes of befoir
for nane bot scho my gladnes may restoir
Allace lady how lang sall I indure
This dolour qlk throw ȝour danger I dre
Am i not he þat daylie dois my cure
ȝour trew subiect and seruitor to be
ȝour bound and thrall in maist hu[m]mill degre
asking agane na thing of ȝow þairfoir
bot ȝour gud will my glaidnes to restoir
On ȝour gud will I done lang depend
howbeit as ȝit I fynd no way to speid
and I am he þat nevir did offend
In wird nor werk aganis ȝour womanheid
That makis my hairt wtin my breist to bleid
Sen saikleslie I suffir all þis soir
and ȝe no way my glaidnes will restoir
And notþeles lady gif ȝe allege
That I to ȝow hes falit in ony p[ar]t
I grant þ[ar]wt ȝour barret to abbrege
and to remove þe ra[n]cour of ȝour hairt
thot I be clene crymeles in every art
I grant ane falt & m[er]cy dois Imploir
Of ȝor gudnes my glaidnes to restoir
ȝe knaw þair is twa kyndis of Ielusy
The first cu[m]is of lufis grit excess
quhairof I can not quyt me verraly
bot of þe nixt qlk is dispyt I gess
Sa god me saif as I haif bene p[ar]tless
Sen I ȝow luvit and salbe evirmoir
Thot ȝe list nevir my glaidnes to restoir
Go littill bill empty of eloquence
To hir þat is þe harbie of my hairt
Salut hir first wt hu[m]mill Reuerence
and schaw hir now my crewale panis smart
get me sum grace fra hir or thow dep[ar]te
or than adew my joy and erdly gloir
for nane bot scho my glaidnes may restoir
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Fair my hairt fair weill bayth freind and fo

lg.l: Fair (^ with a dot and [weill] above it) my hairt fair weill bayth freind and fo
ffair weill þe weill of sweitast madicyne
ffair weill my lufe bayt lyfe and deth also
ffair weill blytnes ffairweill sweit le[m]mane myne
ffair weill þe (cullour, struck through) flour of colour gud and fyne
That fadis not for weddir wen nor weit
no moir than in þe somer sessone sweit
How sall I do quhen I mon ȝow forgo
how sall I sing how sall I glaid than be
how sall i leif I luve ȝow and no mo
quhat sall I do how sall I confort me
how sall I than thir bittir panis dre
quhair now I haif als mekle as I may
of cairis cauld in syching eu[er]ilk day
Quhat sall I wryt in to þis petouss bill
Quhat sall I say for owttin awdiens
Quhat sall I dyt for to declair my will
Quhat sall I say as now to ȝour presens
I ȝow beseik wt all my diligens
Throw ȝor lustines & flour of woma[n]heid
anis for me This bill to se & reid
I can not say no moir in þis prolong
ffor I not wait gif it be profitable
ffor to declair ȝow all my panis strong
heir in to wret be word or be fabill
or gif it be to ȝow c[om]mendabill
Thairfoir as now this littill reme[m]brance
ȝe tak and keip in to ȝour gou[er]nance
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Allace depairting grund of wo

lg.l: Allace depairting grund of wo
Thow art of eu[er]ilk goy ane end
how suld I p[ar]te my lady fro
how suld I tak my leif to wend
Sen fals fortoun is not my frend
Bot evir castis me to keill
now sen I most no langir lend
I tak my leif aganis my will
Fairweill (^ with a dot and [fairweill] above it) my weilfair may
fairweill fegour most fresche of hew
fairweill þe saiffar of assay
fairweill þe hart of quhyt and blew
fairweill (^ with a dot above and [baith] in the margin) kynd curtass and trew
fairweill woma[n] withowttin ill
fair weill þe cu[m]liest þat evir I knew
I tak my leif aganis my will
Fairweill my rycht fair lady deir
fairweill most wyss and womanlie
fairweill my lufe fro ȝeir to ȝeir
fairweill thow beriall blycht of blie
fairweill leill lady liberall and fre
fairweill þat may me saif and spill
fow evir I fair go fair weill ȝe
I tak my leif aganis my will
Ffairweill fra me my gudly grace
fair weill þe well of wirdiness
fairweill my confort in eu[er]ilk place
fairweill þe hoip of steidfastness
ffairwell þe rute of my distress
ffair weill þe luffar trew and still
ffair weill þe nvreiss of gentilness
I tak my leif aganis my will
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: In may in a morni[n]g, I movit me one

lg.l: In may in a morni[n]g,, I movit me one
Throw a grene garding,, wt gravis begone
as leid wtout lyking,, but la[n]gour allone
for misheiss & mrni[n]g,, makand my mone
lg.note: (Curved line in the right margin beside last four lines, [but mo] to right of line)
lg.l: wt hairt als havy as stone
of covir confoirt had I none
as wy þat wist of na wone
bot wandret in wo
Ffor wo and wandreth I waik,, I weip and I wring
for on so myld wtout maik,, þat mais my murnyng
oft syss I syche for hir saik,, and sendill I sing
hir lillie lyre as þe laik,, dois me langing
lg.note: (Curved line in the right margin beside last four lines, [for lufe] to right of line)
lg.l: That brycht fra baill ma me bring
To kyth on me sum conforting
wald scho bethink þat sweit thing,, quhat panis I prufe
Thot pane but play be my pairt,, I preiss not to pleid
Sen I hir hecht all my hairt,, to steir and to leid
To chyd as a cowart,, I call no remeid
Sen scho wrot wreth Otwart,, I wallow as þe weid
lg.note: (Curved line in the right margin beside the last four lines, [In weir] to right of line)
lg.l: The fair þat forgis þis feid
may scho not sair rew þat reid
gif scho gravis me to deid
with doggit dangeir
Sall dengeir thus wt me deill,, is this hir decreit
for lang seruice and leill,, hir luvar forleit
Scho is þe hoip of my heill,, alhaill I beheit
To fend wt freindschipis feill,, To fall at hir feit
lg.note: (Curved line in the right margins beside the last four lines, [as thrall] to right of line)
lg.l: Quhat euir scho wone I wald weit
fro I be gravit in greit
Than hes scho seruandis þat (hir feit, struck through) ar sweit
the fewar at (hir, struck through) call
Thot I wer reddy to graif,, thinkis scho þat ganand
ȝit scho hes and sall haif,, my hairt in hir hand
quhith[er] scho schent or scho saif,, I am hir serwand
To leif hir leir our þe laif,, qll I am levand
lg.note: (Curved line in right margin beside last four lines, [But less] to right of line)
lg.l: I am so bunding in hir band
I wait no way to ganestand
Bot pray to þat plesand
of petie and pess
Off pety and pess I hir pray,, (r I, struck through) and plane I repent
gif I haif wrot ony way,, to wryth hir intent
Sen scho my mvrni[n]g meiss may,, wtin a moment
It war hir syn I dar say,, I suld thus be schent
lg.note: (Curved line in right margin beside last four lines, [saikless] to right of line)
lg.l: suld scho not dreid & dissent
to martir me Innocent
That fra hir will can not went
for deid nor distress
At hir will sall I wair,, my wit in þis plit
To lufe hir wirschep weill mair,, than wa[n]tone delyt
will scho hir ma[n] tha[n] forfair,, all wycht will hir wyt
bot scho cuvir me of cair,, my confort is quyt
lg.note: (Curved line in right margin beside last four lines, [for aye] to right of line)
lg.l: Evir quhair scho will I wryt
In hairtly plesans p[er]fyt
To quhome direct I this dyt
Ane morni[n]g of may
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: My wofull werd complene I may ryt soir

lg.l: My wofull werd complene I may ryt soir
Sen þat I do my labour in to vane
and eu[er]ilk day incresss moir and moir
To luf trewly and is not luvit agane
Quhat sall I say ryt awfull is my pane
Lufe thirlis my hairt bayt day and nyt so soir
I luve trewly and is not luvit agane
a loid of lufe lat it be so no moir
Quhen eu[er]ilk wyt in to þe nycht takis rest
I madlie mvrne and mviv me to & fro
and þat is for þe absens of my gest
I may hir ban allace quhy did scho so
I mene I plene qll the nyt is ago
Syn in my breist hir lusty lufe I closs
quhomefor þe dolor is þat I do so
I luve trewly and is not luvit alloss
Bot and I wist þat scho had trew knawlege
of my mvrni[n]g and my lamentatioun
and syne for þat tynt nothing of curage
nor of hir mynd haifand p[er]fectioun
To luve ane lusty and syn my lyfe vndone
gif I for hir suld thoill sic pvnist pane
Than war my mvrni[n]g all bot derisioun
and scho for me did thoill no thing agane
Bot weill I wait quhen þt scho knawis þe rycht
my panefull passioun dolerus and sair
Scho will me lufe abufe all erdly wycht
and confort me wt priue wirdis fair
So for hir lufe so lykly is to misfair
Bot reassone wald and pety in þis tyd
That my gudly seruice bayt lait and air
rewardit be all dangeir laid on syd
Ffinis
Author Unknown

head.title: Thus wairfull thot myne E hes wrot to wo

lg.l: Thus wairfull thot, myne E hes wrot to wo
and all my wit, hes knit wt þankis two
That I na may, away, in no kin wyiss
Throw sueit bewty, outthrow myne, e, but ho
And dengeir syn, þat dois me downe, also
Thus am I schent, gif I repent, to ryiss
and I rew for all my trew serwyiss
But heid of meid, That sweit and scho me slo
In quhois trest alhaill my lyking Lyiss
My soir regrait my E hes mait for euir
and I no can, as marrit man, dissiuer
nor quhois he (þat, struck through) to se þat wald not plene
for febill plyt ȝit cuth I nyt hir neuir
nor for no trust of luf nor lust to luuir
and for all þis I wiss will scho dedene
[etc]
Author Unknown

head.title: O wrechit infernall crewall element

lg.l: O wrechit infernall crewall element
depairting ground and rut of euery wo
weill aucht þir luvaris cry þat þow be schent
for till þair eiss thow bene eternall fo
and sen on neid thow makis me now to go
I tak my leif heir at my lady fre
how evir I fair fair hairt go fair weill ȝe
How suld I say go fair weill and tak my leif
allace þat wird inpersit throw my hairt
For but ȝour sycht on na wayis may I leif
my cairis ([queis] below, struck through) ar kene my panis ar scherp and smart
all suld me eiss Is travers turnit outwart
ȝit go fairweill qll eft I on ȝow se
how evir I fair fair hairt go fair weill ȝe
ȝour fair visage apairt and gudly cheyir
ȝour bewteis mustir and fyn continans
ȝour myld haifing ȝour woma[n]lie maneir
ȝour ene cumlie qlk bene all my plesans
So p[er]fyt hes bene in my hairt re[m]me[m]brans
I ma not leif and fra ȝour presens be
How evir I fair fair hairt go fair weill ȝe
And m[er]vell is þe p[ar]ting suld confuss
my wrechit hairt is set in sic distress
Sen I wes nevir in grace bot quyt refuss
wt ȝow my souerane lady and maistress
Than suld ȝour p[ar]ting be anis I gess
be verra kynd nocht lestand so wt me
How evir I fair fair hairt go fair weill ȝe
Go fair weill most desyrit lyvis so
A thowsand syiss go fair weill lady myne
Go fair weill erdlie joy for eu[er] mo
Go fair weill hairt and cure of medecyne
Go fair weill quha at no m[er]cy ma ryne
I can not say quhill courtlie I de
How evir I fair fair hairt go fair weill ȝe
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: Fflour of all fairheid,, gif I sall found þe fra

lg.l: Fflour of all fairheid,, gif I sall found þe fra
all ga[m]mis ar me queid,, so neir to grund I ga
I may no mirthis ma,, for sorrow my self I sla
Thus wirkis scho me wa,, þat wlonkast is in weid
That is bayth freind & fa,, and farest flour to feid
So fair wes nevir fygour,, no fame on flud so quhyt
So prop[er] of portratour,, sa p[ar]t no sa p[er]fyt
Hir lyre is lilly lyk,, plesand forowttin plyt
In bour is no so brycht,, beriall no blench flour
as is þat hendly hyt me[n]skyt wt all honour
I aw hir honour ay,, to serue hir bayth lait and air
wt all þe mirth I may,, for now and evir mair
The confort of my cair,, The saifir of my sair
quhair evir I found or fair,, scho is formest in fay
wt hir I wald I wair,, dura[n]d quhill domisday
Thair wes nevir day þat dew,, nor dyamont sa deir
na stane sa haill of hew,, as is þe hyd of heir
hir ene as cristall cleir,, wt luflie lawchand cheir
hir pawpis till perle ar peir,, p[er]fyt and poleist new
and I may nych hir neir,, Than gon wer neuer my glew
Vnglaid I gloir as gleid,, sen my gud luf was gone
for neir witless I weid,, I luf bot hir allone
That hes my hairt ichone,, als trew as turtill on stone
I luf bot hir allone,, of all þat levis on leid
Thus lykis me my leman,, þe flour of all fairheid
Ffinis [etc]

head.title: O maistres myld haif mynd on me

lg.l: O maistres myld haif mynd on me
Sen þat ȝor presoneir
and lat me not in dolour de
Sen ȝe may be my medicineir
ȝe may me saif frome all dengeir
and sett me at full libertie
owt of þis lyfe þat dois me deir
Thairfoir sueit hairt haif mynd on me
My mynd is plungit in distres
That day or nyt I may not rest
wtout ȝor help remedeles
my hairt is sair it may not lest
ffor every day I do bot de
(^ with a dot above) me think þat deid wer for me best
In dowbill pane sen I am drest
Thairfoir sueit hairt haif mynd on me
Thot I haif lost all my plesor
ȝit will I to ȝor mynd apply
on ȝow my hairt is fixit sur
and evir salbe ful faytfully
I dar not beir ȝow cu[m]pany
Ffor tratling tungis þat ay will le
Bot think on me ȝor luvar trew
my awin sueit hairt haif mynd on me
I pray ȝow be not variable
Bot think on me ȝor luvar trew
That is for ȝow sa lame[n]table
Sen to ȝor seruice I did p[er]sew
My Ioy agane ȝe may renew
do ȝe not swa I say for me
allace þe tyme þat I ȝow knew
Thairfoir sueit hairt haif mynd on me
This is ane endless pane allace
That haill luvaris suld be forlorne
as it is hapnit now þe caiss
it wer for bettir be vnborne
Ffor þan my Ioyis wer (loopy symbol) me beforne
quhilk I haif previt and will not be
That garris me syche bayt evin & morne
Thairfoir sueit hairt haif mynd on me
And thus fals fortoun is my fo
befoir to vþ[er]is as scho hes bene
Scho dois my hairt sic pane & wo
I say no moir I may besene
The blenkyne of hir bewtie schene
Sall gar me mvse qll þat I de
and sych full mony tymes betuene
Thairfoir sueit hairt haif mynd on me
Ffinis
Author Unknown

head.title: Haif hairt in hairt ȝe hairt of hairtis haill

lg.l: Haif hairt in hairt ȝe hairt of hairtis haill
Trewly sweit hairt ȝour hairt my hairt salhaif
Expell deir hairt my havy hairtis baill
Praying ȝow hairt quhilk hes my hairt in graif
Sen ȝe sweit hairt my hairt may (struck through word, unclear) sla & saif
Lat not deir hairt my leill hairt be forloir
lg.note: (marg) the ansueir heirof in the 235 leif (end of marg)
lg.l: Excelland hairt of every hairtis gloir
Glaid is my hairt wt ȝow sueit hairt to rest
And serue ȝow hairt wt hairtis observance
Sen ȝe ar hairt wt bayth our hairtis possest
My hairt is in ȝour hairtis gou[er]nance
do wt my hairt ȝour hairtis sweit plesance
Ffor is my hairt thrall ȝour hairt vntill
I haif no hairt contrair ȝor hairtis will
Sen ȝe haif hairt my faytfull hairt in cure
vphald þe hairt quhilk is ȝour hairtis awin
Gif my hairt be ȝour hairtis seruiture
how may ȝe thoill ȝour trew hairt be ourthrawin
Quhairfoir sweit hairt not suffer so be knawin
Bot ȝe be hairt my hairtis reiosing
as ȝe ar hairt of hairtis conforting
Ffinis the a[n]ser heirof is in þe ([clxij] struck through, [ccxxxv] written above) leif
Author Unknown

head.title: Wald my gud ladye that I luif

lg.l: 1 Wald my gud ladye that I luif
Luiff me best ffor ay
I suld gar (ink splotch) mak for hir behuif
ane garmond gude and gay
2 / Off vertew suld hir hude be (wrocht, cut off)
The garnising of grace
To gyde hir weill in deid a[n]d thocht
fra cryme in ony caiss
3 Poleist wt plesand portrator
wt diama[n]dis of discretioun
The chafrone sett wt fyne favor
and rubeis of rycht ressoun
4 ane targate of trewth hingand þ[ar]at
weill cuplit with constans
Off huimbilnes suld be hir hatt
Hir teppet of temperans
5 Hir sark suld be of sobirnes
weill sentit wt gude fame
The semis sewit wt sacreitnes
with nurtor and gude name
6 Hir collare suld be of considerans
quhair wisdome may be sene
Rubaint wt viche reme[m]brans
and beids of bountie betwene
7 Hir kirtill suld be of compacie[n]ce
off þe puir to have pietie
weill watit with benevolence
Lynit with liberalitie
8 Mailȝeit wt maneris and mesor
weill lasit with luifsu[m]nes
Toukit wt trew luif the tresor
Hir stomok of stedfastnes
9 Hir goun suld be of all guidnes
Begareit wt fresche bewtie
Knit wt rubanis of richtuusnes
and prfewit wt prosperitie
10 Hir slewis suld be of sueit s[em]blans
vanit wt woma[n]lie maneir
weill cuffit wt continewa[n]ce
In vertew and wit but weir
(Ink splotch) 11 Hir paitlat suld be of hie prude[n]ce
weill furrit wt fair affere
wt peirlit prenis of pacie[n]ce
for hir wirschop to weir
2ii Hir belt suld be of bowsu[m]nes
meit to hir middill small
Baith heid and pendes wt hartlines
Ine[m]mellit weill wt all
23 Hir chemȝe suld be of chaistetie
about hir halss so quhyte
Hir halss peirlis of pudicitie
rycht plesand and p[er]fyte
24 Hir cloik suld be of clene consciens
weill lynit wt lawlines
denudit of all neglige[n]ce
and borderit weill wt besines
25 (illegible writing, struck through) Off grene ȝout suld hir gluiffis be
ffor hir fair fingaris quhyte
kervit wt kyndnes but creweltye
our ringis of delyte
29 Hir hoiss of honest hamelines
na proudnes to pretend
Hir pa[n]tonis of persewerans
In honor till hir end
This haif I cled my luif ryt weill
Na weid will cum hir better
Nor this garmond sa haif I seill
Nor halff so weill will sett hir
ffinis
Author unknown([Ffinis] in right margin)

head.title: Support ȝour seruand peirles paramour

lg.l: Support ȝour seruand peirles paramour
or dreidfull deth and dolour me devoir
Sen þair is nan may schaw no succour
to my pur hairt oursett wt siching soir
Allace allace sueit desy most decoir
Will ȝe not help me of my heviness
Sen of my hairt ȝe ar þe cheif maistress
(Right column) The arting of ȝour eine angelicall
So spedely my spreit hes perforate
vnto my hairt and causd it to be thrall
(to, cut off) ȝow þe flour of woma[n]heid I wate
(Quhairfoir, cut off) I pray ȝour he excelle[n]t estate
(To, cut off) kyth on me sum confort in þis caiss
Sen of my hairt ȝe ar þe cheif maistress
(Left column) Thair wes nevir in to no woma[n] wroch
Bot planelie in to ȝour p[er]sone dois appeir
Except petie and thot I find it not
dame esperans helpis me out of weir
That scho & lady m[er]cy both in feir
Sall in ȝour hairt graif bayt pety & (grace, cut off)
Sen of my hairt ȝe ar þe cheif (maistress, cut off)

head.title: Quhen tayis bank wes blumyt bryt

lg.l: (Right column begins) Quhen tayis bank wes blumyt bryt (Line going down 9 lines begins here) wt blosomes blyt and bred
be þat rever ran I doun rycht
Vndir þe ryss I red
The merle melit wt all hir mycht
And mirth in morny[n]g maid
Throw solace sound and semely sicht
alswth a sang I said
Vndir þat bank quhair bliss had bene
I bownit me to abyde
ane holene hevinly hewit grene
ryt heyndly did me hyd
The sone schyne our þe schawis schene
full semely me besyd
In bed of blumes bricht besene
A sleip cowt me ourslyd
About all blomet wes my bour
wt blosu[m]mes broun and blew
orfret wt mony fair fresch flour
helsum of hevinly hew
wt schakeris of þe schene dew schor (&, struck through)
schy[n]nyng my courtenis schew
arrayit wt a rich vardour
of natoris werkis new
Rasing þe birdis fra þ[ar] rest
The reid sone raiss wt rawis
The lark sang lowd qll lyt mycht lest
A lay of luvis lawis
The nythingall woik of hir nest
Singing þe day vpdawis
The mirthfull maveiss m[er]riest
Schill schowttit throw þe schawis
All flouris grew þat firth wtin
þat ma[n] cowth haif in mynd
and in þat flud all fische wt fyn
þat creat wer be kynd
vndir þe rise þe ra did ryn
our ron our rute our rynd
The dvn deir dansit wt a dyn
& herdis of hairt & hynd
Wod winter with his wallowa[n]d wynd
but weir away wes went
brasit about wt wyld wodbynd
Wer bewis on þe bent
allone vnder þe lusty lynd
I saw ane lusum lent
That fairly war so fare to fynd
vndir þe firmame[n]t
Scho wes þe lustiest (of lyfe, struck through) on lyfe
allone lent on a land
and farest figour be sic syve
That evir in firth I fand (end right column)
(Left column begins) Hir cumly cullour to discryve
I dar not tak on ha[n]d
moir woma[n]ly borne of a wyfe
wes neu[er] I dar warrand
To creatur þat wes in cair
or cauld of crewelty
a blicht blenk of hir vesage bair
of baill his bute mycht be
hir hyd hir hew hir hevinly hair
myt havy hairtis vphie
so angelik vndir þe air
neuir wicht I saw wt E
The blosummes þat wer blyt & brycht
by hir wer blacht & blew
Scho gladit all þe foull of flicht
That in þe forrest flew
Scho myt haif co[m]fort king or knyt
That eu[er] In cuntre I knew
as waill and well of warldly wicht
In woma[n]ly vertew
Hir cullour cleir hir countina[n]ce
hir cumly cristall ene
hir portratour of most plesance
all pictour did prevene
off every vertew to avance
quhe[n] ladeis prasit bene
ryttest in my re[m]me[m]brance
That rose is rutit grene
This myld meik ma[n]suet m[ar]grite
This perle polist most quhyt
dame natoris deir dochter discreit
The dyama[n]t of delyt
neu[er] formit wes to found on feit
ane figour moir p[er]fyte
nor non on mold þat did hir meit
mycht mend hir wirth a myte
This myrthfull maid to meit I me[n]t
and m[er]kit furt (þe, struck through) on mold
bot sone wtin a wane scho went
most hevinly to behold
The bricht sone wt his bemys blent
vpoun þe bertis bold
farest vnder þe firmame[n]t
That formit wes on fold
As p[ar]radice þat place but peir
wes plesand to my sicht
of forrest and of fresch reveir
of firth and fowll of flicht
of birds bay on bonk & breir
wt blumes brekand bricht
as hevin in to þis erd doun heir
hertis to hald on hicht
So went þis woma[n]ly away
amang þir wodds wyd
and I to heir þir birds gay
did in a bonk abyd (left column ends)
(Right column begins) quhair ron & ryss raiss in aray
Endlang þe reu[er] syd
This hapnit me in a tyme in may
In till a morni[n]g tyd
The rever throw þe ryse cowt rowt
and roseris raiss on raw
The schene birds full schill cowt schowt
Into þat semly schaw
Ioy wes wtin & Ioy wtout
Vnder that vnlonkest waw
qr tay ra[n] doun wt stremis stout
full strecht vnd[er] stobschaw
Ffinis

head.title: O lusty may wt flora quene

lg.l: O lusty may wt flora quene
The balmy dropis frome phebus schene
prelucia[n]d bemes befoir þe day
be þat diana growis grene
Throwch glaidnes of þis lusty may
Than esperus that is so bricht
Till wofull hairtis castis his lyt
wt bankis that blumes (on euery bray, bis,,
and schuris ar sched furt of þ[ar] sicht
Thruch glaidnes of this lusty may
Birdis on bewis of every birth
Reiosing nottis mak and thair mirth
ryt plesandly vpoun the spray
wt fflurissingis our feild & firth
Thruch [etc]
All luvaris þat ar in cair
To thair ladeis thay do repair
In fresch mornyngis (befoir the day
and ar in mirth ay mair & mair
Thruch glaidnes of this lusty may
Ffinis

head.title: all ffor ane is my mane

lg.l: all ffor ane,, is my mane,,
Bot ane I can lufe
War scho gane,, Than war nane
my name to remufe
That I am tane,, wt sic ane,,
I thank god abufe
and bot þat ane,, will I nane,,
Quhat panis I prufe
Ffinis
lg.note: (right column ends)

head.title: Be glaid alȝe þat luvaris bene

lg.note: (Left column begins)
lg.l: Be glaid alȝe þat luvaris bene
ffor now hes may depaynt wt grene
The hillis valis and þe medis
and flouris lustely vpspreidis
awalk out of ȝor sluggairdy
To heir þe birdis melody
quhois suggourit nottis loud & cleir
Is now ane parradice to heir
Go walk vpoun sum rever fair
Go tak þe fresch and holsum air
Go luke vpoun þe flurist fell
Go feill þe herbis plesand smell
quhilk will ȝor comfort gar (incres, cut off)
and all avoyd ȝour havines
The new cled purpor hevin aspy
(h, blotted out) behald þe lark now in þe sky
wt besy wyng scho cly[m]is on hicht
ffor grit joy of þe dayis licht
Behald þe verdor fresch of hew
powdderit wt grene quhyt & blew
quhairwt dame flora in þis may
dois richely all þe feild array
and how aurora wt visage pale
Inbalmes wt hir cristall hale
The grene and tendir pylis ȝing
of every gress þat dois vpspryng
and wt hir beriall droppis bricht
makis þe gresys gleme of (licht, cut off)
Luk on þe saufir firmame[n]t
and on þe a[n]na[m]mellit orie[n]t
Luke or phebus put vp his heid
as he dois raiss his baneris reid
he dois þe eist so bricht attyre
That all semis birny[n]g in a (fyre, cut off)
Quhilk co[m]fort dois to every thing
ma[n] bird beist & flurissing
qrfar luvaris be glaid & lycht
for schort is ȝor havy nycht
and lenthit is ȝor myrry day
Thairfoir ȝe velcu[m] new þis (day, struck through) (may, cut off)
and birdis do ȝor haill plesance
wt merry song & obseruance
This may to velcum at ȝor (mycht, cut off)
at fresch phebus vprysing bricht
and all þe floris þat dois spreid
lay furt ȝor levis vpoun breid
& welcu[m] may wt beny[n]g cheir
þe quene of euery moneth cleir
and eu[er]ry ma[n] tha[n]k in his mynd
The god of natur & of kynd
qlk ordanit all for or behufe
The erd vndir The air abufe
bird, beist, flour, tyme day & nyt
The planeitis for to gif ws licht
Ffinis
(Author unknown [etc], cut off)

lg.note: (left column ends)

head.title: Gif ȝe wald lufe and luvit be

lg.l: Gif ȝe wald lufe and luvit be
In mynd keip weill thir thingis thre
and sadly in thy breist imprent
Be secreit (trew, struck though) trew and pacient
ffor he þat pacience can not leir
he sall displesance haif p[er]queir
Thot he had all þis warldis re[n]t
Be secreit trew and pacie[n]t
ffor quha þat secreit can not be
him all gud falloschip sall fle
and credence nane sall him be lent
Be secreit trew and pacient
and he þat is of hairt vntrew
ffra he be kend fair weill adew
ffy on him fy his fame is went
Be secreit trew and pacie[n]t
Thus he þat wantis ane of thir thre
ane luvar glaid may neuir be
bot ay in sumthing discontent
Be secreit trew and pacie[n]t
Not wt þi toung thy self discure
The thingis þat thow hes of nature
ffor gif thow dois tho suld repent
Be secreit trew and pacie[n]t
Ffinis

head.title: The song of troyelus

lg.l: Gife no luve is, o god quhat feill I so
and gif luve is, quhat thing and quhiche is he
Gife luve be gud, frome quhence cummys my wo
Gife it be wicke, A wondir thinketh me
quhan eu[er]ry turme[n]t and aduersite
That cu[m]meth of him, may (^ with a dot above, [to me] above) sauery, (to me, struck through) (be, struck through) think
ffor ay thrust I the more, That iche it drink
And gif þat at myne awin lust I brenne
ffrome whench cu[m]mys my waling and my playnt
Gife harme agreve me, quhairto plene I thane
I not, ne quhy, vnwery þat I faynt
o quyck deth o sueit harme so queynt
how may of the in me be suche quantete
Bot gif þat I co[n]sent (mark) þat it so be
And gif I consent, I wrongfully (co[m]plene, struck through)
co[m]plene ywis, Thus possed to and fro
all steirles wtin a bot am I
amyd the se atuixin wondis two
That inco[n]trair standen euer mo
allas quhat is this wondir maledye
ffor heit of cold ffor cold of heit I dye

lg.note: (And to the god of luve thus said he, struck through)
lg.l: And to þe god of luve thus said he
wt pitous voce o lord no ȝouris is
my spreit quhiche þat aucht ȝouris be
ȝow thank I lord ȝat haif me brot to this
Bot quhithir goddess or woma[n] (or, struck through) ywiss
Scho be, I not wiche, þat ȝe do me serue
Bot as hir ma[n] I woll ay leue & serue
ȝe standyn in hir ene mychtely
as in a place to ȝour vertew digne
quhairfoir lord gife my seruice or I
may lykin ȝow, to be to me benigne
for my estait royell heir I resigne
in to hir hand and wt hu[m]mill cheir
Becoim hir ma[n] as to my lady deir
q chauseir of troyelus

head.title: As phebus bricht in speir merediane

lg.l: As phebus bricht in speir merediane
E of the warld and lamp Etheriall
passis þe licht that cleipit is dyane
Quhen scho is lucent round as ony ball
and lucifair all vþ[er] sternis small
my lady so in bewty dois abound
aboif all vþir ladeis on þe ground
Hir hair displayit a þe goldin wyre
aboif hir heid wt bemys radient
Is lyk ane buss þat birnys in þe fyre
wt fla[m]mys reid but fumys Elevant
war not scho is sum thing to varia[n]t
I mycht of ressone san þat dame nature
fformit nevir in erd so fair a creature
My hairt þat nevir wes thirlit vnto wicht
In deidly dwalmys sow pit is for evir
ffor luve of hir þat is my lady bricht
quhois plesant hals is quhytt[er] tha[n] the (rever Evir, struck through)
or snaw but spot þat fallis in þe revir
The fragra[n]t balme of odour co[m]fortatyve
may not for sueitness wt hir lippis stryve
Thow drery gost þat dwy[n]nis in dispair
pass wt this bill vnto my lady sueit
and in to presense of hir visage fair
vpone thy kneis thow fall befoir hir feit
askand hir m[er]cy wt thys cherkis weit
To co[m]fort me of my woundis smert
Quhome dart of luve hess persit throw the hert
Sen athroposs my fatell threid hes worne
In pleny[n]g soir and rewthfull wome[n]ting
And þat asperans is non vnto þe morne
of my pure hairt dyand in lang vysing
Thow bury my corps but ony tareing
ffor acteon wes slatit at þe well
Be wreth of dyane wt his awin hounds fell
O thunderane boir in thy most awfull rege
Quhy will thow not me wt thy tuskis ryve
Sen no thing may my grevouss pane assuage
bot scho quhilk is the revar of my lyve
wt sichis soir and cairis pungetyve
Quhairthrow my blude resoluit is in teiris
and ȝit no rewth in to hir hairt appeiris
God gife it wer my fatell aventure
To fecht aganis hir fayis to þe deid
wt speir and scheild and all þat I micht fure
To pruve hir flour and well of woma[n]heid
howbeit it wer not to my lyfe remeid
It wald me suffyiss sen þat scho hes no maik
Till end my lyfe in battell for hir saik
ȝit I beseik hir for þe grit delyte
That semyt in hir bewty naturall
wt rewtfull presens of hir visage quhyt
Scho wald decoir my feistis funerall
That luvaris mycht espy in generall
Gife þat hir ene for weping myt indure
To luk vpoun my rewtfull sepulture
Ffinis q bannatyne

head.title: My hairt is heich aboif, my body is full of bliss

lg.l: My hairt is heich aboif,, my body is full of bliss
ffor I am sett in lufe,, Als weill as I wald wiss
I lufe my lady pure,, and scho luvis me agane
I am hir seruiture,, Scho is my souerane
Scho is my verry harte,, I am hir howp and heill
Scho is my joy invart,, I am hir luvar leill
I am hir bound and thrall,, Scho is at my command
I am p[er]petuall,, hir man both fute and hand
The thing þat may hir pleiss,, my Body sall fulfill
Quhat evir hir diseiss,, It dois my body ill
My bird my bony ane,, my tendir bab venust
My lufe my lyfe allane,, my lyking and my lust
We interchange our hairtis,, in vþ[er]is (mark) armis soft
Spreitless we twa dep[ar]tis,, vsand our luvis oft
We murne quhen licht day dawis,, we plene þe nyt is schort
We curss þe cok þat crawis,, That hinderis or disport
I glowffin vp agast,, quhen I hir myss on nycht
and in my oxster fast,, I find þe bowster richt
Tha[n] langor on me lyiss,, lyk morpheus þe mair
Quhilk causss me vpryss,, and to my sueit repair
and tha[n] is all the sorrow,, ffurt of remembrance
That evir I hed a forrow,, in luvis observance
Thus nevir I do rest,, So lusty a lyfe I leid
Quhen þt I list to test,, The well of woma[n]heid
Luvaris in pane I pray,, god send ȝow sic remeid
as I haif nyt and day,, ȝow to defend frome deid
Thairfoir be evir trew,, vnto ȝor ladeis fre
and thay will on ȝow rew,, as myne hes done o[n]e me
Ffinis

head.title: Lait lait on sleip as I wes laid

lg.l: Lait lait on sleip as I wes laid
This hindir nyt my rest to tak
To me in sleip appeird a maid
And gudly wordis to me scho spak
Scho bad þat I suld co[m]fort mak
ffor I am scho þat help ȝow may
gudly in my armis I did hir tak
Bot quhe[n] I walknyt scho wes away
Quhat garmond come scho in trest ȝe
In till ane mantill of lusty blew
It sett hir weill as semit me
Sayand scho wes ane luvar trew
Scho said to me as I say ȝow
Quhat war þe wordis I did ȝow pray
That lufe for lufe scho wald renew
Bot quhe[n] [etc]
Hir hair wes lyk the oppy[n]int silk
Ane ma[n]till of luve our me scho spred
And wt hir body quhyt as milk
vnto my bed scho maid a braid
Softly talkand to me scho said
Be ȝe on sleip, and I said nay
hir chirry lippis to me scho laid
Bot [etc]
Tha[n] in my armes I did hir brace
With gudly words scho said to me
o ser how lyk ȝe this solace
content ȝe this tell me q sche
I said maistres ȝis verrelie
no thing to pleiss me bettir may
nor wt ȝor p[er]sone evir to be
Bot [etc]
Scho sayis god keip ȝow now I go
Than I kist hir allace me thot
Than vp scho raiss and went me fro
Author unknown

head.title: No woundir is althot my hairt be thrall

lg.l: No woundir is althot my hairt be thrall
To ȝow I wiss þe flour of courtesy
Ffor quhy ȝour name and fame so spreids our all
