That ȝe ar held to be the a per se
In vertew meikness trewth and equitie
and eik to this ȝor prop[er] p[er]soun fair
Is so weill maid in all maner degre
That non to me salbe so singulare
Heirfoir I will ryt humly ȝow Imploir
To lat sum stremys of grace on me distill
ffor non bot ȝe my glaidnes may restoir
Becaus both lyfe and deth lyis in ȝour will
ffor as ȝe list ȝe may me saif or spill
wt ȝour on wird So stand I in ȝour cure
Sen I þairfoir am subiect ȝow vntill
Latt me not suerf ȝour (hir, struck through) faythfull seruiture
For my grene ȝewt is lyk þe withering hay
so soir I am oursett wt sichingis seir
My rosy lippis ar woxin paill and blay
Thruch only thot of ȝow my lady deir
and thair is non (þat, struck through) may be my medsoneir
Bot ȝour fawour quhilk gif I do obtene
I sall revert as dois þe reid roseir
freschest of hew in somer sesoun grene
And sen I am so trublit in my thot
Lat not deley be ane occasioun
To place dispair quhair howp and trust hes wrot
Bot grant wt speid sum co[n]solatioun
That pety having dominatioun
wtin ȝour breist I may sum grace purchess
off my murnyng and lamentatioun
Quhilkis I sustene for ȝow my fair maistress
No thing of ryt I ask my lady fair
bot of fre will and m[er]cy me to saif
ȝour wills ȝour awin as ressoun wald it ware
Thairfoir of grace and not of ryt I craif
of ȝow m[er]cy as ȝe wald m[er]cy haif
off god our lord quhois m[er]cyis infeneit
gois befoir all his werkis we may p[er]saif
to thame quhois hairtis wt m[er]cy ar repleit
And gif þat I be fund to ȝow vntrew
wilfull, heichty or eik in ony wayiss
Ielouss vnkind, or chengeing for ane new
a vane wantour (or, struck through) rebelling to ȝour seruyiss
as trators fals hes bene befoir oft syiss
lg.note: bottom left, later hand 'two leaves wanting'
lg.l: Quhois vntrew hairtis garris trew folkis leif in wo
Than for my gilt no (tong, struck through) torment culd suffyiss
Bot I prayss q god it stands not wt me so
Now to conclude wt wordis compendiouss
wald god my tong wald to my will respond
and eik my speich wer so facundiouss
That I wer full of rethore termys Iocond
Than suld my lufe at moir lenth be expond
Than my cu[n]nyng ca[n] to ȝow heir declair
ffor this my style (Innortint, struck through) Inornetly co[m]pond
Eschamys my pen ȝour eiris to truble mair
Not ellis thairfoir i wryt to ȝow my sueit
Bot wt meik hairt and quaking pen and hand
prostratis my seruice law doun at ȝour feit
Bot nyt and day quhill I may gang or stand
praying þe lord of pety excelland
To plant in ȝow ane petifull hairt and mynd
conducting ȝow to Ioy everlestand
Both now and ay and so I mak ane end
Go to my deir wt hu[m]mill reuerence
Thow bony bill both rude and Imp[er]fyte
Go not with forgt flattery to hir presence
as is of falset þe custome vse and ryte
causs me not (ba[n], underlined in darker ink)þat evir I the indyte
(na, underlined in darker ink) tyne my travell turny[n]g all in vane
(Bannatyne, in margin) bot with ane faithfull hairt in wird and wryte
declair my mynd and bring me Ioy agane
My name quha list to knaw lat him tak tent
vnto this littill verss nixt presedent
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: My trewt is plicht vnto my lufe benyng

lg.l: My trewt is plicht vnto my lufe benyng
That meit and sleip is quyt bereft me fro
wt luvaris mo of murny[n]g I may sing
wtout glaidnes quhair evir I ryd or go
and I hir freind quhy suld scho be my fo
do as scho list I do me in hir cure
on to þe deid to be hir seruiture
And thot I dar not daly do present
hir for to serf for hurting of hir name
I dreid þe serpent sklander do hir sche[n]t
Bot nevirþeles hir honor and hir fame
I sall keip in armis and in game
vnto þe tyme þat tropus the threid
Sall cute of lyfe bayth in word & deid
O cupeid king thyn eiris now inclyne
and perss my lady Inwart to þe hairt
wt that ilk dart þat thow hes persit myne
and causs hir so þat scho to me rewarte
for to haif m[er]cy vnto my pane and smarte
or feill þe pyne þat faythfull luvaris haif
for but hir lufe I graith me to my graif
Explicit q fethy

head.title: Lanterne of lufe and lady fair of hew

lg.l: Lanterne of lufe and lady fair of hew
o perle of pryce most precius and preclair
o dasy dulss gayest þat evir grew
(^ with dot above) o flour delyce most flurisand and fair
(^ with dot above) off every wicht most sueit & singulare
vnto þis taill sueit turtor thow (odd mark) attend
my thirlit hairt so law in to dispair
vnto thy m[er]cy I meikly me co[m]mend
O Iem of Ioy Inionit in my hairt
o plant of pryss most plesand and p[er]fyte
The ryt remeid of all my panis smarte
my spreit is reft to se thy cullor quhyte
dewoyd of wo of sorrow and of syte
quhois bewteis all no hairt may co[m]prehend
my visage wa[n] o lady of delyte
vnto thy m[er]cy I meikly me co[m]mend
Sen thow art scho þat hes my hairt in cure
my howp my heill my weill and eik my wo
Lat me not suerf ȝor hu[m]mill seruiture
for but remeid my hairt will brist in two
now lady fair my freind and eik my fo
quhom on but dowt all vertew dois depend
my hairt & mynd quhair evir I ryd or go
vnto þi m[er]cy meikly I me cmendo[m]mend
q steill

head.title: Hence hairt wt hir þat most departe

lg.l: Hence hairt wt hir þat most dep[ar]te
and hald the wt thy souerane
for I had lever want ane harte
nor haif the hairt þat dois me pane
Thairfoir go wt thy lufe remane
and lat me leif thus vnmolest
se þat thow cum not agane
Bot byd wt hir thow luvvis best
Sen scho þat I haif seruit lang
Is to depairt so suddanly
address the now for thow sall gang
and beir thy lady cu[m]pany
ffra scho be gon hairtless am I
ffor quhy thow art wt hir possest
Thairfoir my hairt go hence in hy
and byd wt hir thow luvis best
Thot this belappit body heir
be bound to seruitude and thrall
(addres, struck through) my fathfull hairt is fre inteir
and mynd to serf my lady at all
Wald god þat I wer perigall
vnder þat redolent ross to rest
ȝit at þe leist my hairt thow sall
abyd wt hir thow lufis best
Sen in ȝour garth þe lilly quhyte
may not remane amang þe laif
adew þe flour of haill delyte
adew þe succour þat ma me saif
adew þe fragrant balme suaif
and lamp of ladeis lustiest
my faytfull hairt scho sall It haif
To byd wt hir it luvis best
Deploir ȝe ladeis cleir of hew
hir absence sen scho most dep[ar]te
and specialy ȝe luvaris trew
That woundit bene wt luvis darte
(su[m] of ȝow, in margin) ffor (ȝe, struck through) sall wa[n]t (alsweill, struck through) ane harte
alsweill as I þairfoir at last
do go wt myn wt mynd Inwart
and byd wt hir thow luvis best
q scott the anser to hairtis

head.title: Considdir hairt my trew intent

lg.l: (the a[n]suer to the,, / ballat of hartis,, / in the [ror of, unclear] leiff, in margin) Considdir hairt my trew inte[n]t,
Suppois I am not eloque[n]t,
To wryt ȝow anser responsyve
ȝour scedull is so excellent, (I, struck through) it passs far my wittis fyve
For quhy it is so full of hairtis
That myne wtin my bosum stairtis
quhe[n] I behald it ryt till end
and for ilk hairt ane hundret dertis
outthrow my hairt to ȝow I send
This woundit hairt sweit hairt ressaif
quhilk is deir hairt abone þe laif
ȝour faytfull hairt wt trew intent
ane trewar hairt may noma[n] haif
nor ȝit ane hairt moir p[er]mane[n]t
Ane hairt it is wtout dissait
It is þe hairt to quhome ȝe wret
The misseif full of hairtis seir
It is ane hairt bayth air & lait
That is ȝor hairtis presoneir
It is ane hairt full of distres
ane cairfull hairt all co[m]fortles
ane penseve hairt in dule & dolour
ane hairt of wo & haviness
ane mirthles hairt wtout mesour
It is ane hairt bayt firme & stabill
ane hairt wtout fenȝeit fabill
ane c[on]sta[n]t hairt bayth trest & trew
ane sure hairt set in to sabill
ane wofull hairt bot gif ȝe rew
It is ane hairt þat ȝor hairt servis
ane hairt for lufe of ȝour hairt stervis
ane hairt þat nevir ȝow offendit
ane hairt of ȝors bayth vane and nervis
ane hairt but solace bot gif ȝe send it
It is na gravit hairt in stone
In siluer gold nor evir bone
nor ȝit ane payntit symlitud
bot this same verry hairt allone
wtin my breist of flesch and blude
Thairfoir sueit hairt send me þe hairt
That is in to ȝour breist ȝinwart
and not thir writtin hairtis in vane
bot ȝour hairt to my hairt rewert
and send me hairt for hairt agane
q . scott

head.title: Quha is perfyte, to put in wryt

lg.l: Quha is p[er]fyte, to put in wryt,
The Inwart murny[n]g & mischance
or to indyte, þe grit delyte,
of lustie lufis obserwance
bot he þat may certane, patie[n]tly suffir pane,
To wyn his souerane, in reco[m]pance
Albeid I knaw, of luvis law
The plesor & the panis smart
ȝit I stand aw, for to furthschaw
The quyet secreitis of my harte
for it may fortoun raith, to do hir body skaith
quhilk wait þat of þa[m]e baith, I am expert
Scho wait my wo, þat is ago,
Scho wait my weilfair and remeid
Scho wait also, I lufe no mo,
bot hir the well of woma[n]heid
Scho wait wtouttin faill, I am hir luvar laill
Scho hes my hairt alhaill, till I be deid
That bird of bliss, in bewty is,
In erd þe only ap[er] se
quhais mowt (Inuss [unclear], struck through) to kiss Is worth I wiss
The warld full of gold to me
Is not in erd I cure, bot pleiss my lady pure
Syne be hir seruiture, vnto I de
Scho his my lufe, at hir behufe,
my hairt is subiect bound & thrall
for scho dois moif, my hairt aboif,
To se hir prop[er] p[er]soun small
Sen scho is wrot at will, (glad I, struck through) þat natur may fulfill
Glaidly I gif hir till, body and all
Thair is not (wicht, struck through) wie ca[n] estimie
my sorrow and my sichingis sair
for I am so done fathfullie,
In faworis wt my lady fair,
That baith or hairtis ar ane, luknyt in luvis chene
and evirilk greif is gane, for evir mair
q scott

head.title: It cumis ȝow luvaris to be laill, off body hairt & mynd alhaill

lg.l: It cu[m]is ȝow luvaris to be laill, off body hairt & mynd alhaill
and thot ȝe wt ȝor ladyis daill, Ressoun
Bot and ȝour faith and lawty faill, tressoun
ȝe may wt honesty p[er]sew gif ȝe be c[on]sta[n]t trest & trew
Thot tha[n] vnryt thay on ȝow rew, ressoun
Bot be ȝe fund dowbill adew Tressoun
ȝour hu[m]mill seruice first resing thame
for that to ȝour intent sall bring thame
wt leif of ladeis thot ȝe thing thame ressoun
Bot eftirwart and ȝe maling thame tressoun
Do nevir the deid that ma diseiss (ȝow, struck through) thame
Bot wirk with all ȝor mynd to meiss thame
To tak ȝour plesour quhe[n] it pleiss thame resou[n]
bot wt vntrewt and ȝe betraiss thame Tressoun
Defend thair fame quha evir fyle thame
and ay wt honest havingis style thame
To venus (the, struck through) als suppois ȝe wyle thame ressoun
bot be ȝe frawdfull and begyle thame Tressoun
ȝe suld considdir or ȝe taik thame
That littill seruice will not staik thame
get ȝe ane goldin hour to glak thame ressoun
Bot be ȝe frawdfull & forsaik thame Tressoun
Be secreit trew and plane allwey
defend þair fame baith nyt and day
In prevy place suppoiss ȝe play ressoun
Bot be ȝe ane clattrer harmisay Tressoun
Be courtas in þair cu[m]pany
for that sall causs thame to apply
Thot þat thay lat ȝow wt thame ly ressoun
bot be ȝe fund vnfaithfull fy Tressoun
Wey weill thir versis that I wryt ȝow
do ȝour devior quhe[n] þat thay lat ȝow
To lufe ȝour ladeis quho ca[n] wyt ȝow ressoun
do ȝe the contrair heir I quyt ȝow Tressoun
q Scott

head.title: Absent I am rycht soir aganis my will

lg.l: Absent I am rycht soir aganis my will
my lang absens causss me mekle wo
my lang absens dois my body kill
my lang absens hes turnit me to wo
my lang absens hes reft þe spreit me fro
my lang absens caussit this to indyte
makand ȝow sur I am not in the wyte
Ryt weill I se wtin ȝour breist ingrawit
The hiest vertew þat clippit is co[n]stans
quhilk be ȝour havingis it may be weill p[er]sauit
That ȝe ar nothing gevin to varia[n]s
Thairfoir I sall do quhat evir I chans
abyd faythfull quhair I haif bene befoir
wt hir þat (odd mark) is my lufe and sall do evirmoir
Adew most trew, of erdly creaturis
adew þe hairt of hairtis co[n]solatioun
my thot, forwrot, wtin my (struck through letter) breist conburis
Trewly sueit hairt my hairtis habitatioun
co[n]ding, sueit, thing, of hevinly conu[er]satioun
Imprent most gent þat for ȝor lufe is pynd
co[n]saif my inwart thot wtin ȝor mynd
Ffinis steill

head.title: I wilbe plane, and lufe affane

lg.l: I wilbe plane, and lufe affane, ffor as I mene, so tak me
gif I refrane, for wo or pane, ȝor lufe certane, foirsaik me
Gif trew report, (of my gud of, struck through) to ȝow resort of my gud port, so tak me
Gif I exort, in evill sort, wtout confort, forsaik me
Gif dilige[n]s, in ȝor presens, schaw my pretens so tak me
Gif negligens in my absens, schaw my (absens, struck through) offens, forsaik me
ȝoris and no mo, quhair evir I go, gif I (be, struck through) so, do so tak me
Gif I fle fro, & dois not so, evin as ȝor fo ffoirsaik me
Gif I do prufe, þat I ȝow luf, nixt god abufe so taik me
gif I remufe, fra ȝour behufe, wtout excuss foirsaik me
Be land or se, quhair evir I be, as ȝe fynd me, so tak me
and gif I le, & from ȝow fle, ay quhill I de, forsaik me
It is bot waist, mo wirdis to taist, ȝe haif my laist, so tak me
gif ȝe our cast, my lyf is past Ewin at þe last, forsaik me
my deir adew, most cleir of hew, now on me rew, & so tak me
gif I p[er]sew, & beis not trew, cheiss ȝe ane new, & forsaik me
q scott

head.title: Only to ȝow in erd that I lufe best

lg.l: Only to ȝow in erd that I lufe best
I me co[m]mend ane hundreth thowsand syiss
Exorting ȝow wt pensyfe hairt opprest
as ȝe ar scho quhom in my confort lyiss
gif I misvse my pe[n] or done dispyss
ocht at þis tyme will god I sall amend
protesting this ballat ȝe attend
Sum luvaris thame delytis till indyte
fair facound speich blandit wt eloquence
and vþ[er] sum dois sett þair wit p[er]fyte
To pleiss þ[ar] ladeis wt all þ[ar] diligens
Sum luffaris wantis throw þ[ar] negligens
for falt of speich the lufe of his maistres
wtout hir witting in distress
As to my p[ar]te my lusty lady schene
Throw laik of (^ with dot above, [speich I] in the margin) thoill ryt grit distress
bayt nyt & day hard persit to þe splene
wt deidly dert and can find no redress
Thus me behuffis my panis to express
or tha[n] knaw ryt weill but wirdis moir
That crewell dert outthrow my hart wald boir
Rathir nor smart, I mon my harme reweill
To ȝow my hairt, quha ma my baillis beit
for & ȝe start, adew all warldly weill
will ȝe rewart my cairis ar co[m]pleit
Tuiching ȝor p[ar]te I prey ȝow be discreit
for eftirwart, gif ȝe vpoun me rew
quhill deid dep[ar]te, (I sall in, struck through) my lyfe I salbe trew
Secreit alswa, in every man[er] sort
for weill nor wa, sall ony knaw or mynd
Than be not thra, ȝour serwand to confort
Sum anser ma, as ȝe ar gud and kynd
That may me fra, my langor appeill þat is pynd
and to sla me throw ȝour negligence
This I ȝow pra, for ȝor he excellens
Adew ryt trew, adew my deirest hairt
fairest of hew, for this tyme haif gud nyt
remord & rew, and pondir weill my p[ar]te
Sen I p[er]sew, nathing of ȝow bot ryt
quhilk gif ȝe knew, my mynd as it is plicht
ȝe wald subdew, ȝour inwart thot & mynd
and me reskew, quhilk for ȝour lufe is pynd
q Scott

head.title: My dullit corss dois hairtly recommend

lg.l: My dullit corss dois hairtly reco[m]mend
my faythfull seruice vnto my lady bricht
quhais hairt baid still quhe[n] I did wend
hir for to serf both day and nycht
Sen þat I am hir faythfull wicht
and luvis hir best and evir sall
Till haif my hairt scho hes most ryt
quhill deth sall cum and for me call
Sen first þe tyme I did hir se
away fra me my hart it went
hir for to serf baith day and nycht
Sen þat the body micht not be present
Thairfoir my hairtly laidy gent
I ȝow beseik for (suin?, struck through) conforting
quhilk hes bene deid ay sen I we[n]t
out of ȝour presens my awin sueit thing
Sen þat I may ȝour presens not obtene
nowdir be day nor ȝit by nicht
My doloris dowbillis my woundis ar grene
In absens of þe fairest wicht
þat evir in erd wes to my sicht
Sen tisby slane wes at þe well
In bonty bewty and cullor bricht
aboif all vþ[er] ȝe do precell
Quhairfoir at last my sou[er]rane lady deir
I ȝow beseik wt hairt affectously
To wey thir wordis þat I haif writtin heir
as wordis of wecht and not of wanitie
Sen þat ȝe ma me satisfie
of all my panis and me recure
ffrome dulfull deth deliuer me
or I be brocht in sepulture
Ffinis
Author Unknown

head.title: O lusty flour of ȝowt benyng and bricht

lg.l: O lusty flour of ȝowt benyng and bricht
ffresch blome of bewty blytfull brycht & schene
fair lufsum lady gentill and discret
ȝung brekand blosum ȝit on þe stalkis grene
delytsum lilly lusty for to be sene
be glaid in hairt and expell haviness
bair of bliss þat evir so blyt hes bene
dewoyd langour and leif in lustiness
Bryt sterne at morrow þat dois þe nyt hyn chace
of luvis lychtsum lyfe and gyd
Lat no dirk clud absent fro ws thy face
nor lat no sable frome ws thy bewty hyd
That hes no confort quhair that we go or ryd
bot to behald the beme of þi brychtness
baneiss all baill and into bliss abyd
dewoyd langor and leif in lustiness
Art thow plesand lusty ȝoing and fair
full of all vertew and gud co[n]ditioun
ryt nobill of blud ryt wyiss and debonair
honorable gentill and faytfull of renoun
Liberall lufsum & lusty of (renoun, struck through) p[er]soun
quhy suld thow tha[n] lat sadness the oppress
In hairt be blyt and lay all dolour doun dewoyd [etc]
I me co[m]mend wt all humilitie
vnto þi bewty blisfull and beni[n]g
To quhome I am and sall ay serwand be
wt steidfast hairt and faythfull trew meni[n]g
vnto þe deid wtout dep[ar]ting
ffor quhais saik I sall my pen address
Sangis to mak for thy reconforting
That thow may leif in joy and lustiness
O fair sweit blossum now in bewty flouris
vnfaidit bayt of cullor and vertew
Thy nobill lord þat deid hes done devoir
faid not wt weping thy vissage fair of hew
o lufsum lusty lady (fair of hew, struck through) wyse and trew
Cast out all out all cair and co[m]fort do incress
exyll all sichand on thy serwand rew
dewoyd langor & lef in lustiness
Ffinis
Author Unknown

head.title: Sueit hairt sen I, ȝour freind only, wes ay

lg.l: Sueit hairt sen I, ȝour freind only, wes ay,
I windir quhy, So fre[m]mitly, ȝour say,
ffrome me away, ȝe do attray, so tyte
I wald apply, quhe[n] ȝe m[er]cy wald pray
ȝour grace for thy, I sall humily, affey
Gif ȝe delay, and wt ane ney, me quyt
of all my syt, on ȝow I ley, (the, struck through) me till assay
It is ȝour pley, perfyte
explicit
Author unknown

head.title: My hairt repoiss the and the rest

lg.l: My hairt repoiss the and the rest
In dolour be na langer drest
Sen thow hes it thow luvis best To beit thy baill
quhilk is ane grund the gudliest wt littill daill
It passs far my wittis fyve
hir prop[er] p[er]soun to discryve
bot the publict sup[er]latyve
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [To tell this taill] to right of line)
lg.l: Scho is the lustiest on lyve, wt littill daill
hir pulchritud maist to pryiss
for fortoun hir no thing denyiss
In hir the fame of ladeis lyiss
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [wtouttin faill] to right of line)
lg.l: ane doucer thing may non devyiss, wt littill daill
Quhair I wes wont for lufe to sterue
quhilk did my hairt in pecis kerve
and perss throw every vane & nerve
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [now i appeill] to right of line)
lg.l: Ffor now but pane my lufe I serue, wt littill deill
Ffor hir this lychtfull Lyfe I leid
Sen hir sa courtly (^ with dot above, [natur maid] in margin)
That weill I wait of woma[n]heid
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [Scho beiris the bell] to right of line)
lg.l: I sall hir lufe till I be deid, wt littill daill
Scho is of ladeis principall
That is or wes or ȝit be sall
Ladeis ressaif originall
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [of hir alhaill] to right of line)
lg.l: That scho is gud and best of all, wt littill daill
That souerane lady is so sueit
Scho is the solace of my spreit
Scho is my Ioy evin co[m]pleit
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [I lufe hir weill] to right of line)
lg.l: I think this dasy most discreit wt littill daill
Becauss I fand hir ay so swaif
Sic favour to þat sueit I gaif
That ay I sall hir honor saif
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [and schame conseill] to right of line)
lg.l: and for hir sake lufe all the laif, wt littill deill
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: Rycht as þe glass bene thirlit thrut wt bemis

lg.l: Rycht as þe glass bene thirlit thrut wt bemis
off phebus fair prefulgent visage bricht
or hornit dyane with hir paly glemis
persss the cluddis sabill in þe nicht
and as the kocatrice keilis wt hir sicht
Rycht so þe bewty of my lady stoundis
outthrowt my breist vnto my hairt redoundis
Behaild how far cristall or diamant
Iassink Iasp Ruby Iem or criselleit
Carbunkile Emmerauld perle or athamant
Turcas Topas marbill or margareit
Exceidis the barrat stonis in þe streit
In lyk wayis dois hir bewty vndegraid
Transcend all vthiris wyfe wedow or maid
Espy richt so how far þe rosy gowlis
passs the wallowit weidis in þe vaill
Or sound of lark aboif þe revenous fowlis
and somersday the nichtis hiemaill
or as ane galay gayest vndir saill
Bene plesandar nor taikles boitis small
So is my Lady lustiest of all
q Scott

head.title: Followis the ballat of the prayis of wemen

lg.l: I marvell of thir vane fantastik men
The quhilk haldis weme[n] in abhominatioun
The veritie and trewt thay do misken
Thruch thair obdurat obstinatioun
devulgant thair Intoxicatt blasphematioun
To dimegrat fair weme[n]is honest Lyfe
To quhome god hes schawin lufe sup[er]latyfe
Ane woma[n] till ane ma[n] Is sop and seill
Ane woma[n] is the co[m]fort of his spreit
Ane woma[n] is till him baith welth & weill
Ane woma[n] is his helth and Ioy compleit
Wemen to men as lyk the succor sueit
and he þat sayis of weme[n] ony miss
ar not condigne to haif þe hevy[n]is bliss
I can not wryt Nor ȝit can I reherss
The noble holy weme[n] þat hes bene
The quhilkis in every vertew did converss
as in to diu[er]ss volumes may be sene
Marteiris virgenis and mony holy quene
as in þe goldin legend men may reid
and als plutarq rehersss of þair deid
Quha was mair noble nor penthesillie
That riche tryvmphand quene of amasone
To troy scho brocht ane plesand chevallrie
of fair ladeis armit frome ta to croun
To Revenge hector that grit campione
wt ane bow toruess diu[er]ss greikis did scho kill
Syne slane be pirrus sone to ferss achill
And samarus þe quene of silhia
hir sone wass slane be cirus that (day, struck through) rud
Betuix twa hillis scho slewe Cirus þat day
Syne patt his heid in ane pype full of blud
Saya[n]d till it drynk gif thow thinkis it gud
for of me[n]is blud thow had evir ane grit thrist
Thairfoir thow may drink now quhill þat thow burst
Off cassandra quhat sall I specifie
off fair ladeis scho was þe flor of troy
Scho was Wyce and expert in profecie
Sayand that helene quhilk was hir bruderis Ioy
That hir cu[m]ing fra greice wald breid grit noy
and als þe troganis blude wald weip and mvrne
Bot gif agane to greice þat scho returne
And fair constans the quhilk was borne in creit
was reft be fors be perrattis of þe sie
Siclyk hippo of greice that lady sweit
Than the briggandis pretendit haistallie
To spulȝe þame of þair virginitie
bot thay lap baith to þe se grund in deid
To saif þair honor and þair woma[n]heid
Penelope quhilk wass vlixes wyfe
May be ane perle & mirror in ilk land
Scho was oft ma[n]neist for to loss hir lyfe
or ells co[n]sent to tak hir ane husband
That tyme vlixes was in presone band
ȝit prudentlie scho keipit weill hir fame
quhill þat hir lord vlixes wes cu[m] hame
Off lucress to tell the pvdicitie
Quhen sextus toruene violat hir be forss
Than for hir husband collatyne send sche
and for hir freyndis quha come on fute & horss
In quhais presens scho straik thrut hir corss
ane scherp dagar quhilk scho had at þat tyme
To schaw hir clene of tarquynis desolut cryme
Ane fervent luve had þe chest Iulia
quhilk was þe spowsit wyfe of grit pompie
quhe[n] scho beheld þe blude rob on ane da
off hir husband þat was slane crewalie
In till Egipt be ȝung king ptholomye
The bludy sicht gart hir p[ar]t wt quick chyild
and instantlie fell doun deid on þe feild
And hipsicratis suld not be forȝett
Off pontho scho was ane excellent quene
Pompeyus vincust hir lord medredett
quha fled away for he durst not be sene
Than scho cled hir in armor brycht & schene
and raid on horsbak lyk ane velȝiant knycht
For to defend hir husband day and nicht
And semeramis quene of serrie
Scho facht in battell lyk ane ca[m]pione
In me[n]is clething & harness cled was sche
To deffend hir ȝung sone demmone
Scho conqueist the grit toun of babilone
and ane p[ar]t of ethiopia and ynd
Thairfoir scho was bayt velȝia[n]t wyse & kynd
Fair portia quhilk was brutus wyfe
hir nobilnes was but co[m]paresone
Quhen scho hard tell hir husband lost his lyfe
and slane was on þe feildis of macedone
To tell hir wo It is confusione
Scho patt in till hir mowth hett coilis of fyre
For brutus saik scho brunt hir bane & lyre
In humane (lire[n]s?) quha wes mair expert
Nor nicostratt dochtir of Ionyus
and fair sapho in poetre and art
quha did compyle vercis co[m]pe[n]dius
and aspacia scho was ryt curius
In to philosaphe in athanes
wtin þe achademia of socrates
And nane was moir expert in poetre
nor was amasia and affrainia
Tha (the, struck through) twa in rome had grit awtoritie
Befoir þe senat to pleid every day
In grit materis contendand to & fray
The ciuill lawis thay ladeis had p[er]queir
and in prettik thay had no maik nor peir
Arthemesia dochtir of mowsalus
Scho weipit soir þe deid of hir husband
Spysand his flesche wt droggis delicius
and brak his bonis in pulder small as sand
of quhilk scho pat ane portioun wt hir hand
wtin ane glass to drink quhill it mycht last
In reme[m]brance of hir lord þat was past
And alcestes quhilk was admetus wyfe
and dochtir of perill of thesalie
appollo said hir lord wald loss his lyfe
and but remeid richt haistaly wald de
Bot gif sum of his freyndis sa kynd wald be
To de for him or ellis none was remeid
Than alcest for his saik ressauit the deid
And vthiris als hes bene Innvmerable
of holy ladeis of grit grawetie
The ten cibillis prophetis honerable
and cornelia full of abilitie
The fervent kyndnes of ypsiphilie
quhe[n] þat scho saiffit hir fader fra þe deid
and hepoleit þat conqueist mony steid
Medusa dido and fair argia
and orchia in battellis þat was bold
and of colquhoss the riche quene medea
The quhilk gart Iasone win þe fleisch of gold
and camilla non fairar on þe mold
and als þe holy vestall claudea
wt m[er]cia lena and sulpicia
And in þe bybill may be red and sene
diu[er]ss holy weme[n] honerable
The wyfe of noy moir Iust thair hes non bene
and sara was baith meik & cheretable
And lia was mansweit and affable
And Rebecca to god was richt plesand
and chest susan That brak not godis command

lg.note: (Off raab, estir a, struck through)
lg.l: Off raab estir and of dewora
and pudis cathrye of faith lamp of lyt
margaret cecill and sanct barbara
wt holy virgynis qlk to deid wes dicht
allace men ar fals blindit in þair sicht
Quhen thay haif contrair wemen purchest feid
Sen wemen ar to men supreme & heid
Bot sum mischevouss me[n] but law or richt
Be maleiss fell thay do le and bakbytt
detractand honest weme[n] day and nicht
Be diu[er]ss sortis of Injureis and dispyt
callu[m]nyand that weme[n] had þe wytt
off all þe grittest crymes þat hes bene done
Sen god creat þe warld lift sone and mone
And for probatione of thair argume[n]t
Thay first allege ane fryvoll vanitie
how medea of ane crewale Intent
hir twa childryne wt hir ha[n]dis gart de
and dauid thruch counsale of bersabie
In battell gart vries loss his lyfe
and sanct Iohine slane thrut counsale of herrodis wyfe
and hercules poysonit be deianyra
and helene brocht on troy distructioun
and sampsone betrasit be dalida
and þe Idolatre of salamoun
proceidit of weme[n]is p[er]swasioun
and sarra as þe scriptor vndirstandis
was causs of þe deid of hir sevin husbandis
Allace this is ane strenge and piteous cace
of thir detrakkaris mast abhominable
how fra þe trewt thay thraw þe richt face
be ane fals gloss vyle and detestable
for to defame fair ladeis honerable
Bot ȝit þe trewt will ay remane p[er]fyt
quhilk will devulgat wicket me[n]is dispyt
Ffirst quhair thay mak ane allegatioun
how þe twa sonis of medea war slane
Medea had ane honest excusatioun
ffor fals Iasone was the causs for certane
Quha did repud and lichtly hir in plane
Than to revenge hir on his crewaltie
his twa ȝung sonis wt hir handis scho gart de
And quhair that men allegis tyme & tyd
That vrias was slane thrut barsabie
King dauid gart co[m]mit þat homicyd
for to fulfill his lust of lichery
and as to hercules þat was gart de
addultre was tynsall of his lyfe
wt yolee quhilk was not his awin wyfe
Sampsone þat was betrasit as thay sa
The causs of it was thruch his lust maist vyle
he sowld not haif gevin trest to dalyda
Becauss scho wes ay of ane vicius style
Thairfoir I think scho did him not begyle
howbeit þat cryme procedit of hir mynd
for dowtless huris dois no thing bot þ[er] kynd
Off holy sarra na ma[n] sowld speik evill
howbeit hir sevin husbandis war all slane
For þat mischeif procedit of þe devill
for þair awin sy[n]nis as þe bybill makis plane
and as to salamone þat king of mane
wemen causit not his ydolatre
Bot rathir it was his vyle lichery
All thir exampillis ar experiens
That weme[n] ar not causs of sic fowll crymis
Bot rathir me[n] be blynd Intelligens
abbusit hes þame self at diu[er]ss tymis
Than for dispyt thay co[m]pyle prose & rymis
accusand weme[n] of þair woma[n]heid
Ffor till excuse þame self of þair vyle deid
And sa weme[n] ar lyk the sillie scheip
among þe wolffis quhilk dois þame kill & bytt
Thairfoir thay haif grit causs to mvrne & weip
Becaus Ill me[n] dois þame schame & dispyt
Bot cowld gud weme[n] sett furt bukis & wryt
Thay could excuse thair Innocens & fame
and als thay could accuse (no, struck through) me[n] to þair schame
Quhat can we of þame speik bot gud & weill
for wtout þame we wald haif nevir bene borne
weme[n] till ws is succor sence & seill
and for or saikis oft tymes thay suffir scorne
war not (^ with dot above, [þ[er] birt] in margin) (thair woma[n], struck through) the warld had bene forlorne
Thairfoir all me[n] sowld sett thair haill intent
To be to weme[n] ay obedie[n]t
Had I þe riches of king darius
or of king midas had I half þe gold
or half þe (gold, struck through) tresor of king tantalus
or half þe landis that alexr did hold
or war I in to battell half so bald
as goddefred or valȝea[n]t a[n]niball
or scipio quhilk affrik conquest all
Than I sowld be all weme[n]is ca[m]pione
To be defendar of þair woma[n]heid
and pass thrut mony vncowt regione
To holy land qr cryst was quick & deid
To slay þame that hes contrair weme[n] feid
and on my speir in takin of grit lufe
I sowld gar hing ane woma[n]is richt hand gluve
Ffinis q weddirburne

head.title: Vp helsum hairt

lg.l: Vp helsum hairt Thy rutis Rais and lowp
Exalt and clym wtin my breist in staige
Art thow not wantoun haill & in gud howp
Ffermit in grace and free of all thirlaige
Bathing in bliss and sett in hie curaige
Braisit in joy no falt may th affray
Having thy ladeis hart as heretaige
In blenche ferme ffor ane sallat every may
So neidis thow nocht now sussy sytt nor sorrow
Sen thow art sure of sollace evin & morrow
Thow cupeid rewardit me wt thiss
I am thy awin trew liege wtowt tressone
Thair levis no man in moir eiss welth and bliss
I knaw no siching sadnes, nor ȝit soun(d, blotted out)
Walking Thot langor lame[n]tatioun
Dolour, dispair weiping nor Ielosye
My breist Is woyd and purgit of pussoun
I feill no pane I haif no purgatorye
Bot peirles perfytt paradisall plesour
wt mirry hairt and mirthfulnes but mesoure
My lady lord thow gaif me for to hird
wtin myne armes I nureiss on the nycht
kissing I say my bab my tendir bird
Sweit maistres,, (lady luffe, struck through) lady luffe & lusty wicht
Steir Rewll and gyder of my sensss Richt
My voice surmontis the sapheir Cludis hie
Thanking grit god of that tressor & micht
I coft hir deir Bot scho fer derrer me
Quhilk hasard honor fame in aventeure
Committing clene hir corse to me in cure
In oxteris cloiss we kiss and cossis hairtis
Brynt in desyre of amouris play and sport
Meittand oure lustis spreitles we twa dep[ar]tis
Prolong wt lasar lord I the Exhort
Sic tyme that we may boith Tak our confort
Ffirst for to sleip syne walk wtowt espyis
I blame the Cok I plene the nicht Is schort
Away I went my wache the Cuschett Cryis
wissing all luvaris leill To haif sic chance
That thay may haif ws in reme[m]brance
Q Scott

head.title: Quhair luve is kendlit confortles

lg.l: Quhair luve is kendlit confortles
thair is no fever half so fell
Ffra cupeid kest his dert be gess
I had na hap to saif my sell
Lyik as my wofull hairt can tell
My invart panis and siching sair
ffor weill I watt the panis of hell
vnto my pane is nocht compair
Ffor ony mellady ȝe ma ken
except peuir luve or tha[n] stark deid
Help may be had fra handis of men
Throw meddecynis to mak remeid
Ffor harmes of body handis and (feit?, struck through) heid
The potting aris will purge the panis
Bot all the me[m]baris ar at feid
Quhair that the law of lufe remanis
As tantalus in water standis
To stanche his thristy appetyte
Bevaling body heid and handis
The revar flyis him in dispyte
So dois my lusty lady quhyte
Scho flyis the place quhair I repair
To hungry men Is small delyte
To twiche the meit and eit na mair
The nar the flamb the hettar fyre
The moir I pyne ȝit I p[er]sew
The moir enkendillis my desyre
ffra I behawld hir hevinly hew
Peuir piramus him self he slew
maid sawle and body to dissaver
he dyit bot anis fairweill adew
I dayly de and dyis never
ȝit Iasone did Inioy medea
and theseus gat adriane
dido dissavid was with enea
and demophon to his lady wan
Gif wemen trowid sic tratouris than
ffor till enioy the fructs of lwfe
Quhy wald ȝe slay ȝour saikles man
Quha myndis nevir for to remwfe
The ferss achill ane wirthy knicht
was slane for luve the swth to say
Leander on ane stormy nicht
dyit fleittand the fludis gray
Trew troyallus he langorit ay
Still waitand for his luvis returne
Had nocht sic pyne It was bot play
as daylie dois my body burne
As poill to pyllattis dois appeir
moir brichttar than the starris abowt
So dois ȝour visage schyne als cleir
as rose amang the raschell rowt
War pariss levand now no dowt
and had the goldin ball to serve
I wait he wald sone waill ȝow owt
and leif baith venus and minerve
Now paper pas and at hir speir
Gif pleiss hir prudence to Impreinttit
My faithfull hairt I send it heir
In signe of paper I presenttit
Wald god my body war fornenttit
(Illegible mark) That I micht serve hir grace but gla[m]mer
To be hir knaif I am contenttit
or smallest varlet in hir cha[m]mer
Ffinis
The hairt did think The hand did frem
The body send to ȝow the same
[etc]

head.title: Gife langour makis men licht

lg.l: Gife langour makis men licht
or dolour thame decoir
In erth thair is no(t, struck through) wicht
May me compair in gloir
Gif cairfull thoftis restoir
My (^ with dot above, [havy] in margin) hairt frome sorrow
I am for evirmoir
In joy both evin and morrow
Gif plesr be to pance
I playnt me not opprest
Or absence micht awance
My hairt is haill possest
gif want of quiet rest
Frome cairis micht me convoy
My mind is nocht mollest
bot evirmoir in joy
Thot þat I pance in pane
In passing to and fro
I laubor all in vane
For so hes mony mo
That hes not seruit so
In suting of þair sueit
The nar the fyre I go
The grittar is my heit
The turtour for hir maik
Mair dule may not Indure
Nor I do for hir saik
Evin hir quha hes in cure
My hart quhilk salbe sure
and seruice to þe deid
vnto þat lady pure
The well of woma[n]heid
Schaw schedull to that sueit
my pairt so p[er]mane[n]t
That no mirth quhill we meit
sall causs me be content
Bot still my hairt lament
In sorrowfull siching soir
Till tyme scho be present
Fairweill I say no moir
Ffinis q king hary stewart

head.title: How suld my febill body fure, The dowble dolour I Indure

lg.l: How suld my febill body fure, The dowble dolour I Indure,
The morny[n]g and the grit mallure, Ca[n] nane devyne
quhilk garris my bailfull breist co[n]bure, To se ane vþ[er] haif þe cure, þt suld by my(ne, cut off)
Ffor weill I wait wes nevir wicht, wald sa inforss his my[n]d & mycht,
To lufe & serf his lady bricht, and want hir syne,
as I do (and dois me, struck through) martir day and nyt, wtout the only thing of rycht, that [etc]

lg.note: War I of pissans for to prufe, my lawty & my hairtly lufe,
lg.l: I suld hir mynd to m[er]cy mufe, wt sic propyne,
war all þe warld at my behufe
Scho suld It haif be god abufe
That suld be myne,
Now quhome to sall I mak my mone, sen trewt & co[n]stans fynd I none,
for all the fathfull lufe is gone, of femenene
It wald vpross ane hart of stone, To se me lost for lufe of one, That [etc]
Quha suld my dullit spreitis raiss
Sen for no lufe my lady gaiss
bot and gud seruice myt hir maiss
Scho suld inclyne
I dre þe dollour and diseiss
quhe[n] vþ[er]is hes hir as thay pleiss, That suld be myne
I may p[er]saif þat, weill be thiss
That all the blythnes joy and bliss
The lusty wantoun lyfe I wiss
of lufe is hyne
and no remeid sen so it is
bot paciens suppoiss I miss
That suld be myne
Ffor nobillis hes not ay renown
nor gentillis ay the gayest goun
Thay cary victuallis to þe toun
lg.note: (Curved line to right of last three lines, [That werst dois dyne] beside line)
lg.l: Sa bissely to busk I boun
ane vþir eitis the berry doun
lg.note: (Curved line to right of last two lines, [that suld be myn] beside line)

lg.l: Quha wald the rege of ȝowtheid dant
Lat thame the court of luvaris hant
and tha[n] as venus subiect grant
lg.note: (Curved line to right of last three lines, [and keip hir tryme] beside line)
lg.l: p[er]cha[n]ce thay sall find freindschip ska[n]t
and abill thair rewaird to want
lg.note: (Curved line to right of last two lines, [as I did myne] beside line]

lg.l: q Scott

head.title: Ane laid may lufe ane leddy of estait

lg.l: Ane laid may lufe ane leddy of estait
ane lord ane lass Lufe hes no vdir law
quha ca[n] vndo That is predestinat
oft syiss for lufe the ly[n]nage lichtis law
rycht as the sone schynis on the sudly schaw
and eik the rane vpoun the ryell ross
Sa aft tymis lufe cheisis ane vnlyk choiss
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: Marvilling in mynd quhat ailis fortoun at me

lg.l: Marvilling in mynd quhat ailis fortoun at me
and I ane serwand trew both day and nyt
I am bot deid sic dolour for to dre
So suddanly exylit frome hir sycht
In all this warld thair is no erdly wycht
moir fre moir fre[m]mit moir trest & eik moir trew
Sen I mon de adew luvaris adew
Dame natur I the wyt of all my pane
That formit hes this flour so fair but feir
all vertew in hir visage dois (appeir, struck through) remane
bot m[er]ciles I go from ȝeir to ȝeir
Scho is allon of price wtouttin peir
This ryall ross will not vpoun me rew
Sen I mo[n] de adew luvaris adew
My dullit hairt but dout may not Indure
my pane but peir It persss throw my hairt
my lady fair of me scho takis no cure
bot thoillis me to de in panis smart
o venus quene thow causs hir mynd rewart
for be þe graue first lufe in to me grew
Se[n] I mon [etc]
Now lat me lady do quhat evir scho will
baith trest & trew my hairt sall nevir felȝe
Small honor is hir serwand for to spill
Sen þat my deth to hir may not awailȝe
ane ble[n]k of hir but dout wald mak me haill
my hairt is gon my face is paill of hew
Se[n] I [etc]
addew addew my dule and my delyte
adew fair weill my freind & eik my fo
adew my pane & plesans most p[er]fyte
addew addew my weill & eik my wo
fairweill for now for euirmoir I go
fairweill I will my sepultur p[er]sew
Se[n] I mo[n] de addew luvaris adew
q Scott

head.title: Pansing in hairt wt spreit opprest

lg.l: Pansing in hairt wt spreit opprest, This hindirnyt bygon
my corps for walking wes molest, for lufe only of on
allace quhome to suld I mak mon, Sen this come to lait
cauld cauld culis the lufe þat kendillis our het
Hir bewty and hir maikles maik, dois reif my spreit me fro,
and causss me no rest to tak, Bot tu[m]lyng to & fro,
My curage tha[n] is hence ago, Sen I may not hir gett
cauld cauld culis the lufe þat kendillis our hett
Hir first to luf quhe[n] I began, I trowd scho luvit me
Bot I allace wes not þe ma[n], that best pleisit hir E,
Thairfoir will I lat dolour be, and gang ane vþ[er] gett
Cauld cauld [etc]
first quhe[n] I kest my fantesy, thair fermly did I stand
and howpit weill þat scho suld be, all haill at my co[m]ma[n]d
bot suddanly scho did ganestand, and co[n]trair maid debait
Cauld [etc]
Hir prop[er] makdome so p[er]fyt, hir visage cleir of hew
Scho raissis on me sic appetyte, & causss me hir p[er]sew
allace scho will not on me rew, nor gre wt myne estait
Cauld [etc]
Sen scho hes left me in distress, in dolour and in cair
Wtout I get sum vþ[er] grace, my lyfe will lest no mair
Scho is our prop[er] trym & fair, ane trew hairt to oursett
Cauld [etc]
Suld I ly doun in haviness I think it is bot vane
I will get vp wt m[er]riness, and cheiss alss gud agane
ffoir I will (no, struck through) maik to ȝow plane, my hairt it is oursett
Cauld [etc]
No no I will not trow as ȝit, þat scho will leif me so
nor ȝit þat scho will chenge or flit as thot scho be my fo
Thairfoir will I lat dolor go, and gang ane vþir gait
Cauld cauld culis the lufe that kendlis our haitt
q fethe

head.title: Departe departe departe allace I most departe

lg.l: Dep[ar]te dep[ar]te dep[ar]te allace I most dep[ar]te
frome hir þat hes my hart, wt hairt full soir
aganis my will in deid, and ca[n] find no remeid
I wait þe pa[n]is of deid, ca[n] do no moir
Now most I go allace, ffrome sicht of hir sueit face
The grund of all my grace, & souerane
Quhat chanss that may fall me, sall I nevir mirry be
vnto þe tyme I se, my sweit agane
I go and wait not quhair, I wandir heir and thair
I weip and sichis rycht sair, wt panis smart
Now most I pass away away, in wildirness & wilsu[m] way
allace this wofull day we suld dep[ar]te
My spreit dois quaik for dreid, my thirlit hairt dois bleid
my panis dois exceid, quhat suld I say
I wofull wycht allone, makand ane petouss mone
allace my hairt is gone, for evir and ay
Throw langour of my sueit, So thirlit is my spreit
my dayis ar most co[m]pleit, Throw hir absence
chryst sen scho knew my smert, Ingrawit in my hairt
Becaus I most dep[ar]te, ffrome hir presens
Adew my awin sueit thing, my joy and co[m]forting
my mirth and sollesing, of erdly gloir
fair weill my lady bricht, and my reme[m]bra[n]ce rycht,
ffair weill and haif gud nycht, I say no moir
q Scott off þe mr of erskyn

head.title: That evir I luvit allace þairfoir

lg.l: That evir I luvit allace þairfoir
This to be pynit wt panis soir
Thirlit throw every vane and boir, wtout offenss
chryst send remeid I say no moir, bot pacienss
Grissall wes nevir so pacient
as I am for my lady gent
for in my mynd I so Imprent, hir excellenss
That of my deid I am content, wt pacienss
How lang sall I this lyfe inleid
That for hir saik to suffer deid
but confort of hir gudly heid, or ȝit presens
I say no moir chryst send remeid wt paciens
On pacie[n]s I mon p[er]forss, Sen þat I go frome weill to worss
Exorting chryst send hir remorss, of conscienss
Sa crewaly hes keild my corss But pacienss
Paciens ourcu[m]is all, and is ane vertew principall,
Sen I am bund to leif in thrall, wt insolens
I mon sustene quhat so befall, wt pacienss
But paciens I ȝow assure, nane may þe panis of lufe indure
nor ȝit in to þat lufly bour, mak residens
Wtout thay preif baith sueit and sour, wt pacienss
Lufe is maid of sic ane kynd, þat be na forss it may be fynd
bot only be of hu[m]mill mynd wt p[er]manenss
To thoill suppoiss þe hairt be pynd wt pacienss
Ffinis q Scott

head.title: So fremmit is my fortoun and my werd

lg.l: So fre[m]mit is my fortoun and my werd
That all my lyfe I leif in displesour
my cairfull corps ca[n] tak no rest in erd
how suld I leif or ȝit my lyfe indure
for lufe of on my hairt hes no recure
Ihow suld I leif or ȝit my lyfe indure am forlorne wtout scho me redress
m[er]cy I cry on my sweit lady pure
ffor to haif mynd on my wofull distress
Thair is no ransoun may me lowss nor bynd
nor ȝit no confort may expell my wo
Seikand remeid quhair nane þat I ca[n] fynd
of hir my freind and eik my fre[m]mit fo
Langor I haif quhair evir I ryd or go
hairtles I am for slewt twichis me so
my wofull hairt quhy bristis thow not in two
and makis ane end of my mischevous wo
Quhair is the swerd þat persit piramus
In absens of his lady tisby
mair wo I wait dreid nevir (try, struck through) troyelus
nor I for hir quhilk causss me to de
o crewall swerd o scherp aduersitie
cum perss me throw sen I ca[n] not abstene
my lame[n]t causss my wofull distany
my woundis ar awld & daly waxis grene
My sorrowfull ene ar blyndit wt my teiris
Throw ardent lufe of my sweit cheif maistress
(and, struck through) ȝit in hir hart no signe of rewt appeiris
bot wilfull will bandit wt crewalness
and ȝit my hart oursett wt haviness
Sall fermly stand wt hir in all maneir
In weill in wo in mirth and in distress
I sall thus end hir wofull presoneir
O atrapus quhilk hes my threid neir worn
Cum (schott, struck through) 4 my lyfe and end my grevouss pane
sen þat my deid remedyles is sworn
on to I de in wo quotidian
cum cutt my threid and lat me not remane
Sen of my (hart, struck through) lyfe I irk throw displesur
chryst sen my corps þat nyt and day is fane
Seisit wer sur in to my sepultur
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: Oppressit hairt indure, In dolor and distress

lg.l: Oppressit hairt indure, In dolor and distress,
Wappit wtout recure, In wo remidiless,
Sen scho is m[er]ciless, and caussis all thy smert
quhilk suld thy dolor dress, Indure oppressit hairt
Perforss tak paciens, and dre thy destany
To lufe but reco[m]pens, Is grit perplexitie
of thyne aduersitie, wyt thy self and no mo
Ffor quhe[n] þat thow wes fre, Thow wald not hald þe so
Thow la[n]git ay to prufe, the strenth of luvis lair
and quhat kin thing wes lufe, quhilk now settis the so sair
off all thy wo and cair, It mendis the not to mene
howbeid thow suld forfair, Thy self þe causs hes bene
Quhe[n] thow wes weill at eiss, and subiect to no wicht,
Thow hir for lufe did cheiss, quhilk settis thy lufe at licht,
and thot thow knew hir slicht, ȝit wald thow refrane,
þairfoir it is bot rycht, That thow indure þe pane
Bot ȝit my (corls p? struck through) corpss allace, Is wra[n]gusly opprest
be the in to þis cace, and brot (in, struck through) to grit wanrest
quhy suld it so be drest, be the and daly pynd
quhilk still it ay detest, Thy wantoun folich mynd

lg.note: The blenkyne of ane E, ay gart the goif and glaik
my body bad lat be, and of thy siching slaik
Thow wald not rest bot raik, and lair the in þe myre
lg.l: ȝit felȝeit thow to faik, That thow did maist desyre
Thot thow do murn and weip, wt inwart spreit opprest
quhe[n] vþir me[n] takis sleip, Thow wantis the nychtis rest
Scho quhome thow luvis best, off the takis littill thot
Thy wo and grit wanrest, and cair scho countis not
Thairfoir go hens in haist, my langor to lame[n]t
Do not my body waist, quhilk nevir did co[n]sent
and thot thow wald repe[n]t, That thow hir hes p[er]sewit
ȝit man thow stand co[n]tent, and drynk þat thow hes brewit
q Scott

head.title: Leif luve and lat me leif allone

lg.l: Leif luve and lat me leif allone
at libertie subiect to none
ffor it may weill be sene vpone
my bludless blaiknit ble
The tormenting in tyme bygon
That skerss hes left bot skin and bon
Throw fre[m]mitness of the
For thruch thy feid I fynd express
my only lady m[er]ciless
Sa doggitless scho did me dress
wt wo and misery
quhe[n] scho had welth and wantouness
I had bot dollour and distress
Throw fre[m]mitness of the
To confort hir thow wes inclynd
and hald my murny[n]g in my mynd
I fand hir of ane staffage kynd
Bath staitly strange and he
Scho wes vncurtass & vnkynd
It wes hir play to se me pynd
Throw [etc]
Thow held hir curage he on loft
and ted my tendir hairt lyk toft
I knaw how costly I wes coft
quhe[n] scho ȝeid frankand fre
Thow sufferit hir to sleip full soft
quhair mirthles I wes marterit oft
Throw fremitness of the
Cupeid thow ke[n]nis I burd to knaw
The langsum leving in thy law
Bot this is not þe first ourthraw
That thow hes done to me
bot of the now I stand not aw
Se[n] ressoun dois my be[n]ner blaw
aganis the feid of the
This lady is so gud ane gyd
Scho lattis me nevir gang on syd
bot teichis me both tyme & tyd
recent befoir myne E
Quhome in to lippin and co[n]fyd
I slip and lattis all ourslyd
aganis the feid of the
q Scott

head.title: Thot I in grit distress, suld de in to dispair

lg.l: Thot I in grit distress, suld de in to dispair
I ca[n] get no redress, of ȝow my lady fair
howbeid my tyme I wair, alhaill in ȝour serwyce
ȝe co[m]pt[er] not of my cair I fynd ȝow ay so nyce
It dois ȝow ay delyt To wit me in distress
Sic is ȝor haill dispyt, and grit vnfathfulness
The mair I do me dress, To be at ȝor devyce
my guerdoun is the less I find ȝow ay so nyss
Ay tresting for to speid, I haif my harte ourset,
quhair þat I fynd bot feid, my langor for to lett,
I seik the watter hett, In vndir the cauld yce
quhair na regaird I gett, I fynd ȝow ay so nyss
Belevand ay for grace, I hald my hart on loft
bot now I say allace, That evir I It socht,
I fynd ȝour fenȝeit Thot, vncertane as þe dyce
Thairfoir I co[m]pt[er] it not, I fynd ȝow ay so nyce
Lang tyme ȝe haif me pruffit, and evir fund me trew
Bot now that I haif luvit, rycht sair I may it rew,
first quhe[n] I did p[er]sew, I wont ȝe had bene wyss
Bot now fair weill adew, I fynd ȝow ay so nyss
q Scott

head.title: Quhat art thow, lufe for till allow

lg.l: Quhat art thow, lufe for till allow
hes brocht me now, in to þis pane & wo
or ȝit awow, hes gart me trow,
and reft my dow, and daliance me fro
Ffy on the lord of lufe, sett me so heich aboif
and als but rest or rufe, hes gart me go
Pariss of troy, had not moir Ioy,
bot till convoy, fair helene fresch and ȝing
now haif I nowy, me to distroy,
as than (of, struck through) at troy had menelaus king
Sen lost is my delyte, and pastyme most p[er]fyte,
all erthly solace quyte, heir I resing
Ffor till discuss, I wes I wiss,
as troyelus, wt cresseid trew to tell
now am I thuss, as piramus
most dolorus, wt tisby at þe well
So is becum my caiss, as orpheus did allaiss
Seikand euridicess, from hevin to hell
Quhair suld I go, now to or fro,
To seik hir so, my vmqle lufe allone
Than freind now fo, Than weill now wo,
Than myrth but mo, now is scho past and gon
Than howp, now (mo, struck through) in distres Than Ioy now (in distres, struck through) co[m]fortless
Than welth and wantones, allace haif I none
Wass nevir wicht, moir plesour mycht
both day and nycht, wt mirthis monyfald
With hairt on hicht, scho in licht
all willit rycht, as I culd wiss or wald
And now All growis gray wes grene
and I am cassin clene, in cairis cald
O luvaris all To lufe bene thrall,
now latt ws (thrall, struck through) fall, befoir þe godis feit
To clip and call, in generall,
both grit and small, þat may our baillis beit
o venus souerane, haif pety on my pane,
and grant me now agane, my lady sueit
Agane and not, lat It be thot,
That scho for ocht, will anys returne to me
Sen chanc hes socht, and werd hes wrocht,
That scho is brocht, quhair scho may byd and be
Sen forss is I ma[n] want hir
(hir, struck through) grit glaidness god ^ mot grant hir
and send me alss gud anter
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [amen q he] beside line)

head.title: Lamenting soir my weird and bissy cure

lg.l: Lamenting soir my weird and bissy cure
In luvis loir, and langor þat me leidis
The pane exceidis, and dolour I indure
and no thing sure, Gif pety in hir breidis
My hairt sair dreidis, Quhen scho me sup[er]ceidis
and furt me feidis, wt flatterand speikingis fair
That I most neidis, bewaill my fatell threidis
Quhen auld done deidis, scho dois forȝet þai[m] clair
The tyme hess bene and ȝit may cum agane
we ma convene, To talk in gudliness
Thot in distress, ȝe leif me in grit pane
I may complane, ȝit to ȝour lawliness
vnto ȝour pess, To tak my sympilness
It wald incress, ȝour honour evir mair
na bissiness, to lufe sall gar me sess
Thot auld kyndness ȝe haif forȝettin clair
Thot ȝe be strange, and can ȝour will refrene
I can not chenge, bot I sall ay be trew
ȝor lusty hew, my curage dois constrene
wt mycht and mene, ȝour seruice to ensew
and to no new, my self I will subdew
Gif ȝe will rew, on me þat sichis sair
Gif ȝe eschew, and will not do ȝour dew
I may say trew ȝe haif forȝet me clair
Sen I haif bene, ȝour serwand thuss of auld
on me ȝe mene, and als be trew me till
Sen nevir ill, I wrot bot as ȝe wauld
Lat nevir be cauld, nor ȝit to breve in bill
That I suld spill, for lak of ȝour gud will
ȝe may fulfill, To bring me frome all cair
It war grit skill my dolour anis suld dill
Gif ȝe not will ȝe haif forȝet me clair
Thuss may I not, bot pray vnto ȝow schene
Is maist in thot, and salbe day and (nycht, struck through) nycht
My self throw sycht, Thuss causyt me to mene
ȝour lusty ene, hes revit me vnrycht
Sen I (^ with a dot above, [had] in margins) licht, To leif I had no micht
Bot wt ȝow wicht, In bandoun to remane
Bill go wt slicht, quhill thow cum to hir sicht
Bid hir of rycht, releif me of my pane
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: In to the nyt, quhen to ilk wicht

lg.l: In to the nyt, quhe[n] to ilk wicht,, natur derekis rest
I walk allone,, makand my mone,, wt luvis pane opprest
was nevir ma[n],, sen luve began,, þat luvit moir trewly
The[n] I I wiss,, suppois I miss,, the lufe of my lady
In luvis dance,, sic is my chance,, To lufe vnlovit agane
heirfoir allace,, my cairfull cace,, quhome to sall I co[m]plane
Sall I me mene,, To venus quene,, or to hir sone cupyde
That wt his dart,, Thirlis my harte,, wt wondis warka[n]d wyde
Or for support,, sall I exort,, mars god armipotent
To saif my lyfe,, in to this stryfe,, or sorrow do me sche[n]t
Ffor thot I cry,, on my lady,, my dolor to redress
Ffor all my trewth,, scho hes no rewth,, on my daly distress
It is hir joy,, to wirk me noy,, hir weill to wirk me wo
It is hir will,, þat I lyk ill,, allaiss quhy dois scho so
It is hir cure,, to do plesure,, To him feling no pane
and latt me go,, Lame[n]ting so,, wt sichis & sorrowis slane
moir mirreit war,, to hir be far,, to cure the seik from ([pyne] struck through, [cair] written above it)
Than to propyne,, him medecyne,, That nevir felt no sair
Bot mony ma[n] wyse,, Sayis þat þe gyse,, of luve is evir sway
To sla the trew,, and on him rew,, That falsast is of fay
O nymphis thre,, haif mynd on me,, and cut my fatell threid
Sen in this erd,, ȝe gaif me werd,, Nevir in lufe to speid
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: The moir I luve and serf at all my mycht

lg.l: The moir I luve and serf at all my mycht
The langar I find ȝour denger and offenss
The grittar desyre I haif vnto ȝour sycht
The less I get ȝour language and presens
The nerrer the sycht þe ferrer frome audiens
The bissyar to pleiss þe moir of Ioy all quyt
The hevear cure The less is my creddens
and nane bot fortoun dar I blame nor quyt
The trewar I be bayth in (tho, struck through) werk and thot
The laither to greif ȝow I am, in word or deid
The rather I se þe less of me ȝe rocht
wt fremmit cheir suche guerdoun is me queid
my hairt in breist I feill salt teiris bleid
The sarar I sych The sadlyar I indyte
Ffor to my harmes ȝe list not to tak heid
and nane bot fortoun dar I blame or wyte
The faster I be bundin in ȝour chenȝe
The less ȝe cair quhider I de or (leif, struck through) leif
The less pety ȝe haif to heir me plenȝe
The strangest wordis ȝe can devyss ȝe geif
The luk of ȝow þat suld my hairt releif
Is he extreme dengeir and dispyte
off my remeid I haif no moir beleif
and nane bot fortoun dar I blame nor (qu, struck through) wyt
Finis
Author unknown

head.title: Quhen phebus fair wt bemis bricht

lg.l: Quhen phebus fair wt bemis bricht
In to þe west at mornyng makis repair
makand his courss in to array full rycht
vnto the eist schutand his schaftis schare
at morn sall ryss out of his courss (curved line) to care
norward doun in to þe samyn degre
Than will my reuere[n]d lady rew on me
Quhen lawdiane law for luve hes left the land
and forth is fleitit to france that fair cuntre
and euery woma[n] is also obediand
quhe[n] men sall find no wattir in the se
and falsheid flymit and euery ma[n] fund trew
Tha[n] will my reuere[n]d lady on me rew
Quhen all the grund is groun or wt gold
and euery ryver ry[n]nis vpward wyne
In somer quhen thair growis (na, struck through) flour on fold
lg.note: (and euer yolk ma[n] hes conqueist kinrikis thre, struck through)
lg.l: In wontir quhe[n] thair fallis na frost ryme
quhen everilk ma[n] will till vþiris inclyne
In may quhe[n] þat the holyne changis hew
Than will my reuere[n] lady on me rew
Quhen falkland fair is farit our the ferry
and sulway sand is brocht attour the se
and arthour sait is (^ with do above, [brot] in margins, [or] above and struck through) (sett, struck through) to sailis berry
and euerilk ma[n] hes conqueist kinrikis thre
Than mon thay realmes ring in ryelte
quhen clerkis will na banifice p[er]sew
Than will my reuerend lady on me rew
Quhen þat dumbar is brocht vnto the bass
and all the fisch ar fled vp in þe air
Quhen þat northward no watteris will doun pass
and me[n] so rich þat thay desyr no mair
and leill luvaris forleitis luvis lair
and walx is wrocht wtouttin byk or be
Than will my reuerend lady rew on me
Quhen schippis off tour and ballingeris of weir
Be thowsand sailis rycht swiftly ondir saill
Thair mastis of gold and all thair vdir geir
The west wond wappand in thair taill
Takand thair courss wt mony how and haill
Pulland doun sailis and landand at eildoun tre
Tha[n] will my reuerend lady rew on me
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.l: Ballatis of remedy of luve as followis :
And to the reproche of evill weme[n]

head.title: So prayiss me as ȝe think causs quhy

lg.l: So prayiss me as ȝe think causs quhy
And lufe me as ȝow lykis best
As pleisis ȝow so plesit am I
Gif not I fynd of not I traist
Gif ȝe be trew I wilbe Iust
Gife ȝe be fals flattery is fre
all tymes and houris evin as ȝe lust
for me till vse als weill as ȝe
Gif ȝe do mok I will bot play
Gif ȝe do lawch I will not weip
Evin as ȝe list think do or say
Sic law ȝe mak Sic law I keip
Schaw fathfull lufe Luve sall ȝe haif
Schaw dowbilnes I sal ȝow quyt
ȝe ca[n] not vse nor no ways craif
bot evin þat same is my delyt
Bot gif ȝe wald be trew and plane
ȝe wald me pleiss and best co[n]tent
and gif ȝe will not so remane
as I haif said so am I lent
awyss ȝow as ȝe think to do
and vse me as ȝe list to fynd
quhat neidis lang talking þairto
For as I am ȝe knaw my mynd
Bewar þairfoir and tak gud heid
quhat is the sentens of this bill
For and ȝe beir me ocht at feid
I sall ȝow hald ay at evill w
Thairfoir be trew but vairiens
and I salbe as of befoir
vþirwayis generis discrepans
content ȝow this ȝe get no moir
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: I am as I am and so will I be

lg.l: I am as I am and so will I be
(h, struck through) Bot how that I am nane knawis trewlie
be it evill be it weill be I bund be I fre
I am as I am and so will I be
I Leid my lyfe Indifferently
I mene na thing bot honesty
and thot men Iuge dyuersly
I am as I am and so will I be
I do not rew nor ȝit complane
baith mirth and sadnes I do refrane
and vse the folkis þat ca[n] not fane
I am as I am be it plesor or pane
Diu[er]ss do Iuge as thay trow
Sum of plesour & sum of wo
ȝit for all that no thing thay knaw
I am as I am quhair evir I go
Bot sen þat Iugeris do tak þat wey
Lat every ma[n] his Iugeme[n]t say
I will it tak in sport and pley
ffor I am as I am quha evir sa nay
Quha Iugeis weill weill god him send
Quha Iugeis evill god thame amend
To Iuge þe best þ[er]foir intend
I am as I am and so will I end
ȝit sum þair be þat takis delyt (to, struck through)
To juge folkis (for, struck through) thot for Inwy & spyt
Bot quhiddir thay juge me (for, struck through) wra[n]g or ryt
I am as I am and so will I wryt
Praying ȝow all that this dois reid
To trest it as ȝe do ȝour creid
and not to think þat I chenge my weid
I am as I am how evir I speid
Bot how þat is I leif to ȝow
Iuge as ȝe list owdir fals or trew
ȝe knaw no moir tha[n] afoir ȝe knew
I am as I am quhat evir eschew
And frome this mynd I will not fle
Bot to ȝow all þat misiugeis me
I do protest as ȝe may se
That I am as I am and so will I be
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: Langour to leive allace

lg.l: Langour to leive allace
my labour Is in vane
Sen þair is nowþir grace
nor ȝit rewaird agane
Quhat sall I do or say
I am with sorrow slane
and dyis nicht & day
withowt hir luve agane
Was nevir ma[n] in erd
moir faithfull & moir plane
Suppois it be my werd
To luve vnluvit agane
I do luve best allane
my lady souerane
Thir ȝeiris mony ane
withowt hir luve agane
Ffor nowdir wald schew rew
nor beir me at disdane
bot lute me ay p[er]sew
withowt hir luve agane
Hir fenȝeit wordis fals
of richtnot maid me fane
and held me in the hals
To lufe vnluvit agane
And als the luik vnleill
of hir bricht fair ene twane
Gart me beleif alhaill
To haif hir luve agane
Bot sen I se hir hairt
and mynd is vncertane
I sall in tyme rewairt
my luve frome hir agane
Sen scho hes nowþir rewth
nor mercy suth to sane
Lat falset to vntrewth
and trest to trow agane
And sen my hairt is fre
I bid not for to lane
I sall awysit be
or I hir luve agane
Thairfoir my hairt tak heid
quhomefor thow suffer pane
and luik weill for remeid
or þat thow luve agane
Scho þat the list to luve
Se (þat, struck through) thow (suffer, struck through) with hir remane
and nevir moir remvue
bot luve hir best agane
Ffinis q Scott

head.title: Ffavour is fair, in luvis lair

lg.l: Ffavour is fair, in luvis lair,
ȝit freindschip mair, bene to co[m]mend
Bot quhair despair, bene adwersare
Nothing Is thair, Bot wofull End
Off men I mene, In serwice bene
of venus quene, but conforting
Be thame I wene, That mon sustene
The kairis kene, of cupeid king
Continwance, In cupeidis dance,
But discrepance, withowt remeid
Sic was my chance, in observance,
but reco[m]pance, my lyfe to leid
Hir court he Io, quhair evir thay go (mark, looks like $)
the lyfe is so, scho dois thame len
Quhair his hes wo, wtowttin ho,
he is sic fo, Till faythfull men
I speik expart, Suppois I smart
That scho hes gart, me thus lame[n]t
Bot this same darte, may causs hir harte
heir eftirwart, also repent
Sen so I se, to leif in le,
at libbertie, Is weill but wo
happie Is he, I say for me
Quhen he is fre, can hald him so
Ffinis q Scott

head.title: Thir lenterne dayis ar luvely lang

lg.l: Thir lenterne dayis ar luvely lang
and I will mvrne ne mair
nor for no mirthles may me mang
that will not for me cair
I wilbe glaid & latt hir gang
with falsat in hir fair
I fynd ane freschar feir to fang
baith of hyd hew and hair
The wintter nycht Is lang but weir
I may mvrne gif I will
Scho will not mvrne for me that cleir
thairfoir I wilbe still
O king of luve that is so cleir
I me acquyt ȝow till
Sa scho fra me & I fra hir
and not bot it be skill
O lord of luve how lykis the
My lemmens laitis vnleill
scho luvis ane vþir bettir tha[n] me
I haif causs to appeill
I pray to him þat deit on tre
that for ws all thold baill
mot send my (curved mark) le[m]mane twa or thre
Se[n] scho can not be leill
Vþir hes hir hairt sowld scho haif myne
trewly that war grit wrang
quhen thay haif play gif I haif pyne
on gallowis mot I hang
or for hir luve gif I declyne
(s, struck through) Thot scho ewill nevir so lang
quhe[n] I think on hir foirheid fyne
Tha[n] mon I sing ane sang
Off all the houris of the nycht
I can not tell ȝow ane
so mvrne I for my lady bricht
fro sleip haif me ourtane
fro scho be past owt of my sicht
The casting of ane stane
I haif no langour be this licht
I love god of his lane
Allace þat evir fader me gat
or moder me wend in clais
gif I sowld for ane woma[n]s saik
my lyfe thus leid in lais
for ȝe saw nevir so fair a caik
of meill þat millar mais
bot ȝit ane ma[n] wald get the maik
as gud luve cu[m]is as gais
q stewart

head.title: Returne thye hairt hamewart agane

lg.l: Returne th(y, struck through)e hairt hamewart agane
and byd quhair thow was wont to be
Thow art ane fule to suffer pane
for luve of hir þat luvis not the
my hairt lat be sic fantesie
Luve nane bot as they mak the causs
and lat hir seik ane hairt for the
for feind a crum of the scho fawis
To quhat effect sowld thow be thrall
but tha[n]k sen thow hes thy fre will
my hairt be not sa bestiall
Bot knaw quho dois the guid or ill
remane with me and tary still
and se quha playis best thair pawis
and lat fillok ga fling hir fill
Ffor feind accrum of the scho fawis
Thocht scho be fair I will not fenȝie
scho is the kynd of vþiris ma
Ffor quhy thair is a fellone me[n]ȝie
that semis gud and ar not sa
my hairt tak nowdir pane nor wa
for meg for meriory or ȝit mawis
bot be thow glaid and latt hir ga
for feind accrum of the scho fawis
Becaus I find scho tuik in Ill
at hir dep[ar]ting Thow mak na cair
bot all begyld go quhair scho will
(be, struck through) schrew the hairt that mane makis mair
my hert (mo, struck through) be mirry lait and air
this is the fynall end and clauss
and latt hir fallow ane filly fair
for feind a crum of the scho fawis
Ffinis q alexr scott to his hert

head.title: Quhen ȝe wer plesit to pleiss me hertfully

lg.l: Quhen ȝe wer plesit to pleiss me hertfully
I was applesit to pleiss ȝow sickerly
Sen ȝe ar pleisit To pleiss ane vþir wy
Be nocht displesit To pleiss quhair plesit am I
[etc]
Author unknown

head.title: Quhy sowld I luve bot gif I war luvit

lg.l: Quhy sowld I luve bot gif I war luvit
Quhy sowld I sett myne hert in variance
Quhy sowld I do the thing to be reprovit
Vnto my spreit it war richt grit grevance
Quhy sowld I schamefully thus me avance
To lovin on and scho not loving me
Than war I gydit with misgovirnance
That I sowld luve and I not lovit be
[etc]
Author unknown

head.title: Irkit I am wt langu[m] luvis lair

lg.l: Irkit I am wt (inwart siching sair) langu[m] luvis lair
oursett with Inwart siching sair,
for in the presone of dispair, I ly
Seing Ilk wicht gettis sum weilfair, bot I
My hairt is pynd and persit so with panis
quhill teiris over my visage ranis
and makis the blud within my vanis,, To dry
Quha ma sic greif resist aganis,, Bot I
My mad misfortoun dois me so co[m]mve
thy I may nowthir rest nor ruve
Bot wary all the goddis abve, The sky
That every leid obtenis thair luve, bot I
All nobill hairtis of nateur Ar inclynd
quhair thay find constance to be kynd
Thairfoir to me scho sowld hir mynd, apply
Sen non Is for hir p[er]sone pynd, bot I
The facultie of famenene Is so
vnto thair freind To be his fo
Syne menis him Quhe[n] he is ago, for thy
vncourtesly thus keill thay mo, tha[n] I
Thay covet not the ma[n] that thay may get
for him Thay hald as propper det
on strangeris ay thair myndis ar sett to spy
Thus mo bene fetterit with thair net, nor I
Grit fule I am to follow the delyte
of thame that hes no faith p[er]fyte
Thairfoir sic cumpany I quyt, denny
off all my wo hes non the wyt, bot I
Quhat woundir Is thot I do weip and pleid
This fellon crewall lyfe I leid
The quhilk but dowt wilbe my deid, In hy
ffor every ma[n] obtenis remeid, bot I
My lady hes ane hairt of stone so hard
(for, struck through) on me to rew scho hes no regard
bot bustously I am debard, ay by
and every ma[n] gettis sum reward, bot I
Ffinis q Montgomery

head.title: I mvse and m[er]vellis in my mynd

lg.l: I mvse and m[er]vellis in my mynd
Quhat way to wryt or put in verss
The quent consaitis of weme[n]kynd
or half thair havingis to reherss
I fynd thair haill affectioun
So contrair thair co[m]plexioun
Ffor quhy no leid vnleill thay leit
vntrewth expresly thay expell
ȝit thay ar planeist and repleit
of falset and dissait thair sell
So find I thair affectioun
Contrair thair complexioun
Thay favour no wayis fuliche men
and verry few of thame ar wyiss
all gredy p[er]sonis thay misken
and thay ar full of covettyiss
So find [etc]
Contrair [etc]
I can thame call bot kittie vnsellis
That takkis sic maneris at thair motheris
To bid me[n] keip thair secreit counsailis
Syne schaw the same agane till vþiris
So find I thair affectioun
Contrair thar awin co[m]plexioun
Thay lawch with thame that thay dispyt
and with thair lykingis thay lame[n]t
of thair wanhap thay ley the wyt
on thair leill luvaris Innocent
So fynd [etc]
Contrair [etc]
Thay wald be rewit and hes no rewth
Thay wald be menit and no man menis
Thay wald be trowit and hes no trewth
Thay wiss thair will that skant weill wenys
So fynd [etc]
Contrair [etc]
Thay forge the freindschip of the fre[m]mit
and fleis the favour of ther freindis
Thay wald with nobill men be ne[m]mit
syne laittandly to lawar leindis
So find I thair affectioun
Contrair thair co[m]plexioun
Thay lichtly sone and covettis quickly
Thay blame ilk body and thay blekit
Thay Eindill fast And dois ill lickly
Thay sklander saikles & thay suspectit
So find [etc]
Contrair [etc]
Thay wald haif all men bund & thrall
to thame, And thay for to be fre
Thay covet ilkma[n] at thair call
And thay to leif at libirtie
So fynd [etc]
Contrar [etc]
Thay tak delyt in m[ar]tiall deidis
And ar of nature tremebund
thay wald me[n] nvreist all thair neidis
Syne confortles lattis thame confound
So [etc]
Contrar [etc]
Thay wald haif wating on alway
but gwerdoun genȝeild or rewaird
Thay wald haif reddy serwandis ay
but reconpans tha[n]k or rewaird
So find I thair affectioun
Contrair [etc]
The vertew of this writ and vigour
Maid in co[m]parisone it is
That famenene ar of this figour
quhilk clippit is antiphracis
for quhy thair haill affectioun
Is co[n]trair thair co[m]plexioun
I wat gud weme[n] will not wyt me
nor of this sedull be eschamit
for be thay courtas thay will quyt me
And gif thay crab heir I quyt clame it
Co[n]fessand thair affection
Conforme to þair co[m]plexioun
q Scott

head.title: Ffane wald I luve bot quhair abowt

lg.l: Ffane wald I luve bot quhair abowt
Thair Is so mony luvaris þairowt
That thair Is left no place to me
quhairof I hovit now in dowt
gif I sowld luve or lat it be
Sa mony ar thair ladeis treitis
with trivmphand amowres balleitis
and dois þair bewteis pryiss so he
That I find not bot daft consaitis
to say of luve Bot lat it be
Sum thinkis his lady lustiest
Sum haldis his lady for the best
Sum sayis Is luve is a per se
Bot sum forswth ar so opprest
with luve wer bettir lat it be
Sum for his ladyis luve lyis seik
Suppois scho comptis it not a leik
and sum drowpis doun as he wold die
Sum strykis doun a threid bair cheik
for luve war bettir lat it be
Sum luvis lang and lyis behind
Sum luvis and freindschip can not fynd
Sum festnit is and ma not fle
Sum led is lyk the belly blynd
wt luve wer bettir lat it be
Thot luve be grene in gud curage
and be difficill till asswage
The end of it Is miserie
misgovernit ȝowth makis gowsty age
forbeir ȝe not & lat it be
Bot quha p[er]fytly wald Imprent
sowld fynd his luve moist p[er]manent
Luve god, thy prince, and freind all thre
treit weill thy self and stand content
and latt All vþir luvaris be
Ffinis q Clerk

head.title: In Iune the Iem, of Ioy and geme

lg.l: In Iune the Iem, of Ioy and geme,
this prese[n]t to co[m]pyle express
but hurt but wem, or wind to stem,
Inarmit I am, with haviness
wantone in weill bot wo, (Gla, struck through)
Glaid wtowt greif also,
and fre of every fo [mark, looks like circle with diagonal line through] \ That I confess
I maik it plane, for luve agane,
Thair sall no sorrow in me synk
Nor ȝit in vane, to suffer pane
To stop frome sleip frome meit or drink
Thair Is no lady fre
that and scho favour me
scho will nocht thoill to se (squiggly line beside last two lines, [me pyne I think] beside line)
Be scho conte[n]t of corss & rent,
all salbe hirss that I may get hir
will scho absent, hyne sall I went
and, (struck through word, unclear, [at] above) als littill valor sethir
Quhair power ma not plaiss
adew wtowt diseiss
als gud luve cu[m]is as gais (squiggly line beside last two lines, [or raþir bettir] beside line)
Quhen scho growis heich I draw on dreich,
To vesy and behald the end
Quhen scho growis skeich, I byd on beich
To lat hir in the brydill bend
Quhe[n] schow growis meik and (ty, struck through) tame
Scho salbe wylcome hame
Gif scho my luve quyt clame (squiggly line beside last two lines, [I sall not kend] beside line)
Pleiss scho to rew, I sall p[er]sew
with subiect serwyice every sessone
Be scho vntrew, fairweill adew
for as scho chaingis I sall cheiss one
Bot gif scho steidfast stand
and be not wariand
I am at hir co[m]mand (squiggly line beside last two lines, looks like {, [conforme to ressone] beside line)
Ffinis q Scott

head.title: Thair is not ane winche þat I se

lg.l: Thair is not ane winche þat I se
Sall win ane wantage of me
Be scho fals I salbe sle
and say to dispyt hir
be scho trew I will confyd (^ with dot above)
will scho remane I sall abyd
will scho slip I will bot slyd
and so sall I quyt hir
Be scho constant and trew
I sall evir hir p[er]sew
be scho fals tha[n] adew
(Lo, struck through) No langer I tary
Be scho fathfull in mynd
I salbe to hir inclynd
be scho strange & vnkynd
I gif hir to fary
Be scho haltand and he
Ryt swa sall scho fynd me
Be scho lawly and fre
The suth I sall say hir
Be scho secreit and wyiss
I sall await on hir serwyiss
will scho glaik & go nyiss
I leif hir to play hir
And I magyn my mailis
I sall feid hir wt caillis
Thot my sawis haif no seillis
I sall leir hir to fan
be scho wylie as ane tod
quhen scho winkis I sall nod
Scho sall not begyle me be god
for ocht þat scho ca[n]
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: To luve vnluvit it is ane pane

lg.l: To luve vnluvit it is ane pane
Ffor scho þat is my souerane
Sum wantoun ma[n] so he hes set hir
That I ca[n] get no lufe agane
Bot brekis my hairt & not the (bethi, struck through) bettir

lg.note: Quhe[n] þat I went wt þt sweit may
To dance to sing To sport and pley
and oft tymes in my armis plet hir
lg.l: I do now mvrne both nycht & day
and brekis my hart & not the bettir
Quhair I wes wont to se hir go
rycht trymly passand to and fro
with cumly smylis quhe[n] þat I met hir
and now I leif (b, struck through) in pane & wo
and brekis [etc]
Quhattane ane glaikit fule am I
To slay my self wt malancoly
Sen weill I ken I may not get hir
or quhat suld be the caus and quhy
To brek [etc]
My hairt sen thow may not hir pleiss
adew as gud lufe cu[m]is as gaiss
Go chuss ane vdir and forȝet hir
God gif him dolour and diseiss
That brekis thair hairt and not the bettir
Ffinis q Scott quhe[n] his wyfe left him

head.title: My hart is quhyt, and no delyte, I haif of ladeis fair

lg.l: My hart is quhyt, and no delyte, I haif of ladeis fair
I wyte, I flyte, all in dispyte, þat evir I leird þat lair
Tit but respyte, I clene þe quyte, for now and evir mair
Thairfoir I dyte, þis writt p[er]fyte, ffairweill now feildis fair
The suth is so, be god my Io, I will fenȝe na mair
Thot vmqle grit wes appetite, Thair is wa[n] tyme of wair
Stopping in aige, he on staige, and ȝowtheid went & done
and my curege, hes tane to swaige, ryt lait eft[er] none
quhe[n] I wes pege, I did vaslege, and sped my era[n]d sone
now is þat rege, turnd in dotage, it is auld of the mone
The suth is so, be god my Io, quyt turnit is þat tone
gud aile & sege, salbe my waige, away ligging alone
The flesche is fawin, wes vmquhile brawin, I list not for to pley
The medowss mawin, the claith is drawin, þe grace is said away
The seid wes sawin, full quyt hes blawin, þe Ioly wind of may
I mak it knawin, for all ȝor lawin, I haif done as I may
The suth is so be god my Io, it is to ȝow I say
Thot ȝe wer gawin, (The, struck through) ȝe bourd but hawin The tyd is past away
Ane proclamatioun, vnto all natioun, I mak heir be þis bill
ane sicker stratioun, god hes laid one, Thay fructis hes tane him till
Stufe is þ[er] none but questioun, remanis bot gud will
now fair on, wt my benysone, on forss I mon ly still
The suth is so, be god my Io, off Iy[n]ny nor of Iill
I pleiss collatioun, & recreatioun latt þame go fling þ[er] fill
The man I call, vnnaturall, þat stewarts Ill him sell
That hes bot small, stufe corporall, Syne schutis at þat schell
quhe[n] principall, and materiall, & natur is expell
Tha[n] be the wall, he lyis our thrall, gar bring him the ha[n]d bell
The suth is fo, quhe[n] dry my Io, of natur growis the well
To seik our all na stufe thow sall
ffor no gold get to sell [etc]
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: In all this warld no man may wit

lg.l: In all this warld no man may wit
Thair no power nor knawlege may
the counsale craft nor kyndnes keip it
na Trest in It þat weme[n] will say
The knot þat I wend had bene knit
of luve and faithfulnes for ay
I se it lowisd and luve is flit
Quhat hand may had that will away
To ȝow madame this I indyte
That lang ȝor trew lufe haif I bene
Commending me greiting I wryt
for ȝour fre[m]mit que[n]tance vnclene
ȝe wait ȝour self quhat that I mene
I neid nocht mair planely to say
god wald I had ȝow nevir sene
Quhat hand may had that will away
Befoir I womit and now I wait
be evidence the sowth I se
allace quhat alit me be so blait
for to lufe hir þat luvit not me
I haif hard say and sa haif ȝe
this proverb oft in sport & play
God wait the blind eitis mony a fle
Quhat [etc]
ȝour gudly wordis maid me to trest
that all ȝour talking had bene trew
I was dissauit sone in haist
The cleth was of ane vþir hew
That I wend had bene reid was blew
That semit ane syiss was bot ane tray
Bot p[er]rellis may no ma[n] eschew
Quhat [etc]
Oft tymes hes it bene red and told
Be vitty me[n] that vndirstude
all glittrand thing is not of gold
And ilk fair apill Is not gude
ane seik heid in a skarlet huid
oft haiss (we, struck through) it bene this we heirsay
ȝour fenȝeit luve Is lyk the flud
Quhat hand may hald þat will away
Fforswth I am infortunate
to ladeis luve þat rew I soir
and Had I wist was me to latt
keipand the reirgaird evirmoir
he was richt wyis that knew befoir
The cairfull end of every fray
Quhat sall I wryt I can no moir
Quhat hand may hald þat will
Now quho so evir hewis to hie
I heir men say and swth it is
The spailis will fall and hurtis Ee
and swa it fairis be me I wiss
I was full lewd to love ladeis
with riches dar not poverty play
I dar not say thair is a miss
Quhat [etc]
Was nene in all the warld I drest
to thame sa weill my hairtis disclois
as to ȝow lady for luve & trest
Bot all þat haif I to forlois
Ffast by the nettill growis the rois
and eftir dark nycht cu[m]is the day
Men sayis als gud luve cu[m]is as gois
Quhat hand may hald þat will away
Ffra this tyme furth knaw ȝe richt weill
and vndirstand quhat Is my p[ar]te
The thing þat ȝe sett at ȝour heill
I will no moir sett at my harte
fra wo Io Ioy I will rewairt
No man may ganecall ȝistirday
ȝour vnkyndnes now garris me smairt
Quhat hand may hald þat will away
The last lettir I to ȝow sent
I wret it as a man steidfast
with all my hairt in guid entent
owt of ȝour mynd now is it past
and þairfoir this salbe the last
I leif wrytting and thus I say
furth of my mynd ȝe salbe cast
Quhat hand may hald þat will away
Ffinis
Author unknown

head.title: My lawtie garris me be lichtleit allaik

lg.l: My lawtie garris me be lichtleit allaik
ȝour luve lestis not I had it bot of lane
all ȝoure unkyndnes compt I not a kaik
Ffor I sall get als gud quhe[n] ȝe ar gane
will god I sall not weir the siching bene
nor walk on nichttis Thocht ȝe haif wrocht me wrangis
I lyk richt weill I latt ȝour luve allane
God be ȝour (odd mark) gyd als gud luve cu[m]is as gangis
[etc] and vþ[er]
Author unknown

head.title: I luve and I Say not

lg.l: I luve and I Say not
I wald and I may not
Oscula si tibi det
Bewar with weme[n]s wrinkis
Mony wylis hir vmbethinkis
Me te discipiet
[etc]
Author unknown

head.title: Ane of the warst þat evir was in erd

lg.l: Ane of the warst þat evir was in erd
was geȝabell as storyis makis me[n]tioun
for in the bybill ȝe may baith see & heird
