Bot he the wirker þat put in hir sic grace
off bewty bontie richess tyme or space
And every gudness þat bene to cum or gone
The thank redoundis to him in every place
all luve is lost bot vpone god allone
O nychtingall it wer a story nyce
That luve suld not depend on cherite
and gife þat vertew contrair be to vyce
Tha[n] lufe mon be a vertew as thinkis me
Ffor ay to lufe invy mone contrair be
god bad eik lufe thy nychtbor fro the splene
and quho tha[n] ladeis suetar nychboris be
a lusty lyfe in lufe seruice bene
The nychtingaill said bird quhy dois thow raif
ma[n] may tak in his lady sic delyt
him to forȝet þat hir sic vertew gaif
and for his hevin rassaif hir cullour quhyt
hir goldin tressit hairis redomyt
Lyk to appollois bemis thot thay schone
Suld not him blind fro lufe þat is p[er]fyt
all lufe is lost bot vpone god allone
The merle said lufe is causs of honor ay
Luve makis cowardis manheid to purchass
Luve makis knyttis hardy at assey
Luve makis wrechis full of lergeness
Luve makis sueir folkis full of bissiness
Luve makis sluggirdis fresche and weill besene
Luve changis vyce in vertewis nobilness
a lusty lyfe in luvis seruice bene
The nychtingaill said trew is þe contrary
Sie frustir luve it blindis me[n] so far
In to þair myndis it makis thame to vary
In fals vane glory þai so drunkin ar
Thair wit is went of wo þai ar not war
Quhill þat all wirchip away be fro thame gone
Ffame guddis and strenth quhairfoir weill say I dar
all luve is lost Bot vpone god allone
Than said the merle myn errour I confess
This frustir luve all is bot vanite
Blind ignorance me gaif (thame, struck through) sic (ignora[n]ce, struck through) hardiness
To argone so agane the varite
Quhairfoir I counsall every ma[n] that he
wt lufe not in þe feindis net be tone
Bot luve the luve þat did for his lufe de
all lufe is lost bot vpone god allone
Than sang thay both wt vocis lowd and cleir
The merle sang man lufe god þat hes the wrot
The nychtingall sang ma[n] lufe the lord most deir
That the and all this warld maid of nocht
The merle said luve him þat thy lufe hes socht
fra hevin to erd and heir tuk flesche and bone
The nychtingall sang and wt (the, struck through) his deid the bocht
all luve is lost bot vpone him allone
Thane flaw thir birdis our the bewis schene
Singing of lufe amang the levis small
Quhois ythand pleid ȝit maid my thotis grene
Bothe sleping walking (in, struck through) restand in* travall
me to reconfort most it dois awaill
agane for lufe quhe[n] lufe I ca[n] find none
To think how song this merle and nychtingaill
all lufe is lost bot vpone god allone
Ffinis q dumbar

head.title: Now cumis aige quhair ȝewth hes bene

lg.l: Now cu[m]is aige quhair ȝewth hes bene
and trew luve rysis fro the splene
Now culit is dame venus brand
Trew luvis fyre is ay kindilland
and I begyn to vndirstand
In feynit luve quhat foly bene
now cu[m]is aige quhair ȝewth hes bene
and trew luve rysis fro the splene
Quhill venus fyre be deid and cauld
Trew luvis fyre nevir birnis bauld
So as the ta lufe vaxis auld
The toþir dois incress moir kene
now cu[m]is aige qr ȝewt hes bene
and trew lufe rysis fro the splene
No ma[n] hes curege for to wryte
quhat plesans is in lufe p[er]fyte
That hes in fenȝeit lufe delyt
Thair kyndness is so co[n]trair clene
now cu[m]is aige [etc]
and trew lufe [etc]
Full weill is him þat may Imprent
or onywayiss his hairt consent
To turne to trew luve his intent
and still the quarrell to sustene
now cu[m]is aige qr ȝewth hes bene
and trew lufe rysis fro þe splene
I haif experie[n]ce by my sell
In luvis court anis did I dwell
Bot quhair I of a joy cowth tell
I culd of truble tell fyftene
now cu[m]is aige [etc]
and trew lufe rysis [etc]
Befoir quhair þat I wes in dreid
now haif I confort for to speid
quhair I had maugre to my meid
I trest rewaird and tha[n]kis betuene
now cu[m]is aige [etc]
and trew [etc]
Quhair lufe wes wont me to displeis
now find I in to lufe grit eiss
quhair I had denger and diseiss
my breist all confort dois co[n]tene
now [etc]
and [etc]
Quhair I wes hurt wt Ielosy
And wald no luver wer bot I
now quhair I lufe I wald all wy
als weill as I luvit I wene
now [etc]
and [etc]
Befoir quhair I durst not for schame
my lufe discure nor tell hir name
now think I wirschep wer and fame
To all þe warld þat it war sene
now cu[m]is aige quhair ȝewt hes bene
and trew lufe rysis fro the splene
Befoir no wicht I did co[m]plene
So did hir denger me (me, struck through) derene
And now I sett not by a bene
hir bewty nor hir twa fair ene
now [etc]
and [etc]
I haif a luve farar of face
quhome in no denger may haif place
quhilk will me guerdoun gif and grace
and m[er]cy ay quhe[n] I me mene
now cu[m]is aige qr ȝewth hes bene
and trew lufe rysis fro the splene
Vnquyt I do no thing nor sane
nor wairis a luvis thot in vane
I salbe als weill luvit agane
Thair may no jangler me prevene
now cu[m]is aige qr ȝewt hes bene
And trew luve rysis fro the splene
So riche so rewthfull and discreit
ane lufe so fare so gud so sueit
and for the kynd of ma[n] so meit
nevir moir salbe nor ȝit hes bene
now [etc]
and [etc]
Is none sa trew a luve as he
That for trew lufe of ws did de
he suld be luffit agane think me
(So, struck through) That wald sa fane or (my, struck through) luve obtene
now cu[m]is [etc]
and trew [etc]
Is non but grace of god I wiss
That ca[n] in ȝewth considdir thiss
This fals dissavand warldis bliss
So gydis ma[n] in floris grene
now cu[m]is aige quhair ȝewth hes bene
And trew luve ry fro the splene
Ffinis q dumbar

head.title: Quha lykis to luve, or þat law pruve

lg.l: Quha lykis to luve, or þat law pruve
Lat him beleif this lyfe to leid
His mynd sall moif, but rest or ruve
wt diu[er]ss dolouris to þe deid
he sall tyne appetyte
and meit and sleip gife quyte
and want þe way perfyte
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [To find remeid] beside line)

lg.l: HE sall not wit, quhiddir þat It,
Be panefull, plesand, weill or wo
To stand or sit, remoif or flit,
To gang, To ly, To byd or go
No wit salbe degest
To heir, se, smell nor test
Bot as a brutall best
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [he sall be so] beside line)

lg.l: Ffle thot he wald, lufe sall him hald,
wtin þe dungeoun of dispair
quhyle hett quhyle (q, struck through) cald, a thowsand fald
his purpoiss salbe heir and thair
he sall hald wisdome vyce
and vertew of no pryce
Bot as a fule vnwyce
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [So sall he fair] beside line)

lg.l: This is the quhy, and causs þat I
Complene so peteously in plane
I lufe þe wy, will not apply
nor grant to gife me grace agane
The moir seruice I do
The moir fre[m]mit is scho
wtout respect vnto
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [my crewall pane] beside line)

lg.l: ȝe luvaris se, Gife þat this be
ane lyfe þat all gude me[n] malingis
I say for me, It is to fle
aboif þe pest and plaig þat ringis
Quhilk is bot curius
ay woid and furius
and fyre sulfurius
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [That me[n] doun bringis] beside line)

lg.l: My brethir deir, we most forbeir,
and fra this sinfull lyfe evaid ws
Lat ressoun steir, ȝour hairtis inteir
And not thoill lathly lust to leid ws
Quhilk is þe verry net
That satane for ws set
To causs ws quyt forȝet
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [The lord þat maid ws] beside line)

lg.l: FFinis q Scott

head.title: Lo quhat it is to lufe

lg.l: Lo quhat it is to lufe
Lerne ȝe that list to prufe
be me (I, struck through) I say, that no ways may
The grund of greif remvfe
bot still decay, both nycht and day
Lo quhat it is to lufe
Lufe is ane fervent fyre
kendillit wtout desyre
Schort plesour, lang displesour
Repentence is the hyre
ane pure tressour, wtout mesour
Lufe is ane ferve[n]t fyre
To lufe and to be wyiss
To rege wt gud ad wyiss
now thus now tha[n], So gois the game
In certane is the dyiss
Thair is no ma[n], I say that ca[n],
both lufe and to be wyiss
Fle alwayis frome þe snair
Lerne at me to be ware
It is ane pane, and dowbill trane
of endles wo and cair
for to refrane that (endles pane, struck through) denger plane
Fle alwayis frome þe snair
q Scott

head.title: Pansing of lufe quhat lyf it leidis

lg.l: Pansing of lufe quhat lyf it leidis
My will express wt ressoun pleidis
and not I fynd to stop þair feidis
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [plane] beside line)
lg.l: bot lufe to reput best remeid is, vane
And trew it is bot vanite
Ffor luk quha ar in lufe most he
p[er]chance may fynd þe fyne salbe
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [pane] beside line)
lg.l: and till esteme it or thay de, vane
Ffor thot in lust of lufe sum lyis
So lang wtout remeid to ryss
It sall not faill to mak þame twyss
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [fane] beside line)
lg.l: Ffra thay leif play to think þe pryss, vane
Quhat noble me[n] hes hurt þ[er] name
and lusty ladeis lost þair fame
Quhat weme[n] micht not sor þair wame
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [lane] beside line)
lg.l: Bot oppinly thair lufe proclame, vane
My counsale is ȝe leif lufe allone
Lufe lelaly and lufe bot one
and su[m] example tak be Iohine
lg.note: (Curved line beside last three lines, [mane] beside line)
lg.l: or ȝe sall think ȝour tyme bygone vane
Author unknown

head.title: Quhome sould I wyt of my mischance

lg.l: Quhome sould I wyt of my mischance
Bot cupeid king of variance
Thy court wtout considerance
lg.note: (Curved line ebside last two lines, [quhen I it knew] beside line)
lg.l: or evir maid þe observance, Sa far I rew
Thow and thy law ar instrumentis
off diu[er]ss inconvenientis
Thy seruice mony soir repentis / knawing þe quarrell
Quhen body honor & substance schentis and saule in p[er]rell
Quhat is thy manre[n]t bot mischeif
Sturt angir grunching yre and greif
Evill lyfe and langour but relief / off woundis wan
Displesour pane and he repreif, off god and man
Thow loviss þame þat lowdest leis
and followis fastest on þame fleis
Thow lychtleis all trew prop[er]teis / off luve express
and markis quhair nevir styme thow seis, Bot hittis be gaiss
Blynd buk bot at þe bound thow schutis
and þame forbeiris þat the rebutis
Thow ryvis þair hairtis ay fra þe rutis / quhilk ar thy awin
and cureis þame curis not thre cutis / to be misknawin
Thow art in freyndschip wt þi fo
and fre[m]mit to thy freynd also
Thow flemis all faythfull me[n] the fro / of steidfast thot
Regarding non bot þame ago / That curis the not
Thow chirreiss þame þat wt þe chyddis
and baneisss þame wt þe abydis
Thow hess þi horne ay in þair sydis / That ca[n] not fle
Thay furdir werst in the confydis / I say for me
Ffinis q scott

head.title: O man transformit and vnnaturall

lg.l: O ma[n] transformit and vnnaturall
O trublit spreit possest wt frenesye
Allace is all thy wit prudenciall
In vane co[n]saittis and profound fantesy
Thrut apprehensionis of mallancoly
generit thrut lust of sensuall affectione
quhilk hes exylit ressone & affectione
Quhair is thy knawlege and Intendme[n]t
And thy ryp wit in solist bissiness
Quhair is thy wisdome & gud Iugeme[n]t
Quhair is thy pastance and solaciusness
Quhair is thy strenth sowld mortefy distress
Quhair is thy prude[n]t verteuss c[on]versatioun
Quhill wulgaris haldis of sa grit estimatioun
Thow dois becum war nor ane brutall beist
In profound pane provokand thy awin deid
Quhen thow in luve lyis lyk ane gryislie gaist
Heit as þe fyre and calder nor þe leid
wt vane consaitis all farsit is thy heid
Destitut of vertew and of grace
Lame[n]tand vane consaitis crya[n]d allace
Wt sobbis and sichis and mony ane suspyir
Torme[n]tand þair thy self in till ane trance
The quhilk haldis (h, struck through) all thy body in ane fyre
Becauss thy heid is full of varia[n]ce
and blyndis thy richt spreitis wt dull Ignora[n]ce
Provokand thy desyre to leif solitar
To end thy dayis in langissing and cair

lg.note: (Wt sobbis, struck through)

lg.l: Thow garris me marvell mair tha[n] I ca[n] mene
Becauss thow art þe maist fule now o[n] lyfe
The dropis be pairis fallis fra thy ene
Rarand lyk ane ȝung barne or ane seik wyfe
Desyrand thy awin deid wt swerd or knyf
Thairfoir vyce me[n] sowld mak for þe no mane
Becauss thow art all wt þe glaikis ourgane
And ȝe auld man ȝour puerilitie
Is gane lang syne and thow art cu[m] till aige
Thairfoir thy eild sowld end wt honestie
and in lufe to ra[m]meiss and to rege
For paramoris in (amoris, struck through) ald me[n] is dottage
Thow sowld vpoun thy bukis and beidis co[n]tempill
The quhilk sowld be to ȝung me[n] gud exempill
The devyne prude[n]t plato sayis express
That quhan me[n]is ene becu[m]is bleird and obscure
and quhan þair cheikis ar full of skrumpilness (^ with dot above) r quha[n] þ[er] (heidis, cut off) na excess in (drynk, cut off) (indure, cut off)
Than thay sowld provyd for þair sepulture
and to co[n]verss in vertew day & hour
and not to leif in lust and paramour
And Ihus sircht quhilk was sapient
he held thre vycis maist abhominable
ane was quha[n] me[n] of riches or of rent
vsit to lie lesingis detestable
The secund was nane sowld hald for a fable
That is quhe[n] me[n] ar in pouerty pynd
Syne growis in hicht (qu, struck through) wt ane ambitius mynd
And the thrid vyce he held maist odius
Becauss it is þe vylest of þe thre
That is quhen me[n] of aige ar vicius
vsand þair lust and sensualitie
wemen takkis als grit (lait, struck through) plesour for to se
ane man of aige in amoris for to carp
as quhe[n] thay heir ane ass play on a harp
Ryt seyndill in to landis quhair I haif bene
I saw nevir auld men oft luve paramour
Nor ȝit it wes nevir in no cuntre sene
That wemen did luve auld me[n] day or hour
Thot sum wemen be sene be avingtour
To kiss and clap auld men be luvis feir
Sic fenȝeit luve thay schaw to get thair geir
Thairfoir thow sowld richt prude[n]tly perpend
The denger The dishonor and (þe, struck through) defame
off povertie or ane mischevous end
Quhilk cu[m]is of men of aige that tynis gud name
Quha[n] ȝung me[n] dois sic thing It is na schame
Becauss ȝowtheid garris thair blude flow & rege
bot auld me[n]is lust proceidis of daft dotage
And sen thy blude Is becum cawld and dry
and als thy flesche and banis co[n]sumys for eild
Thairfoir thow sowld (lufe, struck through) leif wantone chevalry
off venus warkis and to gif our þe feild
and nevir to beir in amoris speir nor scheild
Bot rathir at ane hett fyre the to hold
wt ane sydgoun to keip the fra þe cold
Thow hes mair mistir of ane dowbill cap
nor of þe farest lady in to france
Wt mittanis warme thy tendir handis to hap
Nor for to se thy deir lufe sing or dance
Restoratyvis be wyiss me[n]is ordina[n]ce
wt sweit confectionis sowld be thy confort
Rathir nor wt fresche ladeis for till sport
The messingeris of deid dois the asselȝe
The quhilk no ma[n] nor woma[n] may ganestand
Thy memberis and thy strenth begy[n]nis to felȝe
for butt ane staff thow may not skantlie stand
Thairfoir gif thow be wyiss do my co[m]mand
and to putt wemen cleir furt of thy mynd
Becauss to men of aige thay ar vnkynd
Thot thow be coistlie cled in cap and goun
Lyk the ȝung galȝard gallandis in all thing
And als thy claiss maid of þe new fassoun
And on thy finȝeris mony Ioly ring
ȝit thy gray berd ȝung wemen sall maling
Thairfoir thow sall putt thame furt of thy mynd
Becauss to me[n] of aige thay ar vnkynd
(To the madin, in margins) And noble ladeis and sweit creatoris
I exort ȝow naturaly to Intend
The crewall and vnhappy aventoris
Be Iugeme[n]t devyne quhilk god dois send
Schame pouerty or ane vyle suddane end
on þame that maculattis pudicitie
adherand to þair sensualitie
The noble giftis of chestitie precell
off vertewis it is maist principall
na p[er]sone can expreme defyne nor tell
The godly vertew virginiall
Ffor the devyne theologgis vniu[er]sall
and auld awttoris of maist excelle[n]t gre
aboif all giftis thay preffer chestitie
Thairfoir gif ȝe wald keip pudicitie
ȝe sowld Extremely detest vane amoris
And to fle evill occasioun specialie
as is foirsaid be ornat oratoris
and als ȝe sowld prepend bayt day & horis
To grit mischeif misery and neid
Ffra paramoris dois evir mair succeid
Ffinis q weddirburne

head.title: ȝe blindit luvaris luke

lg.l: ȝe blindit luvaris luke
The rekless lyfe ȝe leid
Espy the snair and huke
That haldis ȝow be þe heid
Thairfoir I reid remeid
To leife and lat It be
for lufe hes non at feid
bot fulis þat can not fle
Quhat is ȝor lufe bot lust
ane littill for delyte
ane beistly game robust
To reif ȝour ressoun quyte
ane fowsum appetyte
That strenth of p[er]soun waikis
ane pastance vnperfyte
To smyte ȝow wt þe glaikis
Quhair sensuall lust proceidis
all honest lufe is pynd
ȝe ma co[m]pair ȝour deidis
vnto ane brutall kynd
fra vertew be contrynd
to follow vyce, co[n]siddir
That ressoun wit and mynd
Ar all ago togiddir
The wysest woma[n] þairout
wt wirdis may be wyllit
To do þe deid but dout
That honour hes exyllit
how mony ar begyllit
and few I fynd þat chaipis
Thairfoir ȝour faithis ar fylit
To frawd thay silly aipis
ȝe mak regaird for grace
quhair nevir grace ȝit grew
ȝe lang to ryn the race
That ane or baith sall rew
ȝe preiss ay to p[er]sew
Thair syte and ȝour awin sorrow
ȝe trest to find thame trew
That nevir wes be forrow
ȝe cry on cupeid king
and venus quene in vane
ȝe send all maner thing
wt trattillis thame to trane
ȝe preiche ȝe fleich ȝe frane
ȝe grane ay quhill ([ȝe] struck through, [thay] above) grant
ȝor prettikis ar profane
pure ladeis to supplant
ȝe schowt as ȝe wer schent
Thay swoun to se ȝow smartit
ȝe rame as ȝe wer rent
and thay ar rewthfull hairtit
ȝour play ar sone p[er]uertit
fra þat thair belly ryss
Thay wary ȝow þat gartit
and ȝe thame Inlykwyss
ȝit thair is lesum lufe
That lawtfully suld lest
he is not to reprufe
that is wt ane possest
That band I hald it best
and not to pass attour
bot ȝe ca[n] tak no rest
quhill thay kast vp all four
Sic luvaris seyndill meitis
bot ladeis ay forlorne is
quhe[n] thay bewaill and greitis
Sum of ȝow lawchis and skornis
ȝour hecht ȝour aith mensworne is
ȝour lippis ar lyk burd lyme
I hald ȝe want bot hornis
as bukkis in belling tyme
ȝe trattill and ȝe tyst
quhill thay forȝet þair fame
ȝe trane þame to ane tryst
and þair ȝe get þame tame
thay sussy not for schame
nor castis not quhat cu[m]is syne
bot quhen ȝe claw þair wame
Thay tu[m]myll our lyk swyne
Thot ([þat] struck through, [ȝung] above) p[er]wersit ([natouris], with the [na] covering the beginning of the word [creatouris])
To palȝardy applawddis
Bot ȝit eildit rubiatouris
([To], originally [That], crossed out [hat] and added the [o]) hant the laittis of lawdis
quhen thay begyn sic gawdis
To leif thay ar most laith
quhe[n] (quhill, struck through) thay haif gottin blawdis
wt venus bowtyne cleth
ȝe wantoun wowaris waggis
wt thame that hes the cunȝe
Ffor (hes, struck through) haif ane bismeir baggis
ȝe grunche not at hir grunȝe
(rycht, struck through) swa ladeis will not sounȝe
with waistit wowbattis rottin
bot prowdly thay will prounȝe
quhair geir is to be gottin
Quhair money may ȝow moif
I hald it aweryce
Thair is na constant lufe
bot co[m]moun m[er]chandyce
This ordour now is nyce
quhair lufe is sauld and coft
It is ane dowbill vyce
To bring þe devill on loft
The bich the curtyk fa[n]nis
The wolf the wilrone vsis
The mull frequentis þe a[n]nis
and hir awin kynd abusis
rycht swa þe meir refusis
the (ane, struck through) cursour for ane awer
awa few I fynd excusis
bot (saif, struck through) weme[n] quhilk will wauer
ȝit poyettis ([ffew] written over [nane]) decreitis
Saif ane hecht p[er]cifie
bot of ȝor sodomeitis
In rome and lumbardie
In aipillis (and, struck through) italie
To compt how ȝe converss
I vg for villanie
ȝour (^ with dot above, [vycis] in margin, [vsingis] struck through) to reherss
Quhair lechery belappis
all steidfast luve it stoppis
quhair hurdome ay vnhappis
wt quenry ca[n]is and coppis
ȝe pryd ȝow at þair proppis
Till hair and berd ([be] struck through, grow above) dapill
ȝe cowet all kyn croppis
as eua (þat, struck through) did þe apill
Thus ȝe haif all þe wyte
and thair mischief ȝe mak It
That suld haif wit p[er]fyte
and ([ressoun] struck through, [wisdome] written above) to abstrakit
Suld ladeis tha[n] be lakkit
Thot few of þame be gud
for all (^ with dot above, [dissait] in margin, [þ{er} evill] struck through) thay tak It
of ȝour awin flesch & blude
Wald ȝe foirse þe forme
The fassoun and þe fek
ȝe suld it fynd Inorme
wt bawdry ȝow to blek
Thairfoir (ȝe, struck through) fle fra suspek
or tha[n] sa mot I thryfe
ȝour natouris ȝe neglek
and wantis ȝour wittis fyve
Appardoun me of thiss
gif ocht be to displeiss ȝow
and quhair I mak a miss
my mynd salbe to meiss ȝow
Thir (^ with dot above, [ressonis] in the margin, [crymes] with [ressonis] written overtop) ar to raiss ȝow
fra crymes (and, struck through) vndir coite
or war (Thairfoir, struck through) ȝe say not waiss ȝow
quod allexander scote
q Scott

div.head: Heir endis the haill four pairtis offis of this ballat buke anno 1568
div.note: (Last two lines appear to be written over something else, which is illegible)

head.title: The prollog of the fourt buik of virgell Treting of the Inco[m]moditie of luve and Remeid þ[er]of co[m]pyld be bischop gawyne dowglas

lg.l: ([the poet dressis him first to venus and cupeid] in left margin) With bemes schene thow bricht cytherea
Quhilk only schaddowis among sterris lite
and thy blind wingit sone, cupido ȝe twa
Ffosterreris of birnyng carnall het delite
ȝour Ioly wo neidlingis most I endite
Begy[n]ni[n]g with ane fenȝeit faynt plesance
Continewith with lust and endis with pe[n]nance
In fragill flesche ȝour febill seid is saw
Rutit in delyte welth and fude delicate
Nureist with slewith and mony vnsemelie saw
Quhair schame is loist Thair spreidis ȝor burgeons hate
oft to revolue ane vnlefull consait
Rypis ȝour p[er]rellis fructis and vncorne
off wicket grane how sall gude schaif be schorne
([the hant of vnlesum luve] in left margin) Quhat is ȝour force bot febling of the strenth
ȝour curious thochtis quhat bot missery
ȝour fremmit glaidnes restis not ane houris lenth
ȝour sport for schame ȝe dar not specify
ȝour fruct is bot vnfructous fantessy
ȝour sory Ioyis bene bot Iangling and Iaipis
and ȝour trew serwandis silly godis aipis
([the co[m]modeteis of luve] in left margin) ȝour sweit mirthis ar mixt with bittirness
quhat is ȝour drery game and mery pane
ȝour werk vnthrift ȝour quiet is restles
ȝour lust lyking in langor to remane
freindschipis torment ȝour trest is bot ane trane
O luve quhidder art thow Ioy or fulichenes
That makis folk sa glaid of thair distres
Salomons wit sampsone thow rubest his forss
and dauid thow bereft his prophecy
([exampillis] in left margin) Men sayis thow brydlit aristotell as ane horss
and crelit vp the floure of poetry
Quhat sall I of thy michtis notify
fairweill quhair that thy lusty dart assails
([remeid] in left margin) Wit, strenth, riches, nathing bot grace availis
Thow chene of luve ha benedicite
How hard strenȝeis thy bandis every wicht
The god above for his hie maieste
with the ybound law in ane maid did licht
Thow vincust the strong gyand of grit micht
Thow art mair forcy than the deid so fell
Thow plenneist paradyce and thow herreit hell
Thow makis febill wicht and thow lawiss hie
Thow knyttis freindschip quhair thair be na parage
Thow Ionatha considderit to dauye
Thow danttit alexander for all his vassillage
Thow festnyt Iacob fourtene ȝeiris in boundage
Thow teichit hercules to go lerne and spyn
(and, struck through) Reik dianiyre his meis & lyoun skyn
([domage in luve] in left margin) Ffor luve narcissus perreist at the well
Ffor luve thow stervist most duchty achill
Theseus for luve his fallow socht to hell
The snaw quhyt dow oft to þe gray maik will
allace for luve, how mony thame self did spill
Thy fury luve, motheris tawcht for dispyte
fyle handis in blude of thair ȝung childryne lyte
O lord quhatt wryitis virgill of thy forss
In his georgikis, how thy vndantit micht
constrenis sumtyme so the stonyt horss
That by the sent of ane meir far of sicht
he braidis, Brayis a[n]non and takis the flicht
Na brydill may him dant nor bustous dynt
Nor bra, hie roche, nor (blar, struck through) braid fludis stynt
The busteous bullis oft for the ȝung ky
With horne to horne wirkis vþir mony wound
So rummessing wt mony low and cry
the feildis all doith of thair rowtting resound
The meik hairtis oft in belling ar found
mak ferss bargan, And ra[m]mis to gidder rin
bairis thair tuskis frettis on vþiris skin
([the story of lea[n]der and hero] struck through) The rewthfull smart and lamentable caice
Quhilk thair he wryttis of leander ȝing
Quhome for thy luve, hero, allace allaice
In fervent flamb of hait desyre birni[n]g
By nichtis tyd The hevy[n]nis lowid thundring
and all with storme trublit the seyis flude
Beittand on rolkis and rowttand as it war woud
Set he him not to swym ovir, welloaway
The firth betuix sestos and abidane
in ewrop, and asia, citeis tway
his fader and moder micht him not call agane
O god, quhair thair, he was tynt and slane
and quhen his luve saw this mischeif, attanis
owttour the wall scho lap and brak hir banis
Lo how venus can hir servandis acquite
Lo how hir passionis vnbryddills all thair wit
Lo how thay tyne thame self for schort delyt
Lo frome all grace to mischeif thay ar flit
Ffra weill (weill, struck through) to wo ffra pane to deid, and ȝit
thair bene bot fewe exampill takkis of vther
Bot wilfully fallis in the fyre leif brother
([to abstene frome wyne & lust veneriane] in left margin) With lust of wyne nor werkis veneriane
be nevir ouirsett myne awctor teichis so
stryfe and debait engenderis and feill hes slane
Thay febill the stre[n]th Reiveillis secreittis both two
honest proves, dreid, schame, and luck, ar gane
([quhat lust is] in left margin) quhair thay habound attempir thame for thy
childer to engender vse (ink mark) venus and not in vane
hant na surfet drink (not, struck through) bot quhen thow art dry
([to the me[n] luvaris] in left margin) Quhat is this luve nyce luvaris þat ȝe mene
or fals dissait ffair ladyis to begyle
Thame to defoule and schent ȝour self betuene
Is all ȝour lyking wt mony subtell wyle
Is that trew luve Gud faith and fame to fyle
([Quhat is lufe] in left margin) gif luve be vertew Than is it lefull thing gif it be vyce it is ȝour vndoing
Lust is no lufe Thocht leidis lyk it weile
This furious flamb of sensualite
ar nane amouris Bot fantesy ȝe feill
carnall plesance but sicht (but sicht, struck through) of honestie
haitis him self forsuth and luvis not the
([twa luvis] in left margin) Thair bene twa luvis, p[er]fyt & vnp[er]fyt
That ane lefull, That vþir fowll delyt
([diffinitioun of luf: naturall lufe:] in left margin) Luve is ane kyndly passioun engendrit of heit
kendlit in the hairt overspredand all the corss
and as thow seis sum p[er]sone waik in spreit
Sum hait birnyng as ane vnbridlit horss
Lyk as the patient hes hait of our grit forss
and in ȝung babbis warmenes insufficie[n]t
and in to aige it failȝeis and is owtuent
([luve Inordinat] in left margin) Richt so in luve thow may be excessive
Inordinatly luvand ony creature
Thy luve also it may be difective
To luve thyne awin geving of vþ[er]is no cure
Bot quhair that luve is rewlit by mesure
It may be licknit to ane haill ma[n] estait
Intemperat warmeness noþir to cald nor hait
Than is thy luve Inordenat say I
Quhen ony createur mair than god thow luvis
or ȝit lufis ony to that fyne quhairby
Thy self or thame thow frawartis god remvffis
Ffor till attempir thyne amouris the behuffis
Luve every wicht for god and to gude end
thame be na wayis to harme bot to amend
That is to knaw, luve god for his gudnes
with hairt, haill mynd, Trew seruice (nicht and, struck through) day & nicht
nixt lufe thy self eschewand wicketnes
Luve syne thy nytboris and wirk thame na vnricht
willing þat thow and thay may haif the sicht
of hevinis bliss and tyst thame not þ[er]fra
for and thow do Sic luf dow not a stra
Ffaynt luve but grace for all thy fenȝeit layis
thy wantoun wylis ar verry vanitie
graceles thow askis grace and thus thow prayis
haive m[er]cy lady haif rewth and sum petie
and scho rewthles agane rewis on the
heir is na p[ar]ramouris found bot all hatrent
quhair nowþir to weill nor wa tak thay tent
Callis thow that rewith quhilk of thair self na rakkis
or is it grace To fall fra grace na nay
Thow seikis m[er]cy and þairof mischefe makkis
Renoun and honour quhy wald thow dryve away
a brutale appetyte makis ȝung fulis forvay
quhilk be ressone list not thair heit refrane
haldand opinioun deir of a borit bene
Sayis not ȝour sentence thus skant of a fass
quhat honestie or renoun is to be dram
or for to drowp lyk a fordullit ass
Latt ws in ryott leif in sport and gam
In venus court sen born þairto I am
my tyme weill sall spent, wenis thow not so
Bot all ȝor sollace sall returne in gram
Sic thewilles lustis in bittir pane & wo
([aganis ald lichery] in left margin) Thow awld hasard lechour fy for schame
That slotteris furth evirmair in slugardry
Owt on the awld trat aigit wyf or dame
Eschamis na tyme in rowst of syn to ly
Thir venus warkis in ȝowtheid ar foly
Bot in to eild thay turne in fury rage
and quha schameles dowbillis thair syn ha fy
as (th, struck through) dois thir vantouris oþir in ȝowth or age
Quhat neidis avant ȝow of ȝour wicketnes
ȝe þat delytis allane in villanis deid
Quhy gloir ȝe in ȝour awin vnthriftines
Eschame ȝe not reherss and blaw on breid
ȝour awin defame havand of god na dreid
na ȝit of hell Provokand vþiris to syn
ȝe that list of ȝour palȝerdie nevir blin
Wald god ȝe purchest bot ȝour awin mischance
and war na banarreris for to perriss mo
god grant sumtyme ȝe turne ȝow to pennance
Refrenyng lustis Inordinat and cry ho
and thair affix ȝor lufe and mynd also
quhair evir is verry Ioy wtowttin offens
þat all sic beistly fury ȝe lat go hens
([aganis makrellis] in left margin) Off brokkaris and sic bawdry how sowld I wryt
of quhome the filth stynkis in godis neiss
with venus he[n]wyffis quhat wayis may I flyt
That straikis thir wenchis heidis thame to pleiss
Dochtir for thy luve this ma[n] hes grit diseiss
quod the bismeir wt hir sleikit speiche
Rew on him it is mirreit his pane to meiss
Sic poid makcrellis for lucifer bene leiche
([To virginis] in left margin) Eschame ȝung virgynis and fair damecellis
furth of wedlok for to disteyne ȝour kellis
Trest not all tailis that wantoun wowaris tellis
ȝow to defloir purposing nothing ellis
abhor sic pryce or prayer qlk wirschep sellis
quhair schame is lost quyt schent is woma[n]heid
Quhat of bewtie quhair honestie lyis deid
Rew on ȝour self ladyis and madynis ȝing
grant na sic rewith for evir ma causs ȝow rew
ȝe fresche gallandis in hait desyre birni[n]g
refrene ȝour curage sic paramouris to p[er]sew
Ground ȝour amouris on cheretie all new
found ȝow on ressoun quhat neidis moir to preiche
god grant ȝow grace in lufe as I ȝow teiche
Ffy on dissait and fals dissimulance
Contrar to kynd with fenȝeit cheir smyling
vndir the cloke of luvis observance
The vennoum of the serpent reddy to sting
Bot all sic crymes in luvis causs I resing
To the confessioun of morall Iohine gower
for I mon follow the text of our mater
Thy dowble wound dido to specify
I mene thyne amouris and thyne funerall fait
Quha may endyt but teiris wt ene dry
Agustyne confessis him self wepit god wait
Reding thy lamentable end misfortunat
by the will I repeit this verss agane
Temporall Ioy endis with wo and pane
Allace thy dolorus caice and hard mischance
frome bliss to wo frome sorrow to fury rage
fra nobilnes, welth, prudence, and temperance
In brutall appetyt fell in wyld dotage
dantar of affrik quene foundar of cartage
vmquhile in riches and schynnyng gloir ringing
Throw fuliche lust wrocht thyne awin vndoing
Lo with quhat thocht bittirnes and pane
luve vnsilly breidis every wicht
how schort quhyle dois his schort plesance remane
his restles bliss how sone takis the flicht
his kyndnes alteris in wreth wtin ane nicht
Quhat is bot torme[n]t all his langsum fair
Begun with feir and endit in dispair
Quhat sussy, ceur, and strange ymageni[n]g
Quhat wayis vnlefull his purpois to attene
hes this fals lust, at his first begynnyng
how subteill wylis and mony quiet mene
Quhat slicht dissait, quently to flat and fene
Syne in ane thraw can not him selfin hyd
nor at his first estait no quhyle abyd
O (lust, struck through) Thow swelth devorar of tyme vnrecoverable
o lust Infernall furnes Inextinguibill
Thy self co[n]sumyng worthis insaciabill
Quent feindis net to god & ma[n] odibill
of thy triggittis Quhat tung may tell the tribill
With the to wrestill Thow waxis evirmair wicht
Eschew thyne hant and my[n]neiss sall thy micht
se how blind luves Inordinat desyre
degraidis honour and ressone dois exyle
Dido of cartage floure and lamp of tyre
Quhais he renoun no strenth nor gift micht fyle
In hir faint lust So maid wtin schort quhyle
That honestie baith and gud fame war adew
Syne for desdene allace her selfin / slew
O quhat availit thy brute and glorius name
Thy nobill tressour and workis Infinyt
Thy citeis beilding and thy ryell fame
thy realmis (qu, struck through) co[n]quest weilfair & delyte
To stynt all thingis Saif thyne awin appetyte
So was in luve thy frawart destanye
allace the quhyle thow knew thre strange enee

div.head: Heir endis the ballatis of luve Remedy thairof and contempt of luve
